Victoria has a store where she sells food staples such as rice, sugar, and flour, as well as fruits and vegetables. In addition, Victoria own several fields where she grows peas and corn, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Victoria needs a loan of 1400 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy flour, noodles, apples, bananas, carrots, squash, and cleaning products.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Victoria plans to use their savings to make more capital available to her businesses. Her dream is to have a successful business, that her children will be professionals, and that she will have money in her old age.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 1400 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy flour, noodles, apples, bananas, carrots, squash, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo Q. is characterized as a very hard-working person with the desire to improve his ice cream selling business in the municipality of El Sauce in León. He's in this business because he feels it's his duty to improve the financial situation at home and meet the needs of his wife and children.

It's important to point out that this job requires much effort because bicycling around all day exposes one to sunlight and causes physical exhaustion. Despite this, Bernardo works without any difficulties knowing that this, his only source of income, is the only means he has to support his family.

Today, he turns to CEPRODEL in the hopes of receiving loanss that will allow him to buy the ingredients he needs to make sherbet and sell it in the municipality of El Sauce.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Bernardo Q. se caracteriza por ser una persona muy esforzada y con un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio de venta de sorbetes ambulante en el municipio de El Sauce en León. Se dedica a este negocio por el hecho de que tiene el deber de mejorar la condición económica de su hogar y suplir las necesidades de su esposa e hijos.

Es necesario destacar que este trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo por el hecho de que el trabajo ambulante provoca mucha exposición al sol y desgaste físico por movilizarse en la bicicleta todo el día. A pesar de esto, el señor Bernardo realiza su labor sin ninguna dificultad por estar consiente de que este es su único ingreso con el cual puede mantener a su familia.

Hoy en día acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan la compra de sus productos para elaborar los sorbetes y comercializarlos en todo el municipio de El Sauce.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Leila Marina

texts.es:
With a lot of hard work, Leila works as a housekeeper in the El Sauce district in León, Nicaragua, with her specialty being cleaning and ironing clothes. She does all this work to improve the quality of life for her children by means of rebuilding their home, which had been in a state of disrepair.

She currently needs to purchase building materials, and for this she turns to Kiva partner Ceprodel, who gave her a loan once for before for her to buy supplies to put up a wall in her home. Now she's requesting a loan to continue the construction and provide a quality roof over the heads of the children she loves.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Con mucho esfuerzo la señora Leila se dedica al trabajo de empleada domestica en el municipio de El Sauce en León sobresaliendo la actividad de lavado y planchado de ropa haciendo todo este trabajo para mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos por medio de la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación que por mucho tiempo ha estado en mal estado por ser una infraestructura muy deteriorada.

Actualmente necesita invertir en la compra de los materiales de construcción y para esto acude a Ceprodel quien en su primera vez le otorgó créditos para la compra de parte de los materiales para levantar un muro en su casa. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para continuar con la construcción y de esta manera poder brindarle un techo digno a sus hijos que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase building materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Marlon Javier

texts.es:
Marlon A. is originally from the city of León, Nicaragua, specifically from the El Sauce district where he is currently dedicated to transporting customers in his own rickshaw (a bicycle with spots for two passengers in the back).

His business consists of pedaling around the city streets looking for clients, whom he picks up and takes to where they want to go, always within the city limits. His wife and kids are proud to have such a hard working husband/father and love him very much and want the best for him.

Marlon has improved his business thanks to loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel, which have allowed him to invest in repairing his pedicab and also making improvements to give it a touch of elegance to provide his clients an excellent service.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Marlon A. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de León específicamente del municipio El Sauce donde se dedica al negocio de transportación de personas teniendo su propia tricicleta (bicicleta con espacio para dos personas en la parte delantera).

El negocio consiste en ambular por las calles del pueblo y al ser solicitado por los clientes, estos le proporcionan la dirección y el se encarga retrasladarlos hacia su lugar de destino siempre a lo interno del pueblo. Su esposa e hijos se sienten satisfechos de tener un padre tan trabajador es por esta razón que lo quieren mucho y anhelan lo mejora para él.

Marlon ha mejorado la situación del negocio debido a que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado por créditos que le han permitido invertir en su bicicleta reparándola y dándole un mejor toque de elegancia para brindar un excelente servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Improvements for rickshaw

loans.name: Liane

texts.en:
Liane O. is a single woman who lives in her mother’s house, which is where the business is operated. More specifically, Liane’s mother is a nurse, and they run a small pharmacy out of the home. Although the business has experienced a great deal of success, Liane would like to see it continue to grow.  

Liane is currently attending night school, so she works with her mother during the day.  Liane and her mother have used their dynamic business skills and intelligence to create a viable and profitable business.  The loan they are seeking would be used to purchase additional medicines, which should increase their profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase additional medicines.

loans.name: Pío Agustín

texts.es:
Pío G. is dedicated to selling groceries in his convenience store like oil, soap, detergents, brushes, shampoos, ect. in the El Sauce district of León. He has a humble family that looks to him for education, food and protection. His business started six years ago with $100 in start-up money he obtained with the help of his children.

Pío's biggest need is purchasing supplies for his convenience store and for this reason he has turned to Kiva partner Ceprodel for support (he has been a recipient of three loans so far) in investing in his business, which has allowed him to provide for his household.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Pio Gamez se dedica a vender productos de abarrotaría como aceite, jabón, pastes, detergentes, escobas, shampoo, etc.) en la ciudad de León en el municipio El Sauce de esta localidad. Posee una humilde familia que tiene el deber de educar y brindar protección y alimentación. Su negocio da inicio desde hace 6 años con una inversión de $100 (Cien dólares netos) que los obtuvo por medio del apoyo de sus hijos para que iniciara el negocio.

Una necesidad que atraviesa el señor Pio es que necesita invertir en la compra de los abarrotes y por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos (Actualmente 3 créditos a su favor) que los invierte directamente en su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell in store

loans.name: Sobeyda Francisca

texts.es:
Sobeyda is dedicated to selling frozen treats, traveling through all the city streets in her district to do it. Her business consists of purchasing ingredients, then making her treats to put up for sale. If anything from the loan is left over she plans to use it for maintenance on her bicycle, her means of transportation to move about the city to sell her products.

The primary need for Sobeyda currently is to buy ingredients to make and then sell her frozen treats. She has turned to Kiva partner Ceprodel for a loan in the past to purchase these products and also make repairs on her bicycle. She says she feels very satisfied with previous loans because they have helped increased her income and she has been able to provide for her children, helping her afford their studies and providing a strong roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La venta de sorbetes ambulante es el negocio a que se dedica la dama Sobeyda T. recorriendo todas las calles del municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León. Este negocio consiste en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar los sorbetes y una vez que cuenta con estos los procesa hasta alcanzar el producto terminado y luego comercializarlos. Además como si fuera poco también debe de invertir en el mantenimiento de su bicicleta que es la que hace posible que se movilice por todo el pueblo.

La necesidad atravesada hoy en día por la señora Sobeyda es la adquisición de la materia prima para elaborar estos deliciosos sorbetes y luego comercializarlos. Es de mucho necesidad destacar que Ceprodel le ha brindado apoyo por medio de créditos utilizados sabiamente en la compra de la materia prima y en el mantenimiento de su medio de transporte. Según comenta se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos porque han aumentado sus ingresos y ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar proporcionando que sus hijos tengan estudio y un techo digno donde descansar.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make frozen treats

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario and his wife, Juana Fernandez, are tailors. They began their tailoring business several years ago and it has steadily grown over the years. In fact, they started out with only one sewing machine and a small client base, but they now have three other employees with their own machines and have attracted a dedicated and loyal following of customers.

Little by little they grew their business to what it is now and they are currently seeking to increase the quality of their products to be sold. With the requested loan, Mario and Juana will buy more quality fabric and will be able to make a variety of clothing for their customers, which will increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and cloth, especially high-quality fabrics.

loans.name: Tania Isabel

texts.en:
Tania is 35 years old. She has been a member of the “Tulipanes” community bank for eight years. Tania joined the community bank because she did not have the necessary documents to get loans at other banks. In the community bank, she has learned how to save, how to manage her business more effectively, and how to treat customers.

Tania has a small store located in her house. She sells food staples, such as flour, sugar, and rice. In addition, Tania sells small toys and clothing. She started her business with her first loan from the community bank. Since then, her business has expanded and she has been able to buy her house.

Tania needs a loan of 2500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy school supplies in order to prepare for the upcoming school season.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Tania plans to use her savings to improve her business and to open another store that would focus on children’s clothing.

loans.use: Tania needs a loan of 2500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy school supplies in order to prepare for the upcoming school season.

loans.name: Elita Yanet's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth and Yanet have been members of the “Tulipanes” community bank for one and two years, respectively. In that time, they have learned how to manage money, how to save, and how to work out problems within their families.

Elizabeth is 25 years old. She has a business selling mainly jackets and shoes. Her family also sells clothing, and Elizabeth worked in their store for several years. She opened her own store three years ago.

Yanet is 22 years old. She lives with her partner and new baby. She also sells clothing and has had her own store for two years. In addition, she has a stand where she sells cell phones and cell phone accessories.

Elizabeth and Yanet each need loans of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying more clothing and shoes.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Elizabeth and Yanet plan to use their savings to add to their family's savings and increase their business together, and to take care of the baby. Their dreams are to have a large business and healthy family.

loans.use: Elizabeth and Yanet each need loans of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in more clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old. She is married and has five children ages fourteen and younger. Rosa has belonged to the “Chontaca” community bank for one year. In that time, she has learned how to work more efficiently. She also feels like she has support and enjoys attending meetings.

Rosa buys animals, such as pigs and sheep. She then butchers them and sells the meat from her home. Her dream is that her business will continue to grow and she will able to begin to sell clothing.

Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy school supplies to sell, to sell in addition to selling meat.

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 47 years old. She is married and has three children who are 22, 23, and 19 years old. Flora has been a member of the “Chontaca” community bank for one year. She likes the community bank because the process is less complicated than at other banks. Since joining the bank, she has learned to work efficiently and to save.

Flora owns a bakery where she makes a variety of traditional sweet breads. She has owned her bakery for six months, but has been making bread for much longer.

Flora needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy flour in bulk, as well as eggs, sugar, and yeast.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Flora plans to use has savings to further develop her business. Her dream is to eventually own a home and to open a second store.

loans.use: Flora needs a loan of 1500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy flour in bulk as well as eggs, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Ide Violeta

texts.es:
Ide L. is 34 years old and lives in Cuyuchugo hamlet, Usquil district in the Otuzco province of the department of La Libertad. She has 4 children that still depend on her. She has a 5th grade education.

Ever since before she was married, she did the housework and worked on the farm. After many years, she met her husband and they both began working in fruit sales. Today she travels weekly to Barrio Negro and Calamarca, both areas in the Julcán district, in the province of Otuzco.

Ide also prepares chuño de maíz (a popular dish in the La Libertad mountain range) and sells it in her neighborhood.

She's part of Banco Comunal "San Juan de Miraflores" and received her first loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1) which she used to buy a variety of fruits.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in full in 4 months, she'll buy a hundred oranges, limes and apples, as well as, ingredients to prepare chuño de maíz. Ide is an associate of the mother's club "Santísima Trinidad".

Her dream is to have means of transportation to transport her merchandise.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ide López tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el caserío de Cuyuchugo, distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 4 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Sólo estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria.

Desde antes de que se casara sólo se había dedicado a la chacra y a las obligaciones del hogar, después de mucho tiempo conoció a su esposo, juntos empezaron a trabajar en la venta de frutas. Actualmente viaja semanalmente por el caserío de Barrio Negro y Calamarca, lugares pertenecientes al distrito de Julcán, provincia de Otuzco.

La señora Ide también prepara chuño de maíz (plato popular en los lugares de la Serranía Liberteña) y lo vende por su caserío.

Ella integra el Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores ” en el que le dieron su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00,con este dinero compró una variedad de frutas.

Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00 que cancelará en 4 meses, comprará un ciento de naranjas, limas y manzanas; además comprará los ingredientes para preparar el chuño de maíz. La señora Ide es socia del club de madres “Santísima Trinidad ”.

Su mayor sueño es tener un medio de transporte para trasladar su mercadería.

loans.use: To buy a hundred oranges, limes and apples, as well as, ingredients to prepare chuño de maíz .

loans.name: Ganira

texts.en: Ganira V. is 58 years-old, married and has three children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. Ganira has been settled with her family in Beylagan since 1996. She and her family have a cattle-breeding business. She would like to purchase a calf and increase the number of her cattle. She needs a loan in the amount of $425.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.en:
Patrocinio is a tailor who makes shirts and, more recently, school uniforms. In addition, his wife is active in the business; they started out with only a small amount of capital to invest, yet they now operate their own shop.

Patrocinio is seeking a loan to buy the necessary amount of fabric to make additional school uniforms for the children in their part of the city because they are currently unable to meet their customers' demands. However, with an increase in the amount of fabric on hand in their shop, they will be able to increase their production and, thus, their income.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and fabrics to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro A. is married to Martina Britez, and they have two young children who are in elementary school. Pedro and Martina own a small convenience store where they sell everyday necessities, including food supplies. While Martina works at their store during the day, Pedro works as a bricklayer to supplement their income.

They started the business with the money they received when they sold their truck, and they have operated the business for 6 years. They are hard-working parents who do whatever they can to give their children the best life possible. They are seeking a loan to purchase additional merchandise for their store.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise (e.g., flour, sugar, and cleaning supplies) for his convenience/grocery store

loans.name: Pelagio

texts.en:
Pelagio and his wife run a small bakery, a business he inherited from his father. He has two children to support, both of whom are in college. Although his bakery is doing well, he needs a loan to increase his production and to enable him to set the prices of his goods at more competitive rates.

With the requested loan, he will buy more products in bulk to drive down the prices of his products. In this way, the loan would make his breads and baked goods less expensive and, accordingly, the demand for his goods should increase. It is important for Pelagio to secure this loan because it will help to insure that he can make the payments that are necessary for his children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Reina

texts.en: Reina G. is a 47-year-old mother who is married to Miguel Aquino. Reina and Miguel have four children who are all in elementary school. Reina and Miguel are traveling merchants who prepare foods (e.g., they bake empanadas and other Paraguayan delicacies) and sell them to their loyal and dedicated customers. Reina and Miguel work extremely hard to meet their family's needs and to constantly improve upon their standard of living; in fact, with their current income, the family is both strong and happy. They are seeking a loan to purchase additional bags, which will be used to store their food before they can sell the food to their customers. If their business continues to prosper, they would like to construct their own house.

loans.use: To buy bags for food storage

loans.name: Edelmira Teodora

texts.es:
Edelmira Teodora A. Castillo is 54 years old and has 6 children who depend on her.

Her business is buying men's and women's clothing which she then sells on Sundays in different hamlets.

She lives in the Cuyuchugo hamlet in the Usquíl district of Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad.

She's had an entrepreneurial spirit since she was 18 years old, offering a few products to her community. When she started, she made her income by selling fruits and vegetables and was able to save up her money.

Edelmira is part of Banco Comunal "San Juan de Miraflores" and received her first loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1) which she used to buy wholsesale clothing and fabrics to make aprons, skirts and tablecloths.

With the loan of 2500 soles, that she will repay in full in 4 months, she'll buy 20 meters of fabric and thread, as well as, shirts, sweaters and pants that she will sell later.

Her ideal would be to have a store in her home.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edelmira Teodora A. Castillo tiene 54 años de edad, estudió primaria completa. Tiene 6 hijos que aún dependen de ella. El negocio al que se dedica es la compra y venta de ropa para damas y caballeros los que vende los días sábados por los diferentes caseríos. Vive en el caserío de Cuyuchugo distrito de Usquíl, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Desde que tenia 18 años tuvo la idea de ofrecer algunos productos por su comunidad, empezó vendiendo frutas y verduras, las ganancias que obtenía las iba ahorrando, de esa manera hizo su propio capital. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” del cual recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, con este dinero compró ropa al por mayor y telas para confeccionar algunas prendas tales como: mandiles, faldas, y manteles. Con el préstamo de S/. 2500.00 que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará 20 metros de tela e hilos, asimismo comprará camisas, chompas y pantalones para posteriormente venderlos. La señora Edelmira fue fiscal del comedor de su caserío “Santísima Trinidad”, actualmente se mantiene como socia. Su ideal es poner una tienda en su vivienda.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and thread, as well as, shirts, sweaters and pants.

loans.name: Ermila

texts.es:
Ermila Rodríguez A. is 36 years old and has an elementary school education. She has 3 children who still depend on her. She lives in the Usquil district of the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad.

Every day at approximately 5 o'clock, Ermila makes fresh anticuchos (kebabs) or salchipollo (chicken dish) from her livestock. In addition to this business, she also raises small animals that she sells to different restaurants in the area.

Before having her own business, she worked on a farm and raised small animals. With much effort, she eventually bought herself equipment to make salchipollo and a small barbecue so she could start her business.

Through a relative, Ermila was introduced to and joined the Banco Comunal "Usquil" and received her first loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1); with this money, she bought 1st grade potatoes, a gallon of oil and discardable plates.

With the loan of 2000 soles, which she'll repay in full in 4 months, she'll buy 3 bags of potatoes, some chickens, and a part of the loan will go to constructing a floor in her house. Ermila's dream is to buy a parcel of land in the city of Trujillo.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ermila Rodríguez A. tiene 36 años de edad, estudió primaria completa. Tiene 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Todos los días, aproximadamente a las cinco de la tarde, la señora Ermila prepara anticuchos o salchipollo. Aparte de este negocio se dedica a la crianza de animales menores los cuales vende a diferentes restaurantes de su región también los sacrifica para prepararlos en su negocio. Antes de tener su propio negocio sólo se dedicó al trabajo en la chacra y crianza de animales. Con mucho esfuerzo compró una salchipollera y una pequeña parrilla los que utiliza en su trabajo. Por medio de un familiar pudo formar parte del Banco Comunal “Usquil”, del cual recibió un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, con este dinero compró papa de primera calidad, un galón de aceite y platos descartables. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará tres sacos de papa, una java de pollos y una parte de este dinero lo utilizará para hacer el piso de su vivienda. La señora Ermila tiene un sueño comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: To buy 3 bags of potatoes, some chickens, and a part of the loan will go to constructing a floor in her house.

loans.name: Alvin Alis

texts.es:
Alvin is a producer of basic grains, and cultivates rice and beans in the municipality of Concha, a department of Masaya, which is a productive high altitude town that draws on its favorable agro climatic conditions in order to harvest basic grains. Alvin has been doing this work for the past 15 years together with his family. His wife helps with the housework, while their 5 children work together with their father in the field harvesting the rice and bean seeds in order to obtain the right harvest and in this way be able to commercialize it. Since these are basic nutritious products in the Nicaraguan diet, there is a high demand for them.

At this time, Alvin needs to buy fertilizer for all of his crop since there is a constant risk throughout their production process.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase Green Fertilizer for Rice Fields

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
Julia Rosa A. O. is 56 years old. She has a grade 2 education. She has one daughter who is already out of the house.

She's been in commerce for 25 years. Apart from the buying and selling of men's and women's clothing, she has always sold fruit in the districts of Quiruvilca y Otuzco, and aslo sells food, soda and beer in her home. In addition, she makes aprons, skirts and slips which she sells to the women in her community and in other towns.

When Julia joined Banco Comunal "San Juan de Miraflores", she was given her first loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1) with which she bought a variety of fabrics to continue tailoring, as well as some sweaters, pants and outfits.

With the loan of 2000 soles, which she'll repay in 4 months, she'll travel to Lima to buy clothing such as sweaters, jackets, pants and other wholesale items of clothing.

Julia is the president of the "Asesguida" group that is in charge of the activities and celebrations of the region. She is also the vicepresident of the dining hall of the "Santísima Trinidad de Cuyuchugo".

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia Rosa A. O. tiene 56 años de edad, estudió sólo hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Tiene una hija quien ya no depende de ella. Hace 25 años que es comerciante. Desde siempre ha vendido frutas por los distritos de Quiruvilca y Otuzco, además vende en su casa comida, gaseosas y cerveza, aparte de la compra y venta de ropa para damas y caballeros. Asimismo confecciona mandiles, faldas y enagües los cuales ofrece y vende a las mujeres de su comunidad y por los diferentes caseríos. Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” en el que le dieron su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00,con este dinero compró una variedad de telas para seguir confeccionando, así mismo también compró un cuarto de chompas, pantalones y conjuntos. Con el préstamo de S/.2000.00 que cancelará en 4 meses viajará a Lima para comprar ropa, chompas, casacas, pantalones y otros al por mayor. La señora Julia es presidenta del cuartel “Asesguida” el cual se encarga de las actividades y celebraciones de su región, además es vicepresidenta del comedor “Santísima Trinidad de Cuyuchugo”. Su mayor sueño es poner un negocio en la ciudad de Lima con el fin de estar más cerca de su hija quien ahora radica allá.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, pants and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.en:
Maria V. contacted her friends and her neighbors, all of whom had independent businesses, and proposed the idea of working with Fundación Paraguaya. Together they meet every so often to work with a loan officer from Fundación Paraguaya and to discuss the successes and failures of their respective business ventures.

The women all have families to support and businesses (e.g., grocery stores, clothing businesses, cleaning businesses, and craft-making ventures) to run and are asking for help today. In short, they are seeking a loan to meet their businesses' needs and to expand their businesses. Collectively, they are stronger than they would be on their own and, as a result, their businesses have improved and grown since they endeavored to work with Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes, cleaning products, food, and other necessary goods

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.en: Ana is 50 years old and the proud mother of four sons and one daughter, all of whom are in their twenties.  Ana makes curtains and decorative window dressings, and sells these products to customers in her community.  Ana explains that maintaining cash flow is sometimes challenging, but she expects her new curtain patterns and styles will help to repay her loan, which would be used to buy additional fabrics for her curtains and window dressings.  Ana’s husband is disabled, so she hopes that the income generated from her business will allow her and her husband to enjoy their golden years.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for curtains and window furnishings

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
Julia Teresa Rodriguez is 54 years old and lives in the hamlet of Cuyuchugo in the Usquil district of the province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad. She didn't go to school as her parents couldn't afford it. She has 5 children who depend on her.

She's in the business of buying and selling small animals (hens, turkeys, guinea pigs and pigs). Apart from this, she also travels to Trujillo where she sells vegetables and fruit like rocoto (hot peppers), eggplant, lima beans, etc. In addition to this, she also works on the farm, where she grows corn and potatoes that she sells in small quantities.

Julia is part of the Banco Comunal "San Juan de Miraflores" and was given her first loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which she used to buy a variety of edible foul that helped grow her business.

With the loan of 2000 soles, which she will repay in full in 4 months, she'll buy hens, turkeys, guinea pigs, and fertilizer for her crop.

Julia's dream is to have a cart so she can transport her business to other parts of the Liberteña mountain range.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia Teresa R. L. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el caserío de Cuyuchugo perteneciente al distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad. No pudo estudiar debido a que sus padres no tuvieron las posibilidades necesarias para brindarle sus estudios. Tiene 5 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de animales menores (gallinas, pavos, cuyes y chanchos). Aparte de esto, ella viaja a Trujillo, donde negocia algunas verduras y frutas tales como: rocoto, berenjena, limas, etc. Por otro lado se dedica al trabajo en la chacra, en el cual siembra maíz y papa que también lo vende, pero en pocas cantidades. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” en el que le dieron su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, con este dinero compró una variedad de aves comestibles y así incrementó su negocio. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 que cancelará en 4 meses comprará gallinas, pavos y cuyes, asimismo comprará abono y fertilizante para la siembra . El sueño de la señora Julia es tener un carro para transportarse con su negocio por distintas partes de la sierra Liberteña.

loans.use: To buy hens, turkeys, guinea pigs, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucila Nemesia's Group

texts.en:
Eulalia, Lucila, and Maria have been members of the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank for ten years. In that time, they have found great support. They have also learned to be punctual, responsible, and to save.

Eulalia is 70 years old. She is married and has two adult children. Eulalia has a store where she sells food staples, such as rice, flour, and sugar. She has owned the store for several years.

Lucila is 51 years old. She is married and has two sons. Lucila owns a bakery where she makes traditional breads, such as “chapla,” which is similar to pita. She has owned her business for many years.

Maria is 49 years old. She is divorced and has two daughters. Maria owns a restaurant. She started a small café several years ago and, six months ago, opened a much larger restaurant.

Eulalia, Lucila, and Maria need loans of 600, 300, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses by buying flour, yeast, sugar, wheat, and by buying in bulk in order to reduce the effects of expected price increases.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Eulalia, Lucila, and Maria plan to use their savings to improve their homes and pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are to own a nice home, improve their businesses, and see their children become professionals.

loans.use: Eulalia, Lucila, and Maria need loans of 600, 300, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy flour, yeast, sugar, wheat, and to buy in bulk, in order to reduce the effects of expected price increases.

loans.name: Ruth Delania's Group

texts.en:
Ruth (pictured second from the left) is a 22-year-old newlywed and her husband is in the military. Ruth is opening her own salon to supplement the income that her husband earns in the military. Ruth spends her evenings and weekends studying at her local university, and she is very excited to start her own business. With this loan, Ruth would like to purchase a hair dryer and hair care (e.g., styling) products. In practice, Ruth plans to expand her hair care inventory and purchase only those products requested by her clients. Ruth hopes that the income generated from her beauty salon will allow her to complete her studies.

Ruth is the leader of her loan group, which includes Santa, Ana, Nancy, and Fior. All of the women in the group are hereby applying for their first loans and each one is a new entrepreneur with enormous hope for the future.

loans.use: To make early investments in new businesses (e.g., to purchase a hair dryer and hair care products for a beauty salon)

loans.name: Emilia's Group

texts.en:
Emilia, Lea, and Elizabeth are members of the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank. They have belonged to the bank for 10 years, 2 years, and eight months, respectively. In that time, they have learned not to depend on their husbands, to help each other, and to save.

Emilia is 48 years old. She is married and has two sons. Emilia sells set breakfasts in the morning and roasted chicken in the afternoon. She also takes borders into her home. In addition, Emily sells cosmetics from a catalogue.

Lea is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. Lea sells groceries, such as rice, flour, and sugar, from a stand in the central market of the small town of Huanta. She has had her stand for the past three years. In addition, Lea sells candies in the high school cafeteria during the school season.

Elizabeth is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. Elizabeth raises animals, such as sheep. In addition, Elizabeth has a job as a housekeeper.

Emilia, Lea, and Elizabeth need loans of 300, 600, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to invest in rice, sugar, pasta, oil, lentils, peas, and meat.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Emilia, Lea, and Elizabeth plan to use their savings to buy land, build a home, and to pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are that they will have successful businesses and that their children will be happy and, eventually, be professionals.

loans.use: Emilia, Lea, and Elizabeth need loans of 300, 600, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy rice, sugar, pasta, oil, lentils, peas, and meat.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria Rosas S. D. R. is 58 years old. She doesn't know how to read or write because she didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She has 6 children, one of which still depends on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco in the province of La Libertad.

She's in the business of buying and selling small animals like guinea pigs, hens, rabbits and pigs. As well as, the buying and selling of cereals such as wheat and hops. She travels to the hamlet of Monchacap in the Usquil district of the province of Otuzco, where she sells her animals and cereals.

Before starting her business, she used to plant grain at her parents' farm. Then, she became independent by moving to Otuzco to start her own business.

Thanks to the invitation of a relative, she was able to join the Banco Comunal "Las Lomas" where she was given her first loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which she used to buy anmimals.

With the loan of 1000 soles which she will repay in full in 4 months, she'll buy 3 bags of hops, 4 bags of wheat and several animals.

Maria Rosa's plan for the future is to start up a little store in her house.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Rosas S. D. R. tiene 58 años D. edad, no sabe leer ni escribir debido a que no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar. Tiene 6 hijos pero sólo uno depenD. D. ella. Vive en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento D. La Libertad. Su negocio es la compra y venta D. animales menores tales como: cuyes, gallinas, conejos y chanchos. Así mismo se dedica a la compra y venta D. cereales como trigo y cebada. Viaja al caserío D. Monchacap, perteneciente al distrito D. Usquil, provincia D. Otuzco lugar donD. venD. sus animales y cereales. Antes D. empezar con su negocio se dedicaba a sembrar granos en la chacra D. sus padres posteriormente se independizo para radicar en Otuzco y allí empezar un negocio propio. Gracias a la invitación D. un familiar pudo integrar el Banco Comunal “Las Lomas” en donD. le dieron un primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 con el cual compró animales. Con el préstamo D. s/. 1000.00 que cancelará en 4 meses comprará 3 sacos D. cebada, 4 D. trigo y varios animales La señora Maria Rosa se ha proyectado en un futuro emprender una bodega en su vivienda.

loans.use: To buy 3 bags of hops, 4 bags of wheat and several animals.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es:
Mrs. María Vilma O. A. is a member of the Communal Bank of “San Juan de Miraflores,” a bank formed in the township of Cuyuchugo in the district of Usquil of the Otuzco province of the state of La Libertad. Ever since her marriage she and her husband have sold pork and mutton to the restaurants of Usquil, Otuzco, Julcan and other cities.

With her first loan of S/. 300.00 ($100.00) Maria purchased chickens. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 ($350.00), which will be repaid if four months, Maria will purchase a lamb, a pig, and a few chickens.

Maria Vilma is 44 years old and has 3 children. Despite the fact that she only completed 5th grade she has been able to succeed for her children. She is very proud to be able to assist her husband and to contribute to the economic maintenance of the home.

Maria’s great dream is to own a store in Otuzco in which she could sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Vilma O. A. es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” formado en el caserío de Cuyuchugo, en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad.

El negocio al que se ha dedicado siempre desde que se unió con su cónyuge es la venta de carne de chancho y carnero la que distribuye por los restaurantes de Usquil, Otuzco, Julcán y otros.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró animales tales como, gallinas y pollos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses comprará un carnero, un chancho y una java de pollos.

La señora Maria Vilma tiene 44 años y 3 hijos. A pesar que solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y se siente muy satisfecha de apoyar a su esposo y aportar a la economía del hogar.

Su mayor sueño es tener un puesto en Otuzco en donde pueda ofrecer su mercadería

loans.use: Purchase of a lamb, a pig, and a few chickens.

loans.name: Jose Armengol

texts.es:
Jose is 35 years old and lives in the dragon fruit producing rural mountain community of San Caralampio. Jose has produced dragon fruit for ten years. He cultivates the land with a plow, organizing it into rows and path ways. He carefully cares for it, eliminating pests and sicknesses which so often affect the ground and damage the crop.

The production of dragon fruit is a very expensive process due to the necessity of many fertilizing chemicals. Jose’s experience in the working the land has provided him with the knowledge of the entire production process, even up to the final marketing of the fruit. It is with this knowledge that Jose also decided to begin producing a small amount of pineapple as well. He sells his crops at the various nearby community markets.

Since Jose’s wife is the individual who helps him to sell their crop, Jose needs to prepare his land in order to get his crop of dragon fruit out to the market. It is in this business that Jose Armengol has managed to better his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El señor José tiene 35 años de edad, habita en la comunidad de San Caralampio, zona rural, montañosa, propicia para el cultivo de pitahaya. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años. Prepara el terreno con las labores de arado, rastra, delineado y hoyado, cuida de la maleza y elimina plagas y enfermedades que suelen afectar el suelo y dañar la cosecha. El proceso productivo de la pitahaya es muy costoso, ya que se requiere de comprar muchos insumos químicos necesarios para fertilizar el suelo. El tiempo de trabajar en las tierras le ha permitido conocer todo el proceso de preparación hasta comercialización del fruto, es así que también se dedica a producir piña en menor cantidad. Su cosecha la ofrece a los diferentes mercados de las comunidades cercanas. Don José necesita preparar la tierra para sacar al mercado la cosecha de pitahaya que esta por reproducir, ya que su esposa es la que le ayuda a ofrecerla en los mercados. Es con esta actividad como Don José Armengol ha sacado adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of large grained sand, fertilizer and disinfectant chemicals.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano is 56 years old and has worked in agriculture for more than 35 years. He has several plots of land where he grows oranges, pineapples, plantains and coffee. He works all day in the fields taking care of his crops, fertilizing the land and spraying insecticides. When the pineapple harvest is ready, or the coffee, Emiliano hires people to help so he can get his products to the markets of Ticuantepe and Managua. Emiliano needs to purchase specific materials in order to maintain his crops for a successful pineapple harvest in May.

Don Emiliano, tiene 56 años, es un agricultor de más de 35 años de experiencia en trabajos agrícolas, posee unas manzanas de tierra en donde tiene productos como naranjas, mandarinas, piñas, plátanos y café. Todo el día trabaja en el campo cuidando y dándole mantenimiento a los cultivos, él mismo se encarga de fertilizar la tierra, abonarla y rociar insecticidas que puedan dañar el cultivo. Cuando está por salir la cosecha de piña así como los granos de café, el señor contrata personas que le ayuden a agilizar todo el proceso de cosecha y de esta manera logra comercializar sus productos en los mercados de Ticuantepe y Managua. El señor necesita comprar ciertos insumos para el mantenimiento del cultivo de piña, temporada de cosecha que sale en mayo.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FERTILIZERS AND INSECTICIDES FOR HIS CROPS.

loans.name: José Omar

texts.es:
Jose is 31 years old and lives with his family in the community of San Caralampio, a rural zone where they grow primarily pineapple, vegetables and citrus fruits. Jose has been cultivating pineapple for 5 years, perfecting the production process and harvesting a high quality product to sell. This has been possible because of the work he does after every harvest to make each process productive. The next pineapple harvest is for May, and Jose needs to purchase fertilizer and other materials for the production process to once again have a successful harvest.

José tiene 31 años, habita con su familia en la comunidad San Caralampio, zona rural en donde se dedican a producir mayormente piña, hortalizas y cítricos, debido a las características propias de la zona permite los productos se asientan de manera positiva. El señor tiene plantaciones de piña, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y se ha ido perfeccionando en todo el proceso de producción, permitiéndole cosechar un producto de buena calidad, para su debida comercialización. Esto ha sido posible debido al mantenimiento post cosecha y al seguimiento que le da a cada proceso productivo. La próxima cosecha de piña es para el mes de mayo, el señor necesita comprar fertilizantes, abonos, urea y carburo, con el fin de tener un buen producto.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FERTILIZER AND OTHER MATERIALS NEEDED TO HAVE A SUCCESS PINEAPPLE HARVEST IN MAY.

loans.name: Elda E.

texts.es:
Elda Guzman D. G. is 72 years old. She was only able to study up until second graD.. She lives in Cuyuchugo, in the Usquil province of Peru and has three children who are no longer dependent on her

Elda works selling clothing and items for the home such as plates, cups and silverware. She travels to Barro Negro where there is a market every weekend. From the time she was young, she worked raising and selling small animals in her neighborhood. Little by little, with the savings, she had the idea to begin selling clothing and itmes for the house. Her business has slowly grown.

Thanks to an invitation from her neighbors Elda became a part of the Communal bank San Juan D. Miraflores. With her first loan she invested in more animals such as guinea pigs and hens, which she raised, cared for and then sold. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more plates and cups and utensils to sell. Her dream is to one day have a small restaurant in her own house.

La señora Elda E. G. D. García tiene 72 años D. edad, estudió sólo hasta el segundo grado D. primaria. Tiene 3 hijos que ya no dependen D. ella. Vive en el caserío D. Cuyuchugo, provincia D. Usquil departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. ropa además D. yanques, sandalias y utensilios para el hogar tales como: platos, cucharas, tazas, sartenes, etc. Viaja al caserío D. Barro Negro en donD. hay negocio todos los fines D. semana, este lugar está ubicado en la provincia D. Julcán departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. DesD. que era joven se dedicaba a crianza y venta D. animales menores en su comunidad, poco a poco con sus ganancias tuvo la idea D. vender ropa, lentamente ha ido incrementando su mercadería y la ha variado conforme era necesario para vender sus productos. Gracias a la invitación que recibió D. sus vecinas ella integra el Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Miraflores” en su primer préstamo recibió S/. 300.00, el cual lo invirtió en comprar animales menores tales como: Cuyes y gallinas los que cría, cuida y posteriormente venD.. Con el préstamo D. S/.800.00, el cual pagara en 4 meses comprará una docena D. platos, cucharas, tazas, cucharones y ollas. La señora Elda sueña con poner una bodega en su casa.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PLATES, CUPS, UTENSILS AND OTHER ITEMS TO SELL.

loans.name: Santos Gerardo

texts.es:
Don Santos is 38 years of age and lives with his family in San Caralampio. He is dedicated to agriculture, having 20 years of experience at this activity. He has sown coffee, chayote and banana; products in high demand since they are part of the diet of the Nicaraguans. A part of his crop is destined for personal use and the majority he sells in the different markets of Managua and Ticuantepe. The income that he generates with this activity vary, depending on the season in which the product is harvested. That is why his wife supports him in paying the household expenses. She is dedicated to the sale of food products. The economic situation of the country has affected the acquisition of the supplies for productive work. The costs of fertilizers, supplements and insecticides have been increased to the point where he needs a loan to be able to buy them. They fear to lose the crop that they possess at this time, due to the lack of these supplies.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Santos tiene 38 años de edad, habita con su familia en San Caralampio, se dedica a la agricultura, posee 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, tiene sembrado café, chayote y plátano; productos bien demandados, ya que son parte de la alimentación de los nicaragüenses, una parte se destina para el autoconsumo y la mayoría la comercializa en los diferentes mercados de Managua y Ticuantepe. Los ingresos que genera esta actividad varían, depende de la temporada en que el producto se coseche, es por eso que la esposa lo apoya en los gastos de la casa, se dedica al comercio de productos alimenticios. La situación económica del país, ha afectado la adquisición de los insumos de trabajo productivos, ya que los costos de fertilizantes, abonos e insecticidas se han incrementado, por lo cual necesita de un préstamo para poder comprarlos, ya que temen perder la cosecha que poseen en estos momentos, debido a la falta de estos insumos.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, supplements and insecticides.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina is 66 years old and lives in the district of Usquil in La Libertad, Peru. She has 5 children, none of whom are still at home or dependent on her. She was only able to study until the third grade because her parents were not able to pay for a complete education.

For a long time, she worked buying and selling animals. Little by little she saved enough money to buy her house, where she set up a restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner to her customers. Her main customers are the people who live in her area, as well as others who come from farther away. To get to where she is today, Guillermina had to go through some difficult times, including a collapse of part of her house. Although she lost a lot, she still kept going, rebuilding with a great deal of effort and work.

She is part of the communal bank called Usquil, which granted her first loan to help her build her business after the damage to her house. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy supplies for her restaurant, including cases of sodas, bags of rice and other ingredients needed to prepare her meals.

La señora Guillermina tiene 66 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Usquil provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Tiene cinco hijos, ninguno depende de ella. Estudió solo hasta el tercer grado de primaria debido a que sus padres no tuvieron mayores posibilidades para brindarle su educación completa. Durante mucho tiempo se dedicó a la compra y venta de animales menores, poco a poco con las ganancias que obtenía, iba ahorrando para comprar su casa. Ahí instaló su restaurante que actualmente lo mantiene, prepara desayunos, almuerzo y cena. Sus principales consumidores son los pobladores de la zona y también vienen de otros lugares. Para llegar a las condiciones en que ahora se encuentra, ha tenido que pasar desagradables momentos. En una oportunidad una parte de su casa se derrumbó, tuvo muchas pérdidas materiales, pero aún así ella siguió adelante y reconstruyó su casa con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. La señora Guillermina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Usquil” el cual le dio su primer crédito de S/.300.00, este dinero le fue de gran ayuda para implementar su negocio ya que había sufrido daños a causa del derrumbe. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00, el cual pagara en 4 meses comprará: 10 cajas de gaseosas entre grandes y pequeñas, 2 sacos de arroz y un huacho entero para cocinar. Su meta en el futuro es modernizar y ampliar su restaurante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SUPPLIES FOR HER RESTAURANT, INCLUDING CASES OF SODAS AND BAGS OF RICE.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana has been a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank for over twelve years. She enjoys the community bank, because it maD. it possible for her to borrow without collateral. She has also learned about responsibility, punctuality, solidarity, and to save.

Juana is 55 years old. She is a widow and has five children. Juana owns a butcher shop. She sells pork, bacon, and lamb. Juana started this business with her first loan from the community bank.

Juana each needs a loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy rice sugar, flour, oil, and animals.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Juana plans to use her savings to put a roof on her homes, make general improvements, and buy new furniture. She dreams that her children will finish school and become professionals.

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 300 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy rice sugar, flour, oil, and animals.

loans.name: Ines' Group

texts.en:
Ines and Elsa are members of the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank . They have been members for five and two years respectively. In their community bank, they have learned to save, manage their businesses efficiently, and to be punctual and responsible.

Ines is 48 years old. She is married and has five children, three of whom live with her. Ines sells vegetables from a cart located on one of the main corners of Huanta. She has been in this line of business for several years.

Elsa is 50 years old. She is single and has two children who live with her. Elsa sells a variety of fruits grown in the region of Ayacucho. These include peaches, avocados, and tuna, which is a type of cactus fruit. She buys her fruit from local farmers and then transports it to the market.

Ines and Elsa need loans of 600 and 750 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, soap, eggs, detergent, milk, celery, carrots, and avocado.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Ines and Elsa feel secure having savings they can use in the case of an emergency. Their dreams are to have a large business, own a home, have good health, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Ines and Elsa need loans of 600 and 750 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, soap, eggs, detergent, milk, celery, carrots, and avocado.

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Santos is 33 years of age. Since he was very young his father taught him to work in the country, where together they produced pineapple of the variety “Monte Lirio”. This constitutes the economic base of the settlers of Ticuantepe, due to the characteristic botany of the zone. For ten years he has been dedicated to the production of pineapple as his main economic activity, as well as to the plantations of banana and coffee. This activity has permitted his family to move forward. His wife is a housewife. At present the cultivation of pineapple presents certain difficulties. The crop that he is producing is of a low quality, due to the fact that the land needs chemical fertilizers to improve the performance of the soil. The condition of the soil is the most important element in the whole process of production. It consists of preparing the land with supplements that permit the plants to sprout and bear fruit. Thus a quality product will be obtained.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Santos, tiene 33 años de edad, desde muy joven su padre le enseño a trabajar en el campo, en donde juntos producían piña de variedad “Monte Lirio”, éste constituye la base de la economía de los pobladores de Ticuantepe, debido a las características botánicas de la zona. Hace 10 años, se dedica a la producción de piña como su principal actividad económica, así como también a las plantaciones de plátano y café. Esta actividad le han permitido sacar adelante a su familia, su esposa es ama de casa. Actualmente el cultivo de piña presenta ciertas dificultades, se esta produciendo con una baja calidad, debido a que la tierra necesita de fertilizantes químicos que mejore el rendimiento del suelo. El cuido del suelo es el elemento más relevante en todo el proceso de producción, consiste en preparar la tierra con abonos que permitan que el fruto retoñe y de los frutos esperados, y así se obtendrá un producto con calidad.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers to maintain the condition of the soil.

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
José has 20 years of experience in producing pineapple and pitahaya (a yellow-skinned fruit) in his community, which has a favorable climate and where the cultivation of these fruits is an established tradition. He works the fields with the support of their 4 children, who are also dedicated to the production. This family has been perfecting and modernizing their production processes. The maintenance of the land has a high cost, due to the attention that must be given to the plants in each phase of the productive process: manually weeding, using organic fertilizer and natural supplements for the control of diseases. These give better yields to their crops, since they prevent the soil from deteriorating so much, provide better conditions for cultivation at planting time and improve the quality of the crop, increasing its value since organic products currently obtain better prices in the market. José requests a loan for the purchase of supplies for his work, since the planting season is from May to July.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don José tiene 20 años de experiencia en producir piña y pitahaya en su comunidad, ésta presenta un clima favorable, en el que los cultivos se producen de manera asentada. El señor trabaja en las manzanas de tierra junto con el apoyo de sus 4 hijos, quienes también se dedican a trabajar en la producción.

Esta familia se han perfeccionado en todo el proceso productivo así como también se han ido tecnificando en la actividad, el mantenimiento de las tierras tiene un alto costo, debidos a los productos que necesitan en cada etapa del proceso productivo como son el deshierbe manual o control natural de plagas y el uso de abonos orgánicos, el cual les brinda mejores rendimientos en su cultivo, ya que contribuye a que el suelo no se deteriore tanto, brindando mejores condiciones al cultivo en siembra y una cosecha de mayor calidad, con valor agregado por ser un producto orgánico que en la actualidad obtienen mejores precios en el mercado. El señor solicita un préstamo para la compra de los insumos de trabajo, ya que la época de cosecha esta entre mayo a julio.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and natural supplements to improve the yield and quality of his crop

loans.name: Dayra

texts.es:
Ms. Dayra is single woman. She lives in the Memorial Sandino settlement , a very poor semi-rural sector where there is a shortage of drinking water and the streets are not paved. For six years she has worked as a cook for the Nicaraguan army. Every day she works from 7:00 AM. to 6:00 PM. She has obtained some financing which has allowed her to improve her dwelling. Although the structure is made of cement blocks and the floor is tiled, the roof is damaged and needs to be changed. At this time the dwelling does not have iron gates that could secure the house. She leaves for work very early and returns late at night, leaving the house empty most of the time. She fears that delinquents will damage the house. That is why she requests a loan with which she can fix the roof of her house and buy an iron gate for the door of her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dayra es soltera, habita en el asentamiento Memorial Sandino, sector muy pobre, semi rural, existe escasez de agua potable, las calles no están pavimentadas. Hace 6 años la señora se desempeña de cocinera en el ejército de Nicaragua, todos los días trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. Ha conseguido ciertos financiamientos los cuales le han permitido mejorar su vivienda, aun siendo de bloques la estructura, el piso es embaldosado, el techo esta dañado y requiere cambiarse. En estos momentos la vivienda no cuenta con verjas que aseguren la casa, sale a trabajar desde muy temprano y llega noche, la casa casi siempre está sola y teme por la delincuencia, es por eso que solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda cambiar el techo de su casa y comprar la verja para la puerta de su vivienda.

loans.use: To buy perlines (metal supports), cement, zinc and iron gates

loans.name: Emeldina

texts.es:
Emeldina is 33 years of age, a single woman and has been working for 10 years selling natural medicines. The business is in her home, where she offers curative medicines in the form of tablets, tea, powders, creams to treat the body, or medicinal plants that alleviate inconveniences and cure common illnesses such as problems of the skin, acne, rheumatisms, and constipation, among others. The great majority of her clients have a lot of confidence in natural medicines. Besides that, they are easy and economic medicines to find. . At the same time Emeldina delivers merchandise such as clothes and shoes to people that trust her. In this manner she has been able to do well and to maintain a healthy business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Emeldina tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de medicamentos naturales, el negocio lo tiene en su vivienda, en la cual ofrece medicamentos curativos, ya sea en pastillas, te, polvo, cremas para sobar el cuerpo, o plantas medicinales que alivian molestias y curan enfermedades comunes como problemas de la piel, acne, reumas, estreñimientos entre otras. La gran mayoría de sus clientas tienen mucha confianza a los medicamentos naturales, además que son medicinas económicas y fáciles de encontrar. . Al mismo tiempo Emeldina entrega mercadería varias como ropa y zapatos a personas que le encargan, de esta manera es como ha podido salir adelante y mantener activo su negocio.

loans.use: To buy natural medicines, clothes, and shoes for ladies.

loans.name: Leopoldita

texts.en: Leopoldita is a young and promising entrepreneur yet she struggles to earn sufficient income in order to live comfortably.  She began selling women’s clothing last year, shortly after finishing secondary school, in order to set aside money to pay for her university studies.  Leopoldita feels that education is priceless because it is the only thing that will allow poor people, like herself, to make something of themselves in the future. She hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she can achieve her goals and be a part of an educated society. With this loan, she would like to buy additional clothing in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to improve upon her small business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 54-year-old, hard-working entrepreneur who lives in the Santana community of San Cristobal.  Gladys lost her husband a long time ago and, since then, she has operated a small business in order to earn a living.  On a daily basis, many customers, most of whom are men, visit her house for refreshments.  To illustrate, she serves alcoholic drinks (e.g., beer, whisky, and red and white wines), energizing beverages, and even natural juices at times.  In addition, Gladys prepares tasty pieces of toast for her customers.  Gladys explains that she receives monthly a pension from the government, but that such funds are insufficient to cover all of her expenses.  Therefore, Gladys is seeking a loan so that she can purchase wholesale drinks to replenish her store and to generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of beverages (e.g., beer, whisky and other alcoholic beverages) in bulk to replenish her small liquor store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To replenish her grocery store by purchasing additional goods.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.es:
Thanks to the first loan we received, we were able to buy the tools we needed, as well as offer good service to our customers. We are requesting a second loan in order to improve our auto repair shop and expand it a little more, thus allowing us to better serve our customers daily. We are requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to improve our auto repair shop business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Gracias por el primer crédito que pedimos comprar la herramienta que nos estaba haciendo falta y le podemos dar un buen servicio a los clientes. Estamos solicitando un segundo crédito para mejorar el taller y ampliarlo un poco más y así poder atender más de dos clientes por día. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para mejorar el negocio de taller de mecánica.

loans.use: Improve automotive repair shop

loans.name: Longuino

texts.es:
Thanks for the first loan. With your help, I was able to buy the woodworking machine I needed. With the loan I am currently requesting, I am going to buy the materials needed for carpentry, thus allowing me to finish the orders I have pending due to lack of lumber. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy carpentry materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Gracias por el primer crédito, con ustedes pude comprar la maquina que me estaba haciendo falta. En este otro crédito solicito un préstamo para la compra de materia prima y así terminar los pedidos que tengo pendientes por falta de madera. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de materia prima para la carpintería

loans.use: Purchase of carpentry materials

loans.name: Elvira's Group

texts.en:
Elvira is 23 years old, and she and her husband have seven children, all of whom attend school. Elvira is the coordinator of a group of five women (including her) that own and operate different businesses in the Santana community of San Cristobal. Elvira sells vegetables and ripe fruits in the community. She has been running her business for more than one year, and currently she is one of the most well-established suppliers of these goods in her area. The entrepreneur is seeking a loan to purchase additional goods in order to increase her sales volume.

The four other members of the group are: (1) Ana Lucia P., a 50-year-old mother of five children, who would like to purchase cloth in order to make curtains to sell in the community; (2) Santa Berta F. P., who would like to buy men’s clothing in bulk for her store; and (3) Juana Estela O. and (4) Elena Josefina L. O., who would like to use the loan proceeds to purchase women’s and children's clothing so that their respective businesses can sell such goods in the community.

Notably, the members of the group guarantee the other group members' loans; therefore, if one woman does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members of the group would assume that woman's loan obligations.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of products (e.g., vegetables, cloth, and clothing) in bulk for the group members' respective businesses.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Your support with the first loan helped me to move both my business and my family forward. My business has grown sufficiently thanks to God and to your support. The business space, however, needs some remodeling and a wider variety of products. I am requesting a loan of $700.00 USD in order to improve my business space and purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Por su apoyo en el primer crédito me ayudo mucho a sacar adelate el negocio y a mi familia. El negocio ha crecido lo suficiente gracias a Dios y a su apoyo. Al local le esta haciendo falta una remodelaciones y algo mas de variedad de productos. Solicito un préstamo de $700.00 Dlls. para acondicionar el negocio y la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and improvement of business space

loans.name: Raúl Rodolfo

texts.es:
Thank you for the first loan. With that loan, I was able to buy the tools I needed. I am currently requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy electrical goods to sell in my business, thus increasing my inventory and offering new electronics to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Gracias por el primer préstamo con el pode comprar las herramientas que me estaban haciendo falta. Ahora estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para compra de aparatos eléctricos para vender en el negocio y así tener más inventario y también ofrecerles este tipo de servicios a mis clientes de venta de los aparatos eléctricos nuevos.

loans.use: Purchase of electrical goods

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Mrs. Chheang S., 36, a widow with four children, sells oranges and mangoes in the market, normally earning $4 a day. Two of her daughters help her to sell the products and two others are students. She requests a loan of $500 from Kiva to purchase a motor bike to transport her produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang K., 50, is a mother of eight children who works as a farmer, making about $2 a day of profit. To supplement the household income, her husband, Mr. Chreo Chroeun, 53, also works as a farmer and earns $2 a day of profit. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a plot of land to farm in order to produce more income.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for farming in order to produce more income.

loans.name: Veng

texts.en: Mrs. Veng R., 38, is a mother of four children and works as a farmer in her rice field, typically earning $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Vong Saem, 40, works as a policeman and earns around $1.1 a day. Two of their daughters work in a garment factory, making a salary of $50 each a month; two others work in construction labor, normally earning around $56 a month. The family is hoping to increase its income by borrowing $700 through Kiva to start a business breeding pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to breed.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sulasmi

texts.id:
Villagers like Ni Nengah Sulasmi are mostly farmers. Since getting married to I Ketut Siandana, this mother of two earns living from her farm. Her husband works on the rice field, while Ni Komang Sulasmi farms cattle. She started from one breeder cow that she shared with another farmer. Now Ni Komang owns an infant cow that she wholly owns. Ni Komang Sulasmi eanrs decent income from cattle farming, besides from breeding cows that can be later sold, she can also use the cow to haul farming equipments. It is not expensive to take care of a cow, she collects grasses from nearby pastures for feed and water from nearby stream. Ni Komang Sulasmi currently plans to purchase one mature breeding cow with a loan from Dinari. She hopes ayear from now, the cow will produce a small cow, therefore increasing her income. She needed to improve her family's finances as tuition fees are increasing for her two children who are studying in primary school and junior high school.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Masyarakat yang tinggal di daerah pedesaan pada umumnya , menggantungkan perekonomiannya dari hasil bertani dan peternakan. Demikian juga halnya dengan Ni Nengah Sulasmi dan keluarga. Sejak menikah dengan I Ketut Siandana, Ibu dengan dua orang anak ini hidup dari hasil pertanian dan beternak sapi. Suaminya mengerjakan tanah pertanian , Ni Komang Sulasmi beternak sapi. Berawal dari memelihara seekor induk sapi milik orang dengan sistem bagi hasil , kini Ni Komang Sulasmi sudah mendapat satu ekor anak sapi yang sudah menjadi bagiannya. Memelihara sapi sangatlah menguntungkan bagi Ni Komang Sulasmi , karena disamping untuk di kembang biakan dengan harapan mendapat anak yang kemudian dipelihara atau dijual , tenaga sapi juga sering di manfaatkan untuk membajak tanah garapan petani. Sedangkan biaya yang di perlukan untuk memelihara sapi tidaklah banyak, cukup dengan modal tenaga untuk menyabit rumput yang tumbuh di sekitar kebun dan memberi minum di sungai terdekat. Ni Komang Sulasmi kini berencana membeli satu ekor induk Sapi yang sudah siap kawin ,dengan uang yang dipinjam dari Dinari dengan harapan satu tahun lagi sapi ini telah beranak sehingga dapat meringankan pekerjaan suaminya dan bisa menunjang perekonomian keluarganya, mengingat biaya kebutuhan sehari-harinya semakin banyak karena kedua orang anaknya yang sekarang duduk dibangku SD dan SMP juga memerlukan biaya yang semakin besar

loans.use: Purchase Breeder Cattle Cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun C., 37, is a vendor of grocery products making on average $30 of income. To contribute to the household income, her husband, Mr. Srive Sran, 42, owns a plot of farmland upon which he grows rice, normally earning $1.43 a day of profit. They have five children. This couple requests a loan of $1000 from Kiva to expand their business. Half of  the money will be used to buy more grocery products and the rest will finance house renovations.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and renovate the house.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Soli

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Soli, 39, is a hard working lady. She is married to Putu Tamanaya, a Cacao farmer. Ni Ketut Soli is very active in taking care of her family's cacao plantation. She applies fertilizer and harvest the cacao, while her husband usually does the insecticide. Cacao is a long term plant, as it only produces after it reaches 4 year of age. Depending on the quality and weather, cacao can produce year round. It usually needs fertilizing every trimester and insecticide spraying as needed. It is usually harvested once a week. Each kg of dried cacao can be sold for about $11 to $15. Ni Ketut Soli is very pleased with her current result. She plans to obtain a loan from Dinari to purchase more fertilizer and insecticide to increase the yield of her plantation. Ni Ketut Soli is very motivated in taking care of the plantation as she hopes to improve her family's financial situation.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Ketut Soli, 39 tahun, adalah wanita yang sangat ulet dan pekerja keras. Sebagai istri dari Putu Tamayana, seorang petani Kakao , Ni Ketut Soli sangat aktif dan berperan dalam mengelola kebun kakao keluarga ini. Dari pemupukan bahkan sampai pemetikan hasil panen dilakukan oleh ibu dua orang anak ini kecuali dalam penyemprotan hama biasanya dilakukan oleh suaminya. Kakau termasuk tanaman jangka panjang karena tanaman ini baru bisa berproduksi setelah berumur kurang lebih 4 tahunan. Baru setelah itu tanaman ini akan berbuah terus hampir sepanjang musim dan sangat tergantung dari cara pemeliharaannya, seperti pemupukan setiap 3 bulan sekali begitu juga dengan penyemprotan sesuai dengan kebutuhan. Sedangkan untuk panen raya biasanya dilakukan pemetikan setiap seminggu sekali. Satu Kilogram kakao kering harganya berkisar Rp 10.000,- s.d 13.000,- .Ni Ketut Soli sangat senang dengan hasil yang di perolehnya saat ini. Saat ini ia berencana untuk mendapat pinjaman yang di pergunakan untuk membeli pupuk dan obat-obatan anti hama agar hasil kebun kakaonya menjadi lebih baik. Ni Ketut Soli lebih bersemangat dalam mengelola kebunnya karena ia mempunyai prinsip bahwa semua yang dilakukannya sekarang adalah untuk keluarganya

loans.use: Purchase Fertilizer and Insecticide

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng Y., 45, is a mother of five children and also owns a stand selling a variety of grocery products. She normally earns on average a profit of $1.5 a day.  Her husband, Mr. Cham Chem, 47, is a wedding chef earning $2 a day of profit. All of their children live away from home. To generate an additional income this couple requests a loan from Kiva of $1000 to purchase a motor-bike to use as a motor-taxi and to buy more grocery products.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and a motor-bike to be used as a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Juni Astut

texts.id:
Since getting married to Putu Purnawa, 4 years ago, Ni Nengah Juni Astut started a small food kiosk in front of her home. She chose this business since her village is quite isolated from urban areas, therefore, the villagers have hard time obtaining daily household needs. She sells daily needs like rice, spices, soap and various snacks. She opens her kiosk at 7 am and closes it at 6om. She earns about $4 each day. As her business grow, her clients are requesting that she carries more merchandise, such as kerosene and farm feeds. Ni Nengah Juni Astuti wants to fulfill these requests and grow her business. Hoerver she does not have sufficient capital. So she applied for a $330 loan from DINARI. With this additional funding, Ni Nengah Juni Astuti plans to increase her merchandise offering and renovate her kiosk. She is optimistic that her business will grow significantly.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Setelah menikah dengan Putu Purnawa 4 tahun yang lalu, Ni Nengah Juni Astuti mulai membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya.Usaha ini dipilih Ni Nengah Juni Astuti karena di dusun tempat tinggalnya, merupakan salah satu dusun yang sangat terpencil yang jauh dari perkotaan sehingga masyarakat di tempat ini sangat sulit untuk membeli barang- barang kebutuhan sehari-hari.
