Barang yang dijual adalah segala kebutuhan rumah tangga seperti beras, bumbu dapur, deterjen, sabun mandi dan aneka makanan kecil. Mulai pukul 07.00 pagi Ni Nengah Juni Astuti membuka warungnya dan tutup pada pukul 18.00 sore. Keuntungan rata rata yang di peroleh per harinya sebesar Rp. 35.000.- Seiring dengan perkembangan dan juga banyaknya permintaan dari pelanggan akan keperluan yang lain seperti minyak tanah dan pakan ternak khususnya ternak babi , Ni Nengah Juni Astuti bermaksud mengembangkan lagi usaha warungnya. Namun karena dana yang di miliki tidak cukup, Ni Nengah juni Astuti mencari pinjaman ke Dinari sebesar Rp 3.000.000,- .Dengan tambahan modal ini Ni Nengah Juni Astuti akan menambah barang daganganya dan memperbaiki kondisi warungnya agar lebih baik lagi. Ni Nengah Juni Astuti optimis usahanya akan berkembang pesat.

loans.use: Purchase goods to be sold and renovate kiosk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong S., 38, is married with four children and works as a teacher in Tmor Kor commune, part of Kampong Cham Province. As a teacher she earns on average $4 per day, which includes her salary and running a part time private class for the students on certain days of the week. To supplement the household  income, her husband, Mr. Kert Sophea, 45, sells wood and charcoal, earning $11 of income. This couple hopes to borrow $1000 to purchase more wood and charcoal to resell in large amounts.  The profit from this business will be used to support the family.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase more wood and charcoal.

loans.name: Ni Luh Sutami

texts.id:
Balinese housewives are usually also active in helping the husband in earning more income. There are many occupations that was traditionally male dominated are now done by women. Ni Luh Sutami is an example. She has been farming cattle for the past 2 years. Her earnings even surpassed her husband's who works as a farmer. So her farm really helps her family's finances tremendously. Each cow can only have a child each year. Each infant cow that is ready for maturing can be sold for $220 to $330, depending on the gender. In general male cows sell more than the female. In the past year, Ni Luh Sutami earned $280 from one infant cow. This earnings is not enough to help her husband to pay for all her family's needs., especially this year her son, Gede Artayasa is starting school. With a loan from Dinari, Ni Luh Sutami expects to buy one more breeder cow. She really hopes that she can produce more cows to be sold so she earns more than last year.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Selain sebagai ibu rumah tangga, ibu-ibu di Bali juga sangat perperan aktif bekerja atau berusaha untuk menunjang usaha / pendapatan suami. Banyak pekerjaan atau usaha yang dulunya dilakukan oleh kaum pria kini sudah dikerjakan oleh para wanita. Seperti apa yang telah dilakukan oleh Ni Luh Sutami. Memelihara ternak sapi yang telah ditekuni sejak 2 tahun belakangan ini telah banyak membantu perekonomian keluarganya bahkan hasil yang didapatpun tak kalah dengan pendapatan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani. Seekor Induk sapi dalam satu tahun hanya beranak satu kali.Dan harga seekor anak sapi yang sudah siap untuk di pasarkan untuk bibit berkisar 2 sampai 3 juta rupiah tergantung dari jenis kelaminnya. Pada umumnya sapi jantan harganya lebih mahal di bandingkan yang betina. Dalam tahun terhakhir ini Ni luh Sutami mendapat hasil Rp 2.500.000 dari penjualan 1 ekor anak sapi. Hasil ini dirasa belum cukup untuk bisa membantu penghasilan suaminya yang hanya sebagai petani kecil. ( penggarap tanah orang lain) Apalagi tahun ini Gede Artayasa anaknya harus masuk sekolah sehingga Ni Luh Sutami memerlukan biaya tambahan . Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari , Niluh Sutami membeli satu ekor Induk sapi lagi bahkan saat ini kedua induk sapi peliharaan Ni luh Sutami sedang hamil. Besar harapan Niluh Sutami sapi-sapi peliharaanya bisa melahirkan dengan selamat, sehingga tahun ini dia bisa mendapatkan hasil dari jerih payahnya lebih banyak dari tahun yang lalu .

loans.use: Purchase Breeding Cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nhom Chi Thao - Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tý, 48 years old, has two children who are still in school. Her family has a animal husbandry business: poultry, pigs, fish farm. She also plants fruit trees. Those have been three years now. She’s taken out loans from the local agricultural bank in Yên Phong. All were paid off. She is applying aloan with the Binh Minh to buy feed for her egg laying ducks. The daily income is about 7USD. Mrs. Ninh uses funds from the loan to buy feed for her poultry. Mrs. Duyên uses funds from the loan to buy piglets. Mrs. Nhàn uses funds from the loan to buy feed for her fish farm and egg laying ducks. Mrs. Hằng uses funds from the loan to buy piglets. Mrs. Thảo uses funds from the loan to buy feed for her egg laying ducks. Her daily income is about 7USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tý, 48 tuổi, có hai con đang đi học. Gia đình chị mở trang trại chăn nuôi gà, vịt, lợn, cá; N.ài ra còn trồng các loại cây ăn quả đã được hơn 3 năm nay. Chị đã từng vay vốn ở Ngân hàng Nông nghiệp huyện Yên Phong nhưng nay đã trả hết. Chị tham gia vay vốn của chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh để bổ sung tiền mua cám cho đàn vịt để trứng. Hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 100000-120000đồng/ngày. Chị Ninh vay vốn mua cám cho gà, vịt đẻ. Chị Duyên vay vốn mua lợn giống. Chị Nhàn vay vốn mua cám cá, vịt đẻ. Chị Hằng vay vốn mua lợn giống. Chị Thảo vay vốn mua cám cho lợn.

loans.use: Buy feed for animal husbandry

loans.name: Vom

texts.en: Mrs. Vom V., 26, works as a weaver and normally earns around $3 a day of profit. To enable the family to have a better life, her husband, Mr. Ry Mao, works as a gardener, usually earning $2 a day. This couple hopes to borrow  $650 from Kiva to purchase a motor-bike in order to reduce the costs of Mr. Mao's commute.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike.

loans.name: I Nyoman Switra

texts.id:
I Nyoman Switra has been farming chicken since 2005. He farms chicken to be slaughtered that takes about 35-40 days from birth to slaughter. An average mature chicken weighs about 2kg and can be sold for $1 per kg. I Nyoman Switra farms about 4000 chickens. He is assisted by his wife and a contract worker that he pays about $110 per harvest. I Nyoman Switra's chicken farm is his family's only source of income since he retired from his post as his village head. He gets decent income from the farm, but it also carries significant risk as his chickens are vulnerable to disease and his yield can vary with temperature and weather. Therefor he needs to keep up the environment and spend some money on vaccines and drugs. Each harvest, I Nyoman Switra can earn up to $110 to $170 by selling his chickens to larger wholesaler who has been I Nyoman's regular client. I Nyoman Switra needs additional fund to afford higher price of feeds and to renovate his chicken cages. He hopes that his chicken farm can grow. He needs to pay for his children's tuition. One of his children is currently in college, and the other is still in Junior high school.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Beternak ayam telah di tekuni I Nyoman Switra Sejak tahun 2005 . Ayam yang di pelihara adalah ayam pedaging. Masa pertumbuhan ayam ini dari sejak lahir hingga siap panen berkisar 35 sampai 40 hari , dengan berat badan rata-rata 2 kg sedangkan harga perkilogramnya Rp 9.200,- . I Nyoman Switra memelihara 4.000 ekor ayam. Ia di bantu oleh istri serta seorang tenaga kerja yang di gaji sebesar Rp. 1.000.000,- per sekali panen . Memelihara ayam bagi I Nyoman Switra adalah satu –satunya sumber pendapatan keluarga sejak dia pensiun menjadi kepala dusun . Hasil yang di peroleh pun sangat menjanjikan . Namun resiko yang dihadapi juga cukup tinggi karena ayam jenis ini sangat rentan dengan serangan penyakit dan sangat terpengaruh pada suhu /cuaca ,sehingga memerlukan lingkungan yang sehat dan juga modal yang cukup untuk persediaan obat-obatan ataupun vaksin. Dalam sekali panen I Nyoman Switra meraup keuntungan berkisar 1 sampai 1,5 juta rupiah. Sedangkan hasil panen I Nyoman Switra langsung diambil oleh pedagang besar yang sudah menjadi pelanggan tetap . I Nyoman Switra memerlukan tambahan modal untuk membeli pakan ayam yang saat ini semakin mahal dan juga untuk merenopasi kandangnya yang sudah mulai rapuh , Dan besar harapan I Nyoman Switra peternakan ayamnya bisa lebih berkembang ,sehingga dapat menunjang biaya pendidikan anaknya yang kini telah duduk di bangku kuliah dan satu lagi masih SMP.

loans.use: Purchase Chicken Feed and Repair Cages

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey S., 28, a mother of two children, is a garment worker, making on average $3 a day.  Her husband, Mr. Youn Pov (not available for picture), is a construction head normally earning $7 a day. Both of their children are students. The couple hopes to use this loan of $500 to buy construction tools to assist Mr. Pov's work.  Additional profit earned from the purchase of these tools will be be used to cover daily expenses and eventually enable them to send the children to university.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies.

payments.comment: Congratulation!!!! Mrs. Srey Sareoun has successfully repaid her loan very early. She is so impressive with the impact of the loan on her entire family, provinding her an opportunity to go a head. Now she is seeking for another loan to keep improving her standard of living.

loans.name: Nhom Co Luat - Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Ms. Luật, singled, 49 years old, tends pigs and trades scrap metal. Her daily income is 5USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

Mrs. Nam, 27 years old, is a teacher. Her husband is a tailor. The daily income is 6USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy tools for her husband.

Mrs. Thu, 37 years old, and her husband process rice grain. She also tends pigs. The daily income is 6USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

Mrs. Mơ, 30 years old, tends pigs and trades scrap metal. Her husband is a construction worker. The daily income is 6USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

Mrs. Thao, 52 years old, tends pigs and trades scrap metal. Her husband farms rice paddy. The daily income is 5USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Cô Luật, 49 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt, không có chồng. Thu nhập hàng ngày của cô cũng từ 80000-90000đồng/ngày. Cô vay 2006000 đồng từ chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc để mua cám cho lợn. Sự thuận tiện và không phải thế chấp là điều cô thích nhất khi đến với Chương trình. Chị Nam, 27 tuổi, làm nghề dạy trẻ, chồng làm thợ may. Chị vay 2006000đồng để thêm vốn cho chồng mua máy. Thu nhập của gia đình trung bình là 100000đồng/ngày. Chị Thu, 37 tuồi, làm nghề xay xát gạo và chăn nuôi lợn, chồng phụ chị xát gạo. Thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình khoảng 100000đồng. Chị vay vốn của chương trình binhminh cdc (2006000đồng) để thêm vốn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi. Chị thích vay vốn ở đây vì được tham gia lâu dài. Chị Mơ, 30 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt, chồng chị làm thợ xây. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình cũng được 100000đồng/ngày. Chị vay 2006000đồng để thêm vốn chăn nuôi. Chị rất thích vay vốn của chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc vì không phải thế chấp Cô Thạo, 52 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt. Chồng làm ruộng. Thu nhập của gia đình trung bình 70000-80000 đồng/ngày. Chị thích vay của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì được vay lâu dài.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs, tools

loans.name: Dith

texts.en: Mrs. Dith D., 55, is a widow with two children. She looks after her house and cooks for her children; she also owns a plot of farmland where growing rice earns her on average about $2 a day.  Her children work in a garment factory, making a salary of $50 each a month. Mrs. D. is requesting a loan from Kiva of $500 to purchase a water pump to irrigate her rice crops.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mrs. Sao S. is a widow with four children who works as a seller of variety products, earning on average $2 a day. Two of her children work as laborers, normally earning about $1 a day. To make additional money for her family, she is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase rice to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice and resell for profit

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Mrs. Ou S., 40, has worked in construction since 2005, making an average of $3 a day. To supplement the household income, her husband, Mr. Nghik Hon, 41, also works in construction and normally earns $3 a day. They have three children, two of whom are laborers with incomes of $2 a day and one who is a student. To decrease the cost of commuting, this couple asks for a loan of $500 to purchase a motor-bike. (Her husband is pictured with the type of motor-bike that he and his wife are planning to buy for their transportation).

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to decrease the cost of commuting.

loans.name: Nhom Chi Thoa - An Ninh - Yen Phu Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thoa, 27 years old, raises pigs. The family daily income is 6USD. She’s never borrowed money from anyone.

Mrs. Thành, 23 years old, has taken out loans from Binh Minh for investing in her butchery operation. She and her husband are young and energetic. Their daily income is 8-9USD.

Ms. Hoà, 46 years old, is taking out loan to do business. Her daily income is 7.50USD

Mrs. Thắm, 24 year old, is taking out loan to invest in her hàng mã (paper dolls as offering to dead people) business. Her husband is a driver. Their daily income is 9-10USD. They have taken out a loan from a bank to finance his truck. It’s been paid off.

Ms. Thư, 27 years old, is taking out loan to invest in her meat shop. The daily income is 6-7USD. She’s never borrowed money from anyone

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Thoa, 27 tuổi, vay vốn để buôn bán thịt lợn. Với mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là 100000đồng/ngày, chị có thể tiết kiệm để hoàn trả ít một cho chương trình là rất hợp lý, nên chị đã tham gia vay của chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc. Còn từ trước đến nay, chị chưa tham gia vay vốn của một tổ chức nào. Chị Thành, 23 tuổi, đã vay vốn của Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc để bổ sung vào vốn của chị đi mổ lợn bán cho các hộ đi bán lẻ. Anh chị tuy trẻ nhưng rất năng động, mức thu nhập hàng ngày cũng lên tới 140000/ngày. Việc buôn bán của anh chị cần nhiều vốn nhưng chị cũng chưa tham gia vay vốn ở một tổ chức nào. Khi biết Binhminh cdc có cho vay với thủ tục đơn giản, chị đã tham gia. Cô Hoà, 46 tuổi, vay vốn để làm ăn và biết được trả dần, làm thủ tục nhanh và thuận tiện nên chị đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc. Với mức thu nhập 120000đồng/ngày, chị sẽ hoàn trả tốt cho chương trình. Chị Thắm, 24 tuổi, vay vốn của binhminh cdc vì sự thuận lợn không cần thế chấp. Chị sẽ dùng tiền để mua nguyên vật liệu đan lát và đóng dán đồ hàng mã. Ngoài thu nhập của chị, chồng chị cũng góp phần không nhỏ vào thu nhập của gia đình (150000đồng/ngày), anh đi chở hàng thuê cho các hộ buôn bán bằng chiếc xe của mình mua được do vay vốn từ ngân hàng (nay đã trả hết). Chị Thư, 27 tuổi, cũng không thua kém các chị em cùng lứa tuổi. Chị vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì sẽ được vay một món tiền lớn và trả những khoản tiền nhỏ lẻ. Chị sẽ đầu tư mua thêm thịt để bán, tăng số tiền lãi hàng ngày cho gia đình. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị hiện nay cũng được 100000/ngày. Chị Thư chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu.

loans.use: Invest in various businesses

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem S., 39, is a mother of two children. She stays at home looking after her children and cooking food for her entire family. Beside doing the housework, she also grows morning glory flowers and raises pigs. Her husband, Mr. Yan Phaly, 42, works as a police officer and typically makes $1 a day. To provide a better life for their children, they are requesting $1,000 from Kiva to purchase more pigs to breed.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan L., 52, is a mother of three children and works as a vegetables seller, making about $5 profit daiL.. Her husband, Mr. Leng Krei, 54, is a police officer and earns about $2 a day. One of their children earns about $100 a month and the other two are students. To expand their business, this couple is requesting a loan from Kiva of $300 to purchase more vegetables to sell in bulk.

loans.use: This couple will use the loan to purchase more vegetables to sell in bulk.

loans.name: Sart

texts.en: Mrs. Sart C. N., 37, and her husband are vendors selling roasted duck in the local market. They earn about $20 profit daily. They have two children, both of whom are students. As roasted duck is a popular dish in Cambodia, and they are now earning more profit, this couple hopes to expand their business buy purchasing ducks in bulk and reselling them for profit.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase ducks for consumption and sale.

payments.comment:
Congratulation to Mrs. Sart Chen Nen!!!!!!!!

Now She is able to pay off her loan very early. On behalf of Mrs Sart Chen Nen, we would like to say greatly thank to all the lenders who always support and help to our poor entrepreneurs. your loan can make different. 

we will provide the Journal update of Sart Chen Nen's family as soon as we could so that you will understand what different your loan make on her and her family. 

Many Thanks again

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Mrs. Tith C., 26, is a mother of two. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. She earns about $2 daily by growing and selling vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Yuk Roth, 27, supplements her income by working as a motor-taxi driver, normally earning $5 daily. As their house is run down, they are requesting about $650 from Kiva to renovate the house.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to renovate their house.

loans.name: Mak

texts.en: Mrs. Mak N., 46, is married with eight children. She works as farmer growing a variety of vegetables and typically earns $3 a day in profit. Her husband, Mr. Prak Ren, 47, is a rears pigs and makes about $1 of profit a day. Three of her children live away from home, three are garment workers earning $100 each a month and two others are students. This couple hopes to borrow $600 to purchase construction supplies to renovate their house.(Mrs. Mak N. and her husband is not available for picture. The photograph shows their sons.)

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to renovate their house.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Mak Neang and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Xuân (group leader) is 54 years old. She request a loan from Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) to buy more merchandise to resell, raising her income. Her husband is a state employee. He does share the workload with her. Mrs Xuân's income is 9 USD a day. She will be able to pay back the loan.
Mrs Ba will use the loan to buy construction material.
Mrs Năm will use the loan to buy vegetables to sell at the market.
Mrs Thuỷ & Hương will use the loan to buy mechandise to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Xuân, 54 tuổi, vay vốn của Chương trình binhminh cdc để lấy thêm một số mặt hàng đi bán thêm phong phú, tăng thêm lãi, phụ giúp gia đình. Anh Hùng, chồng chị, làm chịng nhân viên chức Nhà nước cũng giúp chị phần nào gánh vác gia đình. Chị đã vay của phụ nữ nhưng với mức thu nhập 150000đồng/ ngày, chị sẽ hoàn trả tốt các loại vốn vay.
Chị Ba vay vốn mua sắm nguyên vật liệu phục vụ cho việc đi làm xây dựng (là nguồn thu nhập chính của chị).
Chị Năm vay vốn để mua rau về bán lẻ, tạo thu nhập.
Chị Thuỷ, chị Hương vay vốn để hỗ trợ cho việc bán hàng.

loans.use: Bán hàng, đi làm thuê

loans.name: Den

texts.en: Mrs. Ken S., 28, sells a variety of desserts in the local school campus, making on average $5 a day in profit. Her husband, Mr. Chheng Samnang, 29, works as motor-taxi driver and typically earns $5 a day in profit. They have four children, all of whom are students. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a vehicle to transport the desserts to the school.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motor-bike

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Mrs. Cheam S., 33, is a mother of three. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. She also owns a plot of farmland where she grows rice, earning around $2 a day in profit. To provide their family with a better life her husband, Mr. Yi Visal, 35, works as a doctor in Prey Veng province Cambodia. He earns about $4 a day in profit. This couple hopes to borrow about $1,000 to renovate their house.

loans.use: To renovate their house.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar A. is 43 years old and is married with 4 children.

Muyassar has been running her business for 8 years. She sells housewares like plates and dishes, teapots and caps, vacuum flasks and others items. All the goods are supplied from China. In addition to retail clients, Muyassar also sells to wholesale customers. The business is successful and generates a stable income allowing Muyassar to contribute considerably to the family budget. 

Muyassar has been working with IMON for several years already and has proven herself as a reliable client. Today she requests $1000.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Muyassar shall spend the loan for purchasing the chinaware and other houseware items like teapots, caps, and flasks in order to increase the range of goods for sale. Muyassar thanks all for support and promises to manage the loan without violations.

loans.use: Purchase of  housewares like plates and dishes, teapots, and vacuum flasks that will expand the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Goibnazar

texts.en:
Goibnazar D. is 36 years old. He is married with two children.

Goibnazar provides transportation services on his truck. He has been in this business for 3 years. As a rule Goibnazar transports goods from Dushanbe to Istaravshan and vice versa. Dushanbe is the capital of Tajikistan and located in the South of the Republic and Istaravshan is located in the North of the Republic. The road goes through the mountains and there are a couple of passes that are closed during the winter season due to the snow. Considering the above, Goibnazar has decided to fix his truck. With this purpose he requests 2000.00 Somoni ($600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Goibnazar, however, he is sure he shall be able to pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: Fixing of the truck

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay N., 44, is married with two school-age children. She and her husband sell coffee and a variety of grocery products, earning about $10 a day in profit. As their business and clientele have expanded, they are requesting a $500 loan from Kiva to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba A. is 37 years old and is married with four children.

The husband of Nasiba is currently unemployed which is why Nasiba became the main bread-winner. She sells clothing for women. Nasibahas been in this business for 15 years. One of her trading places is located in the local market and another is in her store. Being very friendly with her clients Nasiba has obtained her clientele through years of work. The business is stable and is generating significant income allowing the family to improve living conditions. 

Today Nasiba is planning to travel to Bishakek which is located in the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan, and Dubai located in Arabian Emirates in order to purchase the new clothing for for sale. With this purpose, she requests $900.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Nasiba has borrowed from IMON several times and has proven herself as a reliable client. Nasiba thanks everyone for the support and promises to pay the loan on time

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Nozir

texts.en:
Nozir D. is 30 years old and is married with three children.

Nozir  manufactures  fences form  metal wire. He has been in this business for 4 years. These fences are widely used in the rural areas for making the barriers for animals in enclosures, pens,  and yards. Nozir is well-known in his neighborhood and has lots of orders. The business is stable and allows Nozir to use the generated incomes for improving the living conditions of the family. 

Today he requests 2 000.00 Somoni ($600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing the input materials, like wire, required for manufacturing the fences. Since this would be his first loan, Nozir promises to be accurate in payment.

loans.use: Purchase of input materials like wires for the manufacture of  fences.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. Ouch S., 45, owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. She is also occasionally hired to harvest the crop in the neighboring field, normally earning $3 to $4 a day in profit. Her husband, Mr. Hak Choun, 46, is a police officer who earns less than $1 a day in profit. They have five children, all of whom are students. This couple hopes to use their Kiva loan to purchase fertilizers, rice seed and oil. To buy all of these, they are requesting a loan from Kiva of about $1,000. They will use the fertilizers and rice seed to farm in the dry seasons to gain more yields throughout the year.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase fertilizers, rice seed and oil.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat R.  is 31 years old and is married with two children.

Shuhrat has been running his business for 10 years. He sells feed for poultry like millet, maize, ground rice and cereal. Through the years of his work, Shuhrat has become popular among the poultry keepers and many of them have become his customers. The business is stable and brings the main income for the family.

Shuhrat has been borrowing from IMON since 2005. He has proven himself a reliable client. Today he requests $700.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Shuhrat plans to purchase the feed for the poultry in order to have the goods in store for the spring season before the harvesting season. Shuhrat thanks all for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing poultry feed in order to have the goods in the store for the spring season before the harvesting season

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S., 53, works as a tailor earning about $12 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chap Bon,  supplements the household income by working as a farmer, making on average $2 a day. They have four children. Two daughters work as garment workers and earn $80 each a month; one son is a palm climber and the other one is a student. To expand their tailoring business in order to create a better life for their family, this couple needs to borrow $1,000 from Kiva to purchase cloth in bulk for their tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth in bulk for their tailoring business

loans.name: Kobil

texts.en:
Kobil K.  is 49 years old and is married with two children (his wife is pictured in photo). 

Kobil breeds cattle and sheep. Four years ago the difficult economic position of the family forced Kobil to become a cattleman. Currently he has 2 cows and 6 sheep in his household. After raising the animals he  sells them in the local market. Kobil's wife helps look after the cattle and helps with the feeding. Kobil works hard in order to make the business successful and generates a stable income for the family. 

Kobil is planning to purchase 2 cows and 4 sheep to raise and to sell in the future. With this purpose he requests $1000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. As this is his first request for  loan,  Kobil would like to promise to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

loans.use: Purchasing 2 cows and 4 sheep for breeding

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim I.  is 23 years old. Naim  supports his mother and his younger brother. 

Naim is provides taxi services from his vehicle. He is a very nice, diligent and smart young man. Naim has been working as a taxi-driver for the past 2 years. He is applying for a loan for the first time as he needs additional funding for purchasing spare parts to repairhis vehicle. He requests 2 000.00 Somoni ($600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Let us help Naim with his intention to make his business more successful and to generate a stable income for his family.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for the repair of his vehicle.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mrs. Moeun S. On, 29, is a mother of two children and works as a farmer making on average $2 a day in profit. To provide their family with a better standard of living, her husband works as a motor-taxi driver, earning $2 a day. They have two children, both of whom are students. To earn additional income this family plans to rear pigs and they are now requesting a $500 loan from Kiva to purchase pigs for resale.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase pigs to resell for profit.

loans.name: Zinat

texts.en:
R. Zinat is 49 years old. She is married with two children. 

Zinat sells fruit. She purchases the fruits in the central market of Khujand city at wholesale prices and sells them in Asht region, which is located in a remote area.  Zinat has been in this business for 7 years and has obtained the suppliers as well as the customers. The business is successful and generates the considerable income allowing the family to improve living conditions.

Zinat had been provided with several loans by IMON and had proved herself as an honest and reliable client. Today she requests $800.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Zinat is planning to purchase various fruits in order to enlarge the range of goods for sale. She promises to be accurate and precise in the loan management and payment.

loans.use: Purchasing more fruits in order to expand the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S., 34, is married with three school-aged children. She is a vendor of grocery products and normally earns about $2 a day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and earns $2 in profit daily. It is still difficult to make ends meet although they both earn, so they decided to borrow about $700 to expand their business by purchasing more grocery products for sale. (Mrs. Touch S. is unavailable for picture)

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Taiba

texts.en:
K. Taiba is 35 years old. She is married with three children.

Taiba sells fabrics like coarse calico, cheesecloth, linen and other cotton textiles. She has been in this business for several years. The business is a family one; Taiba's  sister and the brother help her by working in the market as sellers. Together with relatives, Taiba purchases the goods and rents the store in the local market of the city.  Taiba's husband is a carpenter; his work is of a seasonal nature which is why he also  helps his wife when he has no orders.  Now Taiba is planning to expand the inventory in order to increase the range of goods available for sale. With this purpose she requests 3 400.00 Somoni (1 000.00 US Dollars) for the term of 6 months. Taiba thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan back  on time.

loans.use: Purchasing cotton textiles like coarse calico, cheesecloth, and linen for increasing the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Mahrom

texts.en:
M. Mahrom is 31 years old. Mahrom is divorced, however, he is supporting his kids as well as  his mother.

Mahrom has been a barber for more than 12 years. Mahrom's dream is to run his own barber shop. He also breeds cattle. The current winter is unusually cold in Tajikistan and Mahrom needs to build a heat-insulated cowshed. Though he earns a stable income, Mahrom still needs the additional funding in order to execute the planned tasks. He is requesting 2000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for a term of 12 months. This is the first loan request of Mahrom and he hopes for the trust and in turn promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing the fodder for his cattle and expansion of the barber shop

loans.name: Nasihat

texts.en:
Nasihat Toshamtova sells fruit, like apples, pears, and oranges, in the market of the Asht region, a remote area of Tajikistan. She usually purchases the fruit wholesale from the central market of Khujand in the center of  northern Tajikistan. She has run her business for eleven years. The business is stable and allows Nasihat to make a considerable contribution to the family budget.

IMON has made loans to Nasihat since 2005 and she has demonstrated herself to be a reliable client. She will use this loan to buy a wider variety of fruit to sell.

Nasihat is 47 years old. She is married with three school-age children. Nasihat promises to be precise in her loan payment and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase fruits to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar has a very small bakery that is located in his house. He bakes the national bread of Tajikistan, called “lepeshka.” His elder brother and mother help him in the business.

Zafar has always been known as a hard-working young man. This year, Zafar is getting married and so he is working even harder to make his business more successful. He will use his income to pay for his wedding party and expand the bakery.

With this loan, Zafar will purchase the flour and coal that he urgently needs to continue baking. He thanks everyone for their support and trust.

loans.use: Purchase coal and flour required for baking

loans.name: Khasanhuja

texts.en:
Khasanhuja K. sells women's clothing in the central market of his city. The business is successful and provides a stable income for his large family. But Khasanhuja would like to offer a better variety of goods to his customers.

Twice a month, he travels to a neighboring city to buy his goods. With this loan, he will purchase a wider range of women's clothing to sell in his shop.

Khasanhuja is 24 years old. He is not yet married, however he is the main bread-winner in his family that includes his parents and younger sister. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchase a wider range of women's clothing

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat manufactures fences made from metallic wire. In the rural area in which he lives, such fences are commonly used to enclose various structures, such yards and pens. Shuhrat started his business as a journeyman and has been working independently for one year. His business is becoming more and more stable and is providing a better income for his family.

He will use this loan to purchase building materials, like wire, to manufacture fences.

Shuhrat is 23 years old and married. He supports his wife, parents, and a younger sister. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to pay his loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase materials to manufacture fences

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa has a store in the central market of the city. She sells curtains and the fabrics used to make Tajikistan's national dresses. The dresses are very beautiful and bright, and a popular and an important item of the dowry of any girl. She has run her business for about nine years. It is successful and providing a stable and significant income for her family.

Two or three times a month, Sharifa travels to the neighboring city to purchase goods. She will use this loan to increase her inventory by purchasing fabric and curtains.

Sharifa is 35 years old and married with three children. She thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make and sell national dresses and curtains

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz lives in a rural area and rents his tractor. There is a high demand for his tractor each year from March until November. Aziz is also a cattleman who breeds the cattle for sale. He has three heads of cattle in his household, one of which is for milk.

Aziz will use this loan to purchase spare parts for his tractor and make repairs to it.

Aziz is 34 years old and married with three school-age children. He thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and repair a tractor

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan has been selling dried fruits and nuts for over four years. When his father died, he became the main bread-winner for his large family. Aslan has worked hard and, as a result, his business has become successful and provides a stable income.

He will use this loan to purchase dried fruits and nuts for resale and also to repair the car he uses to transport goods.

Aslan is 30 years old, married with three children, and also supports his mother and younger brothers. He thanks everyone for their trust and promises to repay his loan accurately.

loans.use: Purchase dried fruits and nuts and repair a vehicle

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en:
Sobir sells food (such as confectionaries, juice, sugar, and macaroni foods) to local stores. When Sobir started the business six years ago, it was only retail sales. Gradually, he expanded the business by purchasing goods wholesale and distributing them. The business became stable and successful.

Recently, Sobir paid for his son's wedding party and, as a result, is low on capital. He will use this loan to buy goods to increase his inventory.

Sobir is 42 years old, married, and has four children. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase goods to increase inventory

loans.name: Khuseinboi

texts.en:
Khusein sells school and office supplies. Twice a month, he travels to Khujand to buy a wider range of goods. He has worked non-stop for the last 5 years to make his business successful. As a result, the business is stable, expanding, and provides the main income for his family.

Khusein will use this loan to buy supplies wholesale so that he can sell them to his customers at lower prices.

Khusein is 29 years old, married, and has two school-age children. He thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Buy supplies at wholesale prices

loans.name: Monira

texts.en:
Monira lives in district 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is still single and has taken a tailoring course. Her sister teaches languages.

Monira is teaching tailoring and also sews wedding clothes. She needs to expand her business. She wants to take out an individual loan to buy new sewing machines so that she can attract more clients and make a good income to help her family and make a better future for herself. She is happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Magamaga Central J Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kibonde S.. She is currently in the business of running a tree nursery and is requesting a loan to add capital. Kibonde is 39 years old and is divorced. She has 6 children ranging from age 12 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Kibonde makes approximately UGX 21000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and invest more in her business. Kibonde has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Kibonde is joined in her small group by Edith N.. Edith N. has a business in maize selling and wants to boost business.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and buy nursery equipment like watering cans

loans.name: Nsaggu Akugoba Group

texts.en: After she failed to have a second child, Harriet’s husband left her for another woman, but this did not stop her from caring for her girl, who has now given her 7 grandchildren. She is 48 years old and has had a drug shop business at her home for 20 years, while she has been our client for 9 years. On top of this business, she also has a charcoal trading business, as well as a business selling spare car parts that she co-owns with her son-in-law. Her loan is to help her buy more drugs and buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: Harriet intends to buy more drugs, like Panadol and Fansidar, and charcoal.

loans.name: Kabumbi V A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Juliet N.. She is currently in the business of selling fresh food and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Juliet is 32 years old and is married. Her Husband is a taxi driver. She has 8 children ranging from age 3 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Juliet makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Juliet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in the fresh food business and the loan was paid back on time.

Juliet is joined in her small group by Birungi B., Mariam N., Joyce N., and Zam N.. Birungi B. has a business in tailoring and wants to purchase more cloth materials. Mariam N. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Joyce N. operates a business of selling fresh foods and wants to boost business. Zam N. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling.

loans.use: To expand fresh food business and increase profits

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: Rose, aged 42, is married with 9 children and has a retail shop in Nsaggu, Nakawuka. She has been our client for 5 months, and she is a good person. She also sells milk from her cows at home, and this has helped her generate more income. Each of her other colleagues has a retail shop, and their plan is to expand their shops by buying more sugar, soap, Vaseline, and salt.

loans.use: Rose intends to buy more Vaseline, sugar, salt, and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sorti

texts.id:
One of the Bali natives' activities is praying. They use many kinds of accesories for the prayings, such as Canang with various shapes with many varieties of flower. Ni Nengah Sotri is a mother who see this opportunity to make some money. She provides various kind of religious accesories. She uses some materials such as Janur (coconut leaves) including including young and old leaves. This kind of material is quite easy to find in her neighbourhood. Besides selling daily religious accessories, Ni Nengah Sotri also take some package orders for bigger religious events such Otonan (birthday), Odalan (big religious ceremony), and so on. For these package orders, she needs bigger capital. She also usually needs help from her relatives. By joining DINARI foundation, Ni Nengah Sotri not only receives loan, but also gets some consultancies and advice for making a better business. Everyday Ni Nengah Sotri does her housework such as cooking and taking care of the children. After the housework, she starts working on her business. Her net profit is around Rp 20,000 to Rp 25,000 per day. She uses the profit to cover the family's expenses. Her husband is construction labor with irregular income. Thanks to this business, Ni Nengah Sotri can help support the family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan masyarakat asli Bali adalah sembahyang. Banyak alat - alat yang dipakai untuk menunjang prasarana sembahyang, antara lain yang disebut Canang dengan beraneka ragam bentuknya, dan aneka macam bunga sebagai pelengkapnya. Ni Nengah Sotri adalah salah seorang ibu yang dapat memanfaatkan kesempatan tersebut sebagai salah satu usaha yang dapat menghasilkan uang. Beraneka macam barang - barang yang dapat menunjang persembahyanggan disediakan. Bahan baku yang dipakai adalah Janur ( daun kelapa ) baik yang masih muda maupun yang sudah tua. Bahan baku ini sangat mudah dicari di daerahnya. Selain menjual bahan-bahan untuk sarana persembahyangan secara harian, Ni Nengah Sotri juga melayani aneka macam sarana sembahyangan secara besar / paket Otonan ( Ulang tahun ) dan Odalan ( Upacara keagamaan yang besar ) dan lain-lain. Untuk pesanan dalam bentuk paket inilah yang biasanya sangat memerlukan modal besar. Dan biasanya juga mempekerjakan beberapa kerabatnya untuk membantu agar cepat selesai.Dengan bergabungnya Ni Nengah Sontri dengan Yayasan Dinari, tidak hanya modal dana saja yang diperolehnya tetapi juga pembinaan-pembinaan yang tentunya diharapkan dapat meningkatkan usahanya. Setiap pagi Ni Nengah Sotri mengerjakan kegiatan sehari-hari sebagai ibu rumah tangga seperti memasak, dan mengurus anak anaknya. Setelah semua terselesaikan barulah Ni Nengah Sontri dengan tekun mulai mengambil kegiatan usahanya. Keuntungan bersih dalam sehari mencapai Rp 20.000 s/d Rp 25.000,- dapat dipakai untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya. Suaminya adalah seorang tukang bangunan yang pekerjaannya tidak tetap .Dengan adanya usaha yang dijalankan oleh Ni Nengah Sontri ini sangatlah membantu dalam menambah pendapatan keluarganya.

loans.use: To add more capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Komang Sriani

texts.id:
Ni Komang Sriani and her husband, Darma Kantun, have been married for a long time but they still haven't got any children yet. They live in a very small house with a garden which was inherited from the parents. After the marriage, Ni Komang Sriani started the business in selling crop. If the neighbours have extra chocolates, bananas and coconuts, Ni Komang Sriani will buy them and then sell it later to the wholesaler to gain some profit. Through the non-profit organization in her village, Ni Komang Sriani received loan from DINARI. The loan is very useful to add more capital because in a day Ni Komang Sriani can buy at least 50 kgs chocolate, bananas and other crops. In the next day, Ni Komang Sriani will sell them in the market or other wholesalers. Her net profit is around Rp. 10,000 to Rp. 30,000 per day and from this profit Ni Komang Sriani can cover her life expenses because her husband doesn't work and only relies on his own crop in his garden. Ni Komang Sriani hopes that this business will grow more with more profit.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Komang Sriani dan Darma Kantun, suaminya, sudah lama menikah tetapi sampai dengan saat ini belum juga dikarunia seorang anak di dalam keluarga mereka. Mereka tinggal di sebuah rumah yang sangat kecil yang merupakan rumah warisan dari orang tuanya dan juga diberi kepercayaan untuk mengurus kebunnya. Sejak menikah, Ni Komang Sriani mulai menjalankan usahanya sebagai pedagang hasil bumi. Kalau ada coklat, pisang dan kelapa milik tetangganya, maka Ni Komang Sriani membelinya kemudian akan dijual kembali ke penggepul yang sudah menjadi langganan tetapnya dengan harapan nanti setelah dijual dapat memperoleh keuntungan. Melalui organisasi yang ada didesanya Ni Komang Sriani mendapatkan dana dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut sangat berarti dalam menambah modal usaha karena dalam satu hari Ni Komang Sriani dapat membeli paling sedikit 50 kg coklat, pisang, dan hasil kebun lainnya. Kemudian Ni Komang Sriani esok paginya akan menjualnya kembali dipasar, ataupun beberapa pengepul yang biasa mengambilnya. Keuntungan bersih dalam setiap harinya dapat mencapai Rp.10.000,- s/d Rp 30.000 dan dari hasil usaha inilah Ni Komang Sriani dapat menggantungkan hidupnya sebab suaminya tidak bekerja dan hanya mengandalkan hasil kebunnya sendiri. Ni Komang Sriani berharap agar nantinya usaha yang sedang ditekuni ini bisa berkembang lebih baik dengan keuntungan yang lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use: To add more capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Neema Kimara A Group

texts.en:
Juma M., age 40, is married and has a child who is 14 years old. He owns a shop, which he began 6 months ago. He works from 6:30 AM to 10:00 PM and is able to make a monthly profit of around US$17.

Juma has taken out 1 previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase the stock for his shop. Juma hopes to receive a new loan to increase the same business. Juma will share this loan with his subgroup members, who have businesses in the sale of food and charcoal.

In the picture Juma is the man who is standing in the middle.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his shop

loans.name: Ni Luh Raini

texts.id:
Ni luh Raini's kiosk is a quite humble kiosk. The kiosk sells various kinds of staples, snacks, kids' drinks and fast food such as fried noodle and noodle soup. As there is no competitor in her village, her kiosk is always crowded. Ni luh Raini opens the kiosk from 6am until 8pm. After her work finishes in the kiosk, Ni luh Raini continues her house work at home such as cooking, doing laundry and preparing for her oldest kid who studies in elementary school. Ni Luh Raini was introduced to DINARI by a non profit organization in her village. She got the additional fund to add her business capital from DINARI. She used the capital to buy more merchandise so she can offer more complete choice for the customers in her neighbourhood. Her net profit is around Rp 40,000 to Rp 60,000 per day. With the availability of more complete merchandise choice, she hopes she can gain more profit because she uses the profit to fulfill her family's daily expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Warung yang dimiliki Ni luh Raini tergolong masih sederhana. Barang yang disediakan antara lain aneka barang kebutuhan sehari-hari, aneka makanan ringan, aneka minuman anak-anak dan makanan siap saja seperti mie goreng / rebus. Karena usaha ini tidak ada saingan di desanya maka warungnya selalu ramai. Ni Luh Raini mulai membuka warung pada pukul 06.00 pagi dan tutup pada pukul 20.00 malam. Setelah selesai membuka warung, Ni Luh Raini kembali meneruskan pekerjaan untuk keluarganya yaitu, memasak, mencuci dan mempersiapkan keperluan anak pertama yang sudah sekolah tingkat dasar. Melalui Lembaga yang ada didesanya Ni Luh Raini mengenal Yayasan DINARI dan mendapat tambahan dana untuk menambah modal usaha warungnya.modal tersebut dipakai untuk melengkapi semua barang dagangan yang belum tersedia yang selalu dibutuhkan oleh masyarakat sekitar. Keuntungan bersih yang diperoleh setiap hari antara Rp 50.000.- s/d Rp 60.000.- Dengan tersedianya barang yang lengkap saat ini diharapkan keuntungan bersih yang didapat bisa bertambah, karena dari keuntungan ini dipergunakan untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya setiap hari.

loans.use: To buy more variaties of merchandise in the kiosk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Luh Murtini

texts.id:
Palm sugar is sugar which is made traditionally from sugary sap of coconut or palm tree. Ni luh Murtini has been doing this business for some time. Especially after her husband passed away, this business revenue can cover her daily expenses. Her revenue is not that much, but Ni luh Murtini never gives up and always tries her best. Everyday Ni luh Murtini travels around to buy palm sugar which will be sold to her customers in the market or her regular customers who has their own kiosk. Ni luh Murtini can buy about 30 kgs to 50 kgs of palm sugar with profit of Rp. 30,000 to Rp 50,000 per day. Through the non profit organization in her village, Ni luh Murtini received fund from DINARI. This fund is really useful for her to add her capital. She hopes that she can buy more palm sugar so that she can gain more profit. This job has support her life and her 2 children who has to live without their father.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Gula Merah adalah gula yang diolah secara tradisional yang bahan bakunya diambil dari sari pohon kelapa atau pohon aren. Jual beli Gula merah ini sudah lama ditekuni oleh Ni luh Murtini. Apalagi setelah suaminya meninggal dunia, pekerjaan inilah yang dapat mencukupi keperluannya sehari-hari. Penghasilan setiap harinya memang tidak besar, namun Ni luh Murtini tidak pantang menyerah dan tetap berusaha. Setiap hari Ni luh Murtini berkeliling untuk membeli gula merah yang nantinya akan dijual kembali kepada pelanggan –pelangganya baik yang ada di pasar maupun dari pelanggan yang ada di warung -warung. Dalam sehari Ni luh Murtini dapat membeli gula Merah sekitar 30 kg sampai 50 kg dengan keuntungan Rp 30.000 s/d Rp 50.000 perhari. Melalui lembaga di desanya, Ni luh Murtini mendapatkan dana dari Yayasan DINARI. Dengan modal inilah Ni luh Murtini sangat terbantu untuk menambah modal usahanya. Dengan harapan bisa membeli lebih banyak lagi Gula Merah dan keuntungannya pun bertambah. Dengan pekerjaan inilah Ni luh Murtini dapat mempertahan hidupnya dan juga kedua anaknya yang sudah menjadi yatim sejak ditinggal oleh ayah mereka.

loans.use: To add more capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal M. is a 24-year-old internally displaced person from Aghdam, Azerbaijan. His uncle passed down his knowledge of ceramic tile works. There’s demand for Vusal's work in the district where he lives. The problem is that he is using his uncle’s tools, which saw their good days years ago.  He is sure that the new tools he will buy with Kiva loan support will increase his productivity so he can make more money to support his family.  Vusal got married a year ago.

loans.use: Purchase of new tools to increase the speed of work and productivity

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mkama's Mena Group

texts.en:
Mkama J. W., age 43, is married and has 2 children (ages 12 and 6). He has a clothing business, which he began 8 years ago. He works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily, and he has been able to make a monthly profit of about US$34.

Mkama has taken out 1 previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his clothing business. He hopes to receive a new loan for further business expansion. Mkama will share this loan with his subgroup members, who have businesses in the sale of general store items, clothes, and furniture.

In the picture Mkama is in the middle of the back row.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Ni Luh Werni

texts.id:
Ni Luh Werni has started the kiosk business since 5 years ago. She sells various kinds of snacks, cookies, and staples. She needs quite a lot of capital to purchase the merchandise. After joining DINARI, Ni Luh Werni got trainings and opportunities to gain more capital to purchase more merchandise that she couldn't afford to buy before. Ni Luh Werni opens te kiosk from 6am until 6pm. Besides taking care of the kiosk, Ni Luh Werni also does the house work as the kiosk is located in front of her house. Ni Luh Werni replenishes the kiosk inventory once every 3 days. She bought them from the market which is quite far from her house using the transportation services provided in her village. Some of the merchandise are sometimes delivered to her place. She earns about Rp. 15,000 to Rp. 20,000 per day. With this revenue, she can cover her and her family (a husband and a child) daily expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Luh Werni menekuni usaha warung sejak 5 tahun yang lalu. Barang yang dijual meliputi aneka macam makanan ringan, kue dan juga keperluan sehari –hari. Modal yang diperlukan memang tidak sedikit untuk melengkapi keperluan usaha warungnya. Semenjak bergabung dengan DINARI Ni Luh Werni mendapat pembinaan dan mendapat kepercayaan sehingga memperoleh pinjaman dana yang dipergunakan untuk melengkapi keperluan usaha warungnya yang beberapa lalu belum terpenuhi. Ni Luh Werni membuka warungnya pada pukul 06.00 pagi dan ditutup pukul 06.00 sore. Selain menunggui warung Ni Luh Werni juga dapat mengerjakan pekerjaan lain dirumahnya sebab warungnya terletak didepan rumahnya.Untuk melengkapi warungnya Ni luh Werni setiap tiga hari berbelanja dipasar yang jaraknya lumayan jauh dari rumahnya dengan jasa transportasi yang ada didesanya, selain itu juga ada beberapa barang yang selalu diantar oleh sales ke rumahnya sehingga sangat membantunya. Pendapatan yang diperoleh dalam sehari mencapi Rp. 15.000,- sampai dengan Rp.20.000,- dengan keuntungan inilah Ni luh Werni mencukupi keperluan sehari-harinya bersama dengan suami dan seorang anaknya.

loans.use: To add more capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nhóm Chi Nghien - Cum Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Nghiên is 48. years old. She has 3 children. She raises pigs and sells grocery. Her husband works in their rice paddy. Their family income is 6.25 USD a day. She needs a loan to buy mash to feed her pigs.
Mrs Vân will use the loan to buy pig mash.
Mrs Ngà will use the loan to buy grocery to sell.
Mrs Bình will use the loan to buy chicken feed and pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nghiên 48 tuổi có 3 con đang đi học và đi làm. Chị làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt. Chồng chị làm ruộng và phụ giúp chăn nuôi. Thu nhập trung bình khoảng 100 000 đồng/ngày. Chị vay vốn để mua cám cho lợn ăn.
Chị Vân vay vốn để mua cám cho lợn.
Chị Ngà vay để bán hàng tạp hoá.
Chị Bình vay mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà.

loans.use: to buy pig mash, chicken feed, grocery

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Chuyên - Vọng Nguyệt - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Chuyên is 28, she raises pigs and sells grocery. Her husband is a construction worker. Her family income is 6.25 USD a day. She needs a loan to buy more piglets to raise.
Mrs Hà raises pigs as well. Her husband is a construction worker. She needs a loan to invest more into pigs raising.
Mrs Thế raises pigs and sells grocery.
Mrs Lợi and Hường need a loan to start raising livestock.
They all wish to obtain more loans after this one.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chuyên 28 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt. Chồng chị làm thợ xây, thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị là 100 000 đồng/ ngày. Chị muốn vay để thêm vốn chăn nuôi . Chị Hà làm nghề chăn nuôi, chồng chị làm thợ xây, chị muốn vay thêm để có vốn chăn nuôi. Chị Thế làm nghề chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ sắt, chị muốn vay vốn để chăn nuôi. Chị Lợi và chị Hường vay vốn để chăn nuôi.
Tất cả các chị đều thích được vay lâu dài.

loans.use: raise pigs

loans.name: Abdulstar

texts.en: Abdulstar lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated: he has a degree in business. He has a small business as a real estate agent, renting and selling houses. He has a good number of clients in Kabul, but he wants to enlarge his business so he has requested an individual loan to expand his business. He wants to help his family be well-cared for, and he is happy that he can further his business with this loan.

loans.use: to expand his little real estate business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. One of them is studying in secondary school, and the other one is in college. He is living in a rented house, and his elderly father lives with him. He has a carpentry shop and applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new wood and a machine for cutting the wood. He also wants to renovate his shop to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new wood and a machine for cutting the wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Koku's Subira Group

texts.en:
Koku A., age 29, is married and has 2 children (ages 6 and 12). She has a cake shop which she began 3 years ago. She works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily, and she has managed to make a monthly profit of around US$131.

Koku has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy equipment for making cakes. She hopes for a new loan to buy umbrellas for customers to sit under outside the café. Koku will share this loan with her subgroup members, who deal in selling charcoal, alcohol and soft drinks, food, hardware, and poultry.

In the picture Koku is second from the right in the front row.

loans.use: To purchase umbrellas for her cake shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cereals for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his green maize business.

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.en:
Lucía is in her early fifties, and she and her husband have six lovely children (four boys, two girls), all of whom go to school. Lucía owns and operates a small business that sells basic food products (e.g., rice, beans, vegetable oil, milk, etc.). After four laborious years operating this business, Lucía now has a loyal following of customers who visit her stall every day to buy her goods. The entrepreneur wants to improve upon her business by adding new merchandise so as to attract new customers and, ultimately, to increase her income so that her family can lead a comfortable lifestyle.

Lucía would like to receive this loan with four other entrepreneurs who live in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal: (1) María P., a 22-year-old mother of two sons, who would use her portion of the loan to purchase pants and men’s underwear to re-sell to members of the community; (2) Santa S., who would use her portion of the loan to purchase raw materials and ingredients to continue to produce her delicious empanadas; and (3) Cecilia S. T. and (4) Veronica S., who would use their loan portions to purchase clothing in bulk to replenish their respective businesses.

The members of this group guarantee the other members' loans. Accordingly, if one woman fails to repay her portion of the loan, the other members will assume that woman's obligations.

loans.use: To purchase of a wide variety of products (e.g., rice, beans, jewelry, and clothing) for the group members' businesses.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 31 years old and has three children (two boys, one girl), all of whom attend school.  Julia sells silver jewelry to women of the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal.  In addition, she sells ice cream in the afternoon. Julia explains that, after two arduous and laborious years, her business is relatively stable and profitable at the present time.  With additional profits from her business, she would like to buy furniture and a washing machine for her house.  The entrepreneur is seeking a loan to buy new items (such as necklaces, earrings, and bracelets) for her business.  Julia has recently acquired a small store for her business, so she needs to have as many goods as possible to exhibit in her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional silver jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her business.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru:
Ikrom A. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 28 years old, is married and has no children. He has finished high school.

Ikrom is a taxi driver. He has 4 years of experience. Currently, Irkom can not make profit with his business, because gasoline prices have increased. The client would like to install equipment for natural gas. This is the reason why Ikrom is applying for a loan. If the client installs natural gas equipment, then he will decrease the taxi fee. This will give people an opportunity to use his taxi at more affordable prices. Irkom plans to repay his loan within 7 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Абдуллоев Икром Бобоевич проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 28 лет, женат детей не имеет. Образование среднее.

Работает таксистом. Опыт в данной сфере 4 года. Данная деятельность перестала давать доход так как поднялись цены на бензин. Клиент хочет установить оборудование для природного газа. Поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит. Кроме того если клиент установит газовое оборудование , то в том случае цены на такси он снизит и это даст возможность населению передвигаться на такси по доступным ценам. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 7 месяцев.

loans.use: To install natural gas equipment

loans.name: Kumrigul

texts.ru:
Kumrigul K. lives in Yavan city. She is 43 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She has finished high school.

Kumrigul works at a market in Yavan where she sells cloth. She has been in this business for one year. Kumrigul provides her family with an income, which helps sustain it. With her loan she plans to purchase new goods. This will help increase the volume of sales and will ensure that there is enough cloth for sale on the market. Moreover, it will give buyers the opportunity to purchase goods without leaving the city. The client plans to repay her loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Курбоназарова Кумригул Исмоиловна проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 43 года. Замужем имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее.

Работает на рынке в городе Яван , торгует тканями. Занимается этим видом деятельности один год. Приносит доход своей семье, который помогает ее обеспечивать. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы завести новый товар. Это поможет увеличить объем продаж и позволит обеспечить рынки тканями, и делать покупки покупателям не выезжая за приделы города. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 46 year old grocery store owner. Hassan works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. This is the fourth time that Hassan has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. This time he needs to purchase merchandise for his business. Hassan is a good provider for his family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 32 year old man who is engaged to be married. Haytham is in the sanitary business. He lives in the Beirut suburbs. This is the second time that Haytham has applied for a loan at A. Majmoua. This time he needs to purchase merchandise for his business. The increased income generated by the loan will help him buy a bedroom for the new couple.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa Assalé is 32 years old, married and has three (03) children. Her husband barely gets by and has an irregular income. She buys sandals in the grand market in Lomé at wholesale prices, and then re-sells them at retail prices in the local market. She has been running this business for more than three years. The current loan will allow her to increase her stock in order to satisfy the demands of her clientele, and also to increase her income in order to continue contributing to the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Yawa Assalé est mariée et mère de 03 enfants et est agée de 32ans.Son mari se débrouille et a un revenu irrégulier. Elle achète des sandalettes au grand marché de Lomé en demi-gros qu'elle revend en détail au marché local. Elle exercerce cette activité depuis plus de trois ans. Le présent emprunt lui permettra d'augmenter son stock afin de satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle et augmenter son revenu afin de continuer à aider les charges familiales

loans.use: To buy sandals in Lomé for resale in Adéta

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is 25 years old. Khalil is a single young man who lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. Khalil sells home appliances. This is the second time that Khalil has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. The micro credits are helping him buy merchandise to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Fawzie

texts.en: Fawzieh is a 66 year old widow. Fawzieh works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Fawzieh owns a grocery store. This is the fifth time that Fawzieh has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abed El Nasser

texts.en: Abed El Nasser is a 37 year old father of 5. Abed El Nasser lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is in the motorcycle business. He offers maintenance services. He needs a loan to buy motorcycle parts to sustain and grow his workshop.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Bar Restaurant Kpalimeto Group

texts.fr:
Bar Restaurant Kpalimeto is a restaurant belonging to a group of 6 people, comprising 4 women and 2 young men. With this loan, the group plans to buy yams, which are the primary ingredient in the production of fufu, a dish preferred by the locals. Bar Restaurant Kpalimeto is situated in the middle of the local market. The income from this business allows the group members to contribute to the daily needs of their respective families.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

BAR RESTAURANT KPALIMETO est un restaurant appartenant à un groupement de 6 personnes dont 4 femmes et 2 garçons. Avec cet emprunt ce groupement désire acheter des ignames qui constituent la matière première de la production de fufu qui est un aliment très préféré des habitants de la localité. Le siège du BAR RESTAURANT KPALIMETO est situé au sein du marché. Avec le revenu de cette activité les membres participent au fonctionnement de leur foyer respectifs

loans.use: To buy 100 yam tubers and 2 goats for the production and sale of fufu (a staple food in West Africa)

loans.name: Abed El Hadi

texts.en: Abed El Hadi is a 39 year old father of 2. Abed El Hadi lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He works as a blacksmith. He needs to apply for a loan to buy tools for his business. Abed El Hadi wants to sustain and develop his workshop.

loans.use: To buy tools for his business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 61 year old father of 2. Mohamad lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He owns a sandwich restaurant. This is the fifth time Mohamad has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs to pay for the maintence of his restaurant.

loans.use: For the maintenance of his restaurant

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 44 years old and a father of 3. Mohamad lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He is a curtain tailor. This is the third time Mohamad has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Groupement Dzidudu

texts.fr:
The group Dzidudu was created three years ago and consists of three courageous women. They buy pagnes (printed fabric used for clothing) in Lomé and re-sell them at retail prices in the neighbouring villages of Adéta. With the income from this business, these three women contribute effectively to their household expenses. With the current loan, they would like to increase their stocks.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupement Dzidudu est crée depuis trois ans et compte trois femmes courageuses. Elles achètent les pagnes à Lomé et les revendent en détail dans les marchés des villages environnants d'Adéta . Avec le revenu tiré de l'activité ,ces trois femmes contribuent efficacement aux charges familiales. Avec le présent emprunt elles désirent augmenter leur stocks

loans.use: To buy 10 rolls of pagne (printed fabric) in Lomé and to re-sell them at retail prices in the local market

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hisham is 28 years old and a father of 3. Hisham lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He owns a grocery store. This is the first time Hisham has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is going to buy a coffee machine and a coffee roaster.

loans.use: To buy a coffee machine and a coffee roaster.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of school supplies, such as notebooks, pencils, pens, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha lives in "anticretico" [Translator's Note: an "anticretico" is a special rental agreement offered in Bolivia, see: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html] with her two children. Her home is located on Abdón Saavedra street, in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz. She works in promotions at an institution but her wages are very low. She decided to start selling clothes, perfumes, shoes, etc. to earn extra income since she is separated from her husband and she is the one who supports her children.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase merchandise and to offer more products.

Martha does not have a previous record with Impro, this will be her first loan, but the socio-economic analysis shows that she is capable of making the payments and supporting her family at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Martha vive en anticretico con sus dos hijos en la calle Abdón Saavedra de la zona de sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja como promotora en una Institución pero su sueldo es muy bajo por lo cual ella se dedicó también al comercio y vende ropa, perfumes, calzados, etc para aumentar sus ingresos ya que esta separada del esposo y ella mantiene a sus hijos.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar mercadería y poder surtir más sus productos.

No tiene antecedente con Impro; este será su primer crédito, pero el análisis socio económico muestra que ella es capaz de cumplir con los pagos y al mismo tiempo mantener a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as clothes, perfumes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Hajrija

texts.en: Hajrija was born in 1946 and she is divorced. She has a son who works as a builder and two more children. She took a loan  in the amount of $750 and she is going  to buy hay for her cow. She wants to earn some money  by selling milk products and with  that money  she wants to buy another cow.

loans.use: Buy another cow

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan works at ISECA, which is a technology institute where he teaches programming and computer classes. His home is located in the Zona Sur of the city of La Paz. His mother works as a caretaker at a public school in the same area of the city.

Juan is single and is the only person his mother can count on. He supports his family.

This is the third time that he requests a loan from IMPRO. His record classifies him as a "cliente 1" which means that he follows the terms of his loan and pays it accordingly.

This loan will be used to help him complete his college education and to buy a computer.

His credit record and his job allow him to qualify for this loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Juan trabaja en ISECA, es un instituto de aprendizaje de computación donde su labor es de docente y enseña paquetes de computación y programación.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Zona Sur de la ciudad de La Paz., ya que su madre es portera de un colegio fiscal de la zona sur.

Es soltero y el único apoyo de ayuda para su madre ya que el sustenta los gastos familiares de su casa. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.

El crédito será destinado para realizar sus estudios universitarios y comprar una computadora.

Su antecedente crediticio y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 38-year-old car mechanic. Anwar is married and has 4 children. He works and lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. This is the first time Anwar has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy material for his business. The increased income generated from the investment will be used for the maintenance of his house.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 24-year-old man. He works and lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. This is the first time Hussein has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy computers for his business. Hussein sells electrical appliances and computers, and repairs these items.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia earns a living selling perfumes and beauty products in offices, homes and businesses in the area of Villa Fátima of the city of La Paz. Her husband is a salaried public transportation driver. Their home is located in the area of Las Delicias, Ladera Norte of the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time that she requests a loan. Thanks to her record, she is classified as a "cliente 1" which means that she follows the terms of the loan and pays it accordingly.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics and an assortment of beauty products). Her work experience as a merchant and her credit record qualify her to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Delia trabaja como promotora de perfumes, se dedica a ofrecer sus productos en las oficinas, domicilios y negocios particulares por la zona de Villa Fátima de la Ciudad de La Paz, su esposo es chofer asalariado del transporte público.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Las Delicias Ladera Norte de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (Perfumes, cosméticos, y todo tipo de productos de belleza). Su trabajo y su historial crediticio le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como comerciante.

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes, cosmetics and other beauty products.

loans.name: Merima

texts.en: Merima was born in 1987 and she is married. Her husband  works as a waiter and his monthly income is US$ 188. They live with his mother  and their  only income source, beside his salary, is  his mother's pension. They have  a child one year old. She intends to buy chickens with this loan  in the amount  of US$ 750. Her wish  is to became  financially independent.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Hani
