texts.en: Hani is a 30-year-old electrician. He works and lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. This is the first time Hani has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy material for his business. The increased income generated from the loan will be used for the maintenance of his house.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
Junior Alarcón lives with his father in the Pasankeri area, ladera oeste of the city of La Paz. Junior works as a security guard for a company in that industry. His father is handing him over part of his land so that Junior can build his own house. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a new room on the aforementioned land.

This is the first time he requests a loan. The socio-economic analysis performed was favorable and qualifies him to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Junior Alarcón vive en casa de su padre en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. El señor Junior trabaja como empleado de seguridad en una empresa del ramo. Su padre le esta cediendo parte de su terreno para que el señor Junior pueda construir su vivienda propia. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación nueva en el terreno de su padre.

Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To build a room on land that his father is handing him over.

loans.name: Azab

texts.en: Azab is a 34-year-old woman. She works and lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Azab sells clothes. This is the first time Azab has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Fahima

texts.en: Fahima is a 59-year-old woman. She works and lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Fahima owns a grocery store. This is the second time Fahima applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Santa Catalina Poty Group

texts.en:
Celsa V. was the founder of this committee of women. She realized that there was a need for her women friends and neighbors to work together to augment their businesses and profits.

She went to the Fundación Paraguaya with her idea and a list of names and today eighteen women work together to gain loans and increase their businesses. Today the women are asking for a loan to buy different goods for their individual businesses. These businesses incluD. handicraft work, selling food goods and refreshments, and cleaning businesses.

loans.use: To buy clothes, different items to make handicrafts, material, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Mrs. Jesusa Q. lives in her own home in the Tupac Amaru zone of the city of La Paz with her husband, Mr. Jhony Morales and their four children. Mrs. Q. sells peanuts retail. Her husband transports meat from the municipal slaughterhouse to the various butcher shops in the neighborhood.

The requested loan will be used to construct a reinforced cement slab (cement and iron) and close frontal wall of the home.

This is the seventh time that Jesusa has requested a loan from Impro. The socioeconomic analysis carried out by Impro was favorable and has qualified Jesusa for the loan. She has been an Impro client since 2001.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Jesusa Q. vive en casa propia en la zona de Tupac Amaru de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Jhony Morales y sus cuatro hijos. La señora Jesusa Q. realiza la comercialización de maní al por menor. Y su esposo transporta carne del matadero municipal a las distintas carnicerías de barrio.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una losa de hormigón armado (cemento y fierro) y el cerramiento del muro frontal.

Esta es la séptima ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Es cliente de nuestra institución desde el año 2001.

loans.use: Construction of a cement slab reinforced by iron and construction of the frontal wall of  her home.

loans.name: Christina Songa Group

texts.en:
Christina S., age 28, is married and has 2 children (ages 4 and 2). She has a salon, which she began 1 year ago. She works from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily, and she has managed to make a monthly profit of about US$35.

She hopes for a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to improve her salon. Christina will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have a business selling alcohol, a business selling soft drinks, a kiosk, a café, and a business selling cosmetics.

In the picture Christina is in the middle in the front row.

loans.use: To improve the salon

loans.name: Sanya

texts.en: Sanya is a 55-year-old woman. She works and lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Sanya processes food and makes rose water and orange flower water. She wants to buy provisions to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima is a 48-year-old woman from Visoko. Her husband  has a full-time job in a textile and leather factory. His monthly income  is US$ 300. They have two children  and this is  her second loan  in the amount of  US$ 750. She wants to buy more livestock and she intends to  expand her business with livestock.

loans.use: Buy another cow

loans.name: Nisveta

texts.en: Nisveta was born in 1980 and she is from Ribnica, a small  place near Zavidovići. She is married  and her husband  is a demobilized soldier. He has a monthly income of US$ 113. They have two children, 6 months and 6 years old. This is her first loan in the amount  of US$ 825. Nisveta is going to use this loan  to buy hay for a cow and  some chickens  for breeding. She wants to keep  this cow  as an additional  income  resource for her  family.

loans.use: Buy hay for a cow

loans.name: Enida

texts.en: Enida is from Ribnica, a small village  near Zavidovići, and she is 21 years old. Her husband  is self-employed; he works in agriculture and drives a tractor. He can earn  about US$ 300 monthly. Enida lives  with her mother-in-law and  has one  child,  six months old. With this loan  in the amount  of US$ 825, they are going to buy  a binder  for their tractor in order to improve  their business and to be ready  for the spring  sowing.

loans.use: Buying a binder for their tractor

loans.name: Zainabu Maelwano Group

texts.en:
Zainabu A., age 32, is married and has 2 children (ages 11 and 2). She has a salon, which she began 2 years ago. She works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily, and she has been able to make a monthly profit of about US$44.

Zainabu has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy a dryer. Zainabu will share this loan with her subgroup members, who deal in selling food and running shops.

In the picture Zainabu is second from the left.

loans.use: To buy a dryer

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 24 years old and a married woman.  She is from  Potoci, a small town near  Mostar. She is  married  and together with her husband runs a coffee shop.  They have one child , 3 years old, and Aida  took this loan  in the amount of  US$ 750 to buy equipment  for their work.  Her wish is to  start  improving this business  that will  provide  her  with regular  income and employment.

loans.use: Buying equipment for their cafe

loans.name: Ximena

texts.es:
Ximena makes dough-based pastries including dough loops known as rosquillas, fried and honey-frosted dough known as tawas and filled empanadas, all of which she then markets in the schools and in her sales stall located on Luis Espina Street in El Alto. This business is her principal source of the income with which she helps her mother support her three youunger siblings. Her home is located in the Brasil zone of the city of El Alto.

She needs the loan to buy raw materials such as flour, oil, cooking fat and baking powder. Purchasing a larger quantity of raw material will allow her to satisfy her client's demand for her products.

This is Ximena's first loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out by Impro allowed the organization to approve Ximena's loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ximena elabora masitas (rosquillas, tawas y empanadas), mismas que comercializa en los colegios y en su puesto de venta ubicado en la Calle Luis Espina de El Alto; esta es su principal fuente de ingresos con los que ayuda a su madre a la manutención de sus tres hermanitos menores; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Brasil de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para la compra materia prima harina, aceite, manteca y royal; así poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado por Ximena.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, cooking fat, and baking powder for her business.

loans.name: Blas

texts.en:
Blas V. is married with three children. All of his children are young, two in school, and the eldest works with him in his convenience store. The convenience store added an auto service element and now brings in more income than ever. His wife Lourdes De Las is an optometrist and she helps bring in a lot of income.

Blas V. is asking for a loan today to help increase the amount of goods in his convenience store. His plan is to continue increasing the size of his store so that he may continue to increase his income. Blas wants to make sure that all three children will continue on to the university level and secure good jobs for their futures.

loans.use: To buy yerba, sugar, meta, dairy products, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is a dairy farmer. He sells his cows' milk to the industrial plant PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) Andina. His wife weaves shawls worn as part of the Bolivian cultural costumes known as cholitas. With these jobs the couple generates the income with which they support their 3 dependent children.

Francisco lives in the community of Huayrocondo, two hours from the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to buy a cow of a medium sized breed in order to increase milk production. This is Francisco's second loan with Impro. His good payment record qualifies him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco es productor de leche de vaca, la cual es comercializada a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), la esposa realiza tejidos de mantas para cholitas y de esta manera consiguen los ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus 3 hijos que depende de él y de su esposa.

Vive en la Comunidad de Huayrocondo (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta para otorgarle otro préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow of a high quality breed.

loans.name: Aldina

texts.en: Aldina is from  Vrapčići, a suburb  near Mostar. Aldina is  30 years old and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly income is US$ 375. They have one child, two years old. This is her first loan in the amount of US$ 750. She grows crops and does animal husbandry. Aldina intends to buy livestock and plant vegetables, because she thinks that she will expand her business and she will increase her household income by selling vegetables. She also wants to finish the building of her house.

loans.use: Buying livestock

loans.name: Esperanza's Group

texts.en:
This committee of fifteen women was formed recently by a group of women entrepreneurs. They work independently from one another in different businesses selling food, drinks, clothing, and items for the house. Although they have their independent businesses, they come together to ask for loans, support one another in their business plans, and also to make payments on their loans.

Today they are asking for a small loan to continue increasing their business ventures. All of the women will get a portion of the loan that they need and with it, they will buy things like food, refreshments, clothing, and goods for the home.

loans.use: To buy food, refreshments, clothing, and goods for the home to sell.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio lives in his own house on K street in the Alto Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz with his wife and two sons. He works repairing elevators on weekends. His wife works as a cook.

He is applying for a loan which he'll use to buy a motor and a vacuum, since he has started a carwash business near his home. The business is going well, but he does all the work manually. He wants to do a more professional job in order to grow his client base.

His credit history classifies him as a good client, approved to receive a new loan. He has been Impro's client since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Eusebio vive en casa propia en la calle K de la zona de Alto Llojeta de La Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus dos hijos; Eusebio trabaja reparando ascensores los fines de semana , la esposa trabaja como cocinera.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar un motor y una aspiradora ya que puso un negocio de lavado de autos cerca de su domicilio y le esta yendo bien, pero todo el trabajo lo realiza en forma manual y lo que el quiere es hacer un trabajo mas profesional y poder tener mas clientela.

Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase of a vacuum cleaner and a motor for his carwash business.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Daniela is a married 46 year old with 5 children, all of whom are students. She has spent about 15 years on her business, which consists of selling basic nutritious products, carbonated beverages, dairy products, personal hygiene products, and housecleaning products. Her small grocery store has been able to grow as a result of her efforts, and through the economic support of her husband, who works as a skilled construction worker. Her husband's work is not steady helps in the same way with house expenses.

The small grocery store has been the main source of fixed income in this family and with it they have been able to maintain themselves and live with dignity. At this time, Daniela reports there is not sufficient money to stock the grocery store and offer a significant variety in the products that she has in the store.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase Basic Grains, Meats, Vegetables, and Perishable Products

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Karla is single, living in the municipality of Ticuantepe, a department of Mangua, which is a rural community in which the economic activity done by poor people is the production of citrus fruits, garden vegetables, and the commerce of basic grains. For the past 5 years, Karla has had a small grocery store, in which she sells basic consumer products for families. Supplying to the poor people the products they need daily, through her business Karla has been building her house a little bit at a time. She now needs a loan in order to buy construction materials to raise a front wall of her house, which would give her more security both in her house and in her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials in order to raise a wall in her house

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
Mr. Jose has spent the past 12 years as a metallurgist, a trade in which he works independently in his neighborhood or in selected houses, as an expert in making windows, fixed glass and sliding glass doors, and designing and creating gates, among other skills he possesses as a bricklayer, welder, and specialist in working with glass and iron.

Jose is the provider of his household, in charge of paying for all basic living expenses. His spouse is a housewife and takes care of their two young children. At this time he is making a set of gates and doors for a home, which requires him to buy construction materials in order to do the work so that he can deliver the end-product in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials in order to invest them in his business

loans.name: Nubia Isabel

texts.es:
For the past 35 years, Mrs. Nubia has had a small neighborhood business which consists of selling nutritional products like basic grains, dairy products, perishables, house cleaning products, and personal hygiene products like deodorants, creams, perfumes, among other things. She has spent her whole life in this business, which has made it possible to educate her children and train them as professionals - a situation that she is proud of since today they are professionals and support themselves independently.

Mrs. Nubia works in her business all day long, from 6am to 9pm every day. This work routine helps maintain her energy and zest for living. The business has expanded and she has been successful in offering a diverse array of products to satisfy the needs of her customers, who for the most part are housewives. At this time, the small grocery store needs to stock up on the products that are in highest demand by customers. Customers buy what they need for their homes day by day, therefore the store needs to provide them what is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase of Perishable Products and Meats

loans.name: Korantetng

texts.en:
Korantetng S. is a 50 year-old building contractor. He is married and supports his six children.

Korantetng is currently building a hostel at Cape Coast University. His savings have been depleted trying to complete this hostel, so he is requesting $275 to purchase building supplies to complete the job. He hopes to have the hostel open to students by next semester.

Korantetng is the group leader of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase building supplies to complete construction of a student hostel.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa K. is a single hairdresser with one child. She is requesting $275 to purchase hairdressing products so she can meet the demand of her customers.

Theresa is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing products to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
"I haven't been able to finish building a room due to a lack of money. I really need to finish it so I can live in it. I only need to put in a concrete floor and plaster the walls. I'm asking for $1,200.00 in order to put a concrete floor in my room."

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

“Debido a la falta de dinero no he podido terminar la construcción de un cuarto, me urge terminarlo para poder habitarlo, ya que solo me falta la losa de concreto y enjarrar las paredes. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para poner la losa de concreto en un cuarto”.

loans.use: Installation of a concrete floor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a trader who deals in the selling of secondhand clothing. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She wants to increase her sales but lacks enough capital.

Mary is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more secondhand clothing to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more secondhand clothing to meet the demand from her customers.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.en:
María is a young and promising entrepreneur who lives in the Café community of Santo Domingo. She has been selling sneakers and shoes by catalogue for over a year. María explains that she doesn’t have a large stock of goods in her house. Instead, she buys products after her customers order them, which requires her to travel outside her community once a week.

María will use her loan to buy a large quantity of products ordered by her customers. She’ll also purchase some fashionable shoes and sneakers that she thinks people will love and buy.

María’s business supports the education of her two children.

loans.use: Purchase of a collection of sneakers and shoes for a small business.

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.en:
Carmen María sells men’s and women’s clothing in the Café community of Herrera, Santo Domingo. She lives close to La Pulga, the most famous street market in Santo Domingo. Swarms of people go to La Pulga every Sunday to purchase anything you could possibly need.

Carmen operates her business from her house during the week, but on Sundays she sets up a stall in La Pulga and offers her goods to the passers-by.

With her loan, Carmen will buy more clothing in bulk to replenish her stock so that she can continue selling her goods. It will help Carmen increase her income and improve the living conditions of her two children.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk to restock a small business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a chop bar operator who prepares food for sale. She is married and has five children. Business is doing very well and customer numbers have increased.

Elizabeth is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more foodstuffs for food production to meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more foodstuffs to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol owns and is the principal of a primary school in the Altagracia community of Herrera, Santo Domingo. Currently, she receives more than 500 children from the surrounding area who attend class in the school. María explains that not all parents have the means to pay for their children’s education, even though her school is not expensive. She also says that she employs 17 teachers and, every now and then, she needs to get the benches and blackboards repaired.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more school furniture because she thinks that the more comfortable the pupils are, the better they’ll be able to learn.

loans.use: To buy furniture for a school the entrepreneur manages.

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Rosa Yda

texts.en:
Rosa Yda sells a collection of necklaces, bracelets, earrings and trinkets to women of the Altagracia community of Santo Domingo. She has two boys and a girl; they all attend school.

Rosa dreams of having a small shop where she can operate her business. That way, she won’t have to walk along the streets offering her products, and customers will be able to make purchases more easily.

With her loan, Rosa will buy more goods in order to expand her stock and attract new customers.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry to move a small business forward.

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
"With some sacrifice I was able to install protective metal grilles in the windows of my house; but now I need to install a metal grille in my house's main entrance. The area where I live with my family is a little unsafe because there are many young vagrants who break into the houses to rob, so I decided to work to ensure my family's safety". I'm asking for $500.00 in order to install a protective metal grille in my house's main entrance.

Translate from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva Volunteer

“Con algunos sacrificios logre poner las protecciones a las ventanas de mi vivienda, pero ahora necesito poner reja en la puerta principal, este fraccionamiento en donde vivo con mi familia es un poco inseguro ya que hay muchos muchachos vagos que se dedican a robar en las casas así es que yo decidí poner a salvo a mi familia”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner reja en la puerta principal de mi vivienda

loans.use: To install a protective metal grille in my house's main entrance

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.en:
María Rosa is in her early forties. She and her husband have two girls aged twenty-two and fifteen, both of whom study. María describes herself as an experienced entrepreneur. She explains that she has great abilities to convince people, and says that she’ll manage to be successful in any business she begins.

María explains that her husband’s salary is not enough to bear all of the family’s expenses. So, in order to help her husband improve their financial standing, María plans on using her loan to start a small business. She’ll be selling silver jewelry and underwear to women of the Altagracia community of Santo Domingo. María hopes her business’ success will help her provide a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry and underwear for a small business.

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo G. and his wife both work in the area of sales. He sells clothing items to support his family. He has two children who are both in elementary school. A few years ago, Gustavo purchased a spot to open a business in the center of town, and has since been very successful with his business.

He is asking for a loan today so that he may invest in new clothing. With the changing of both the seasons and the preferences of the customers, he must be able to satisfy the constantly changing fashions styles. He works so that his family can have the best quality of life.

loans.use: To buy different pieces of clothing like t- shirts, shorts, blouses, pants and jeans

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
"I have been building a small room on my land for a few months, but I had to stop building it due to the lack of money. I'm going to go on with the construction again even if it's little by little, because I really need to finish the room so my son can live in it". I'm asking for $700.00 in order to finish building the room.

Tranlated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo en construcción un cuarto pequeño dentro de mi terreno pero hace algunos meses pare la construcción debido a la falta de dinero, pero ya voy a empezar otra ves aunque sea poco a poco ya que necesito terminar ese cuarto para que mi hijo pueda habitarlo” Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Finish building a room

loans.name: Ida's Group

texts.en:
This committee of 18 working women began with the efforts of the group leader Julia Benitez. She gathered some of her friends, presented them with the idea of taking out a loan together through the Fundación Paraguaya, and they in turn got some of their friends. Now their group is large and the women are working well together.

They hope to secure a loan together to help augment their businesses. Everything from gardening businesses, to baking, and selling clothes. These women, although separate, are very united. They trust one another and their dependence ensures that all the payments are made on time.

loans.use: To buy a large variety of things: clothing, fabric, buttons, hair products, Campos, and conditioners, plants, gardening tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel G. is married with four children and a successful business. He is a carrier and uses his truck to transport goods for people without access to vehicles. Since his truck is refrigerated, he mostly transports food goods.

Miguel has opened a small meat shop in his house which his mother helps to run. Over the years both of his businesses have gained great reputations and business. Along with his transportation business and his small butcher shop, Miguel also founded a social dining hall for the children in extreme poverty. His dining hall can accommodate over 70children.

The loan he is asking for today is for another project he is investing in to amplify the space of his business. He will invest in a bigger plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Thank you for the first loan. We now have the refrigerator that we needed to sell dairy products and cold meats, so my business bring in more income and my family are not in need of anything. We are seeking a loan of $1200 to expand the business since it is small and we are unable to put all of the merchandise on display.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Gracias por el primer préstamo ya tenemos el refrigerador que nos estaba haciendo falta para la venta de lactaos y carnes frías así tenemos mas ingreso la negocio y a mi familia no les esta haciendo falta ampliar mas el negocio. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para ampliar el negocio ya que esta algo reducido y la mercancía no lo podemos poner todo en exhibición. En el negocio trabajamos mi esposa y yo ella se queda cuando yo boy a surtir mas mercancía.

loans.use: To expand the business to better display merchandise.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is thirty-seven years old, married, and has a fifteen year old son. She works half time as an employee in a house cleaning and cooking, and the rest of her time is dedicated to selling household goods. She sells pasta, rice, sugar, Yerba, flour, eggs, detergents, small tools, and refreshments. On the weekends she works in a salon as a hairdresser.

Narcisa is a very busy mother, but she must do what she can to bring in enough money to support her small family. Her husband works with her as well. He watches the store in the day and on the weekends, while she works in the private residence and in the salon, and during the nights he does electrical work.

The money will be used to keep their convenience store in business. She will buy food, cleaning supplies, hair products, and other necessities to sell.

loans.use: She will buy food, cleaning supplies, hair products and other necessities to sell.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Gracias por su apoyo para comprar un equipo y herramienta nueva. Hoy estoy solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancía para la peluquería y acondicionarla mejor el local para esta temporada de calor y para que los clientes estén más cómodos al esperar su turno. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls Para la comprar mercancía y acondicionar el local.

Thank you for your support to purchase equipment and new tools.  Today I am seeking a loan to buy merchandise for the barbershop and better air-condition the shop for the heat this season and so that clients are more comfortable while waiting their turn.  I am seeking a loan of $1200 to buy merchandise and better air-condition the location.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and better air-condition the location.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan Bernardo I. is a fifty-eight year old man who is married with four children. Three of them are married and live independently and one is still living at home while he is attending university. Juan still helps his son pay for the school bill.

Juan’s business is selling food like rice, mayonnaise, sugar, flour, and other necessities. He sells his goods to different businesses along with the military and police offices nearby. He is asking for a loan today so that he will be able to buy more of these items in bulk, and offer them at lower prices to the businesses where he sells his merchandise.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and packets of mayonnaise by the box.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Gracias por su apoyo ya pude comprar el congelador que necesitaba para poder vender carne. Con este tengo mas ingreso a la casa. Ahora estoy solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la comprar de mercancía para el negocio de abarrotes y solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para la comparar de mercancía.

Thanks to your support I was able to buy the freezer that I needed to sell meat. With this, I have more income in my household. Now, I am seeking a new loan to buy merchandise for the grocery business and I am seeking a loan of $1200 to compare merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a mixed pack of adult clothing.

payments.comment: El pago real es de $18.75 dólares.
La cuota real es de $ 18.75 dólares.
La cuota real es de $ 18.75 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 18.75 dólares

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy one pack of mixed adult clothing and one pack of fisherman clothes.

payments.comment: El pago real es de $37.50 dólares
El pago real es de $ 37.50 dólares .
El pago real es de $ 37.50 dólares.
La cuota real es de $ 37.50 dólares
La cuota real es de US$ 37.50

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Señora Leticia R. Solano is 63 years old. She studied only until the third grade of primary school. She has six children but only one still depends on her. She lives in Poblado Menor "Cuyuchugo" of the district of Usquil in La Libertad, Perú

Ever since she became independent, Señora Leticia searched for a way to advance herself. She began selling fruits throughout different parts of the nearby mountains. Little by little she offered a greater variety of fruits and made a little bit of capital. In this way she was able to begin another business in selling clothes. This business she has kept to this day. On a simple sewing machine she makes aprons, skirts, and vests for selling on foot throughout Otuzco.

She is a member of the communal bank "San Juan de Miraflores" through which she received her first loan of 300 Soles. She used this money to buy fabrics.

With the loan of 900 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy fabrics, threads, and zippers for the manufacture of aprons and vests.

Señora Leticia dreams of growing her business and having a greater variety of merchandise to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Leticia R. Solano tiene 63 años de edad, estudió sólo hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Tiene 6 hijos pero solo uno depende de ella. Vive en el Poblado Menor “Cuyuchugo” del Distrito de Usquil de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad - Perú

Desde que se independizó la señora Leticia buscó la manera de salir adelante. Se inició vendiendo frutas por diferentes partes de la sierra cercanas a su caserío; poco a poco fue teniendo mayor variedad de frutas, hizo un pequeño capital y de esa manera pudo emprender otro negocio que es la venta de ropa, este negocio lo mantiene hasta la fecha. En una sencilla máquina de cocer confecciona mandiles, faldas, vestidos para luego venderlos en condición de ambulante por toda la provincia de Otuzco.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” en el cual recibió su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 , este dinero lo empleo en comprar telas.

Con el préstamo de S/900.00 que cancelará en 4 meses comprará telas, hilos y cierres para la confección de mandiles y vestidos.

Sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener variedad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy fabric, threads, and zippers for the manufacture of articles of clothing.

loans.name: Marina Martina

texts.es:
Señora Marina Martina García Gonzáles is fifty years old. She studied up until the fourth grade of primary school, because her parents didn't have sufficient means. She has three children but only two are stil under her care. She lives in Poblado Menor "Cuyuchugo" of the district of Usquil in La Libertad, Perú.

She is dedicated to buying and selling clothes for gentlemen and ladies like dress coats, sweaters, and pants, which she buys in bulk to sell and obtain a profit. Furthermore, Señora Marina manufactures aprons, skirts, and vests; many of these are orders from clients that she has won over time.

She comes to Chota and San Agustín to offer her products to the residents of La Libertad.

Her business began twenty years ago with fruit sales, travelling through various parts of the Liberteña mountains. Little by little she became known and gained various clients this way, who made clothing requests and so she began to sell those products. After that she began delivering in great quantities, not only clothing orders that she bought, but also clothes that she made.

Señora Marina is a member of the communal bank "San Juan de Miraflores" where she obtained her first loan of 300 Soles. With this money she bought fabric, threads, and oil for her sewing machine.

With the loan of 1700 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy fabrics, threads, and a half dozen sweaters and dress coats.

Her great longing is to have a vehicle in which she can transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Marina Martina García Gonzáles tiene 50 años de edad, ella estudió hasta el cuarto grado de primaria porque sus padres no tuvieron mayores posibilidades. Tiene 3 hijos, pero sólo 2 aún están a su cargo. Vive en el Poblado Menor “Cuyuchugo” del Distrito de Usquil de la Provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para caballeros y damas tales como casacas, chompas y pantalones, los cuales compra al por mayor para venderlos por unidades y así obtener ganancias. Además la señora Marina confecciona mandiles, faldas y vestidos; muchos de éstos son pedidos que le hace su clientela que ha conseguido con el tiempo.

Sus productos los viene ofreciendo por los caseríos de Chota y San Agustín pertenecientes a la provincia de Julcán, departamento de La Libertad.

Su negocio lo inició hace 20 años con la venta de frutas, viajaba por varias partes de la sierra Liberteña. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y de esta manera obtuvo varios clientes quienes le hacían algunos pedidos de ropa y así empezó a vender estos productos. Posteriormente llevaba en mayor cantidad, no solo pedidos de ropa que ella compraba para vender, sino también ropa que ella confeccionaba.

La señora Marina es integrante del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” en donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, con este dinero compró telas, hilos y aceite para su maquina de cocer.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00, que cancelará en 4 meses comprará telas, hilos, y media docena de chompas y casacas.

Su mayor anhelo es tener un vehículo en el que pueda trasladar su mercadería.

loans.use: With the loan she wants to buy fabrics, threads, and oil for her sewing machine

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Señora Estela is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa de Lima." She lives in the region of San Martín in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located at 698 Jr. Pajatén, where she is dedicated to selling groceries.

Thanks to her effort and the support of her husband she has succeeded in increasing her business. At the beginning, she had a small shop, which has continued growing little by little.

With the loan of 3000 Soles, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy products of everyday needs like sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, oil, noodles, etc.

Señora Estela is 48 years old and lives alone with her husband. She works daily to continue forward and to be able to have a life worthy of a hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Estela pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en Jr. Pajatén No. 698 se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y el apoyo de su esposo ha logrado incrementar su negocio, al principio contaba con un pequeño local el cual ha ido creciendo de a pocos

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara productos de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, de azúcar, cajas de leche, aceite, fideos, etc.

La señora Estela tiene 48 años, vive sola con su esposo, trabaja diariamente para salir adelante y poder tener una vida digna de una mujer trabajadora

loans.use: With the loan she wants to buy products that are everyday necessities.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Señora Judith is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa de Lima". She lives in the region of San Martín in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located at 390 Prolongación Dos de Mayo Esquina and she is dedicated to selling groceries.

Thanks to the support of her husband and her kids she succeeded in increasing her business little by little. At the beginning it was small, but now she has many clients thanks to her competitive prices.

With the loan of 3000 Soles, which she will pay back in six months, she will buy various products of everyday needs like sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, olive oil, preserves, etc., in order to satisfy the needs of her clients who live in her neighborhood and community.

Señora Judith is 31 years old and lives with her husband and her kids. She works daily to show that there are no limits to reaching her goals and she can reach all of them with effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en la Prolongación Dos de Mayo Esquina P. Aguirre No. 390 y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos logró aumentar su negocio poco a poco ya que al principio era pequeño, tiene mucha clientela gracias al precio competitivo con que vende sus productos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual pagara en 6 meses, comprará productos variados de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche,aceite, conservas ,etc para satisfacer así las necesidades de sus clientes que viven en su barrio y la comunidad.

La señora Judith tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que para cumplir las metas no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: With the loan she wants to buy products that are everyday necessities.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa T. V. belongs to the "Women in Action" Banco Comunal in Picota. She lives in the San Martín region of the Picota province in the district of Picota. Her business is loacted at 236 Jr. Bolognesi and she makes and sells bread and other staple products.

She started this business in order to earn more income and to improve her family's quality of life.

With this loan of 2000 soles, which she will repay over 6 months she will buy sacks of flour, butter, milk, sugar and other ingredients to make bread and thus meet the needs of the members of her community.

Rosa is 36 years old, lives with her husband and has 4 children. Two of her children live with her and two are pursuing higher education in the country's capital.

Her dream is to have a large bakery where she will offer the widest variety of breads and pastries to her distinguished clientèle.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa T. V., pertenece al B.C. “Mujeres en Acción” de Picota, vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi 236 y se dedica a la producción/venta de pan y otros productos de primera necesidad.

Ella emprendió este negocio con la finalidad de tener mayores ingresos, para brindarle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.

Con el crédito de S/.2000.00, que devolverá en un plazo de 6 meses, comprara sacos de harina,, mantecas, leches, azúcar y demás insumos para la elaboración de pan y de esa manera satisfacer las necesidades de los pobladores de la localidad.

La señora ROSA tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 viven con ella, y 2 están realizando sus estudios superiores en la capital del país.

Su sueño es tener una gran panadería donde oferte la más grande variedad de panes y postres a su distinguida clientela.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Mrs. Aurora belongs to Las Dinamicas Communal Bank, located in the CFB. KM 5, in the district of Calleria, the state of Ucayali. Aurora is 46 years old, she is the mother of 2 children. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in the wood business. Nowadays she says that with the wood business and a lot of strength it has been growing, also she opened a sewing workshop where she dedicates herself to the tailoring of lingerie. Thanks to her perseverance she is obtaining all of her goals. With the loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in wood and also a bit in the lingerie tailoring. Aurora is a hardworking woman and she is happy with what she has achieved in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Aurora pertenece al banco comunal Las Dinámicas, ubicado en la CFB. Km. 5, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Aurora tiene 46 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decidió invertir en el negocio de la madera. En la actualidad cuenta con el negocio de madera que con mucho esfuerzo ha ido creciendo, también abrió un taller de costura donde se dedica a la confección de lencerías. Gracias a su perseverancia está logrando todos sus objetivos. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en madera y también un poco en la confección de lencería. Aurora es una mujer muy trabajadora y está feliz por lo que está logrando en su vida.

loans.use: Will be invested in wood and the sewing of lingerie

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Mrs. Barbara belongs to the Bellavista Communal Bank, located at 367 Jr. Roca Fuerte Avenue, in the district of Calleria, the state of Ucayali. Barbara is 42 years old, she is the mother of 4 children and is separated. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in the sale of food. Nowadays she continues selling food, which has grown in earnings and it is due to the rich maturity that her food has. Barbara wakes up very early to go to the market, later in the mornings she dedicates herself to the preparation of her foods and at night, with the help of her children, she leaves to sell her product. With the loan of 1700 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy plates, forks, tables, seats, tablecloths and the rest of the capital she will designate to the daily purchase of the supplies. Barbara has a rough routine everyday, but without it she couldn’t take care of her family life. She has always had the thought in her mind to better her business with the sale of food and she hopes to continue this with the support of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bárbara pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Roca Fuerte N° 367, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años, es madre de 4 hijos y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. En la actualidad continua con la venta de comida, la cual ha crecido en ganancias y ello debido a la rica sazón que tiene. Barbara se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado, luego en las mañanas se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas y por las noches, con la ayuda de sus hijos, sale a vender su producto. Con el préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará platos, tenedores, mesas, sillas, manteles y el resto de capital lo destinó para la compra diaria de los víveres. Bárbara tiene una rutina muy agitada todos los días, pero aún así no descuida su vida familiar. Siempre tiene en mente ampliar su negocio con la venta de comidas y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase plates, forks, tables, seats, etc.

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Mrs. Camila belongs to the Loreto Communal Bank, located at 344 Jr. Comandante Suarez Avenue, in the district of Calleria, the state of Ucayali. Camila is 27 years old, she is the mother of 1 young son and her husband is a merchant. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in a small store in her residence. Nowadays she talks about her store. Camila wakes at 6 AM to prepare breakfast for her son and husband and later tends to the store until 8 PM. With the loan of 1200 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, 2 packages of noodles, chicken, shampoo, soap, vegetables, etc. Camila with insistence and dedication is succeeding with her business. Her son is well and her husband helps and he makes her happy.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Camila pertenece al banco comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez N° 344, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años, es madre de un hijo menor de edad y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en una pequeña bodega en su domicilio. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega. Camila se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y el de su esposo, luego atiende la bodega hasta las 8.00 p.m. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 paquetes de fideos, pollos, shampoo, jabón, verduras, etc. Camila con empeño y dedicación está saliendo adelante con su negocio. Su hijo está bien y su esposo la apoya y ello la hace muy feliz.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Esther Teolinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Esther belongs to Las Dinamicas Communal Bank, located at 1 Masisea Mz G Lt. Avenue, in the district of Calleria, the state of Ucayali. Esther is 38 years old, she is the mother of 2 children and her husband is a mechanic. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in the business of lubricants for cars and motorcycles. Nowadays her business has grown and now she says that they offer more services. She says her husband helps and works with her and her children, but they always take time to share a moment with the family. With the loan of 2000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of chains, spotlights, wheels, tires and chambers. Esther feels proud to be a businesswoman and she wants to share her story with all women so that they feel capable of creating their own business and they feel good about themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther pertenece al banco comunal Las Dinámicas, ubicado en la Av. Masisea Mz G Lt. 1, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Esther tiene 38 años, es madre de 2 hijos y su esposo es mecánico, Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decidió invertir en el negocio de lubricantes para motos y motocarros. En la actualidad el negocio creció y ya cuenta con mas servicios que ofrecer. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja con ella y el de sus hijos, pero siempre se da un tiempo para compartir un momento en familia. Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000 soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses invertirá en la compra de cadenas, catalinas, focos, piñones, llantas y cámaras. Esther se siente muy orgullosa de ser una mujer empresaria y quiere compartir su historia con todas las mujeres para que se sientan capaces de crear su propio negocio y sentirse bien consigo misma.

loans.use: To purchase chains, spotlights, wheels, tires, chambers, etc.

loans.name: Heidi Thalia

texts.es:
Mrs. Heidi belongs to the Loreto Communal Bank, located at 620 Jr. Comandante Suarez, in the district of Calleria, the state of Ucayali. Heidi is 27 years old, she is the mother of 1 son and her husband works in a sawmill. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in selling food. Nowadays she dedicates herself to the sale of food and all the sales as earnings have grown due to the demand that her products have. With the loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of goods such as chickens, pants, skirts, shoes, cosmetics etc and other parts of the capital she will invest in the supplies for selling food. Heidi is content to have the opportunity to work with Maunela Ramos because it has allowed her to further support her husband and the desire to continue bettering her situation.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Heidi pertenece al banco comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez N° 620, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Heidi tiene 27 años, es madre de 1 hijo y su esposo trabaja en un aserradero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela de S/. 300.00 decidió invertir en la venta de comida. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida y tanto las ventas como las ganancias han aumentado debido a la gran demanda que tienen sus productos. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en mercadería como polos, pantalones, faldas, zapatos, cosméticos, etc. y otra parte del capital lo invertirá en los víveres para la venta de sus comidas. Heidi está contenta por tener la oportunidad de trabajar con Manuela Ramos porque de esta manera podrá salir adelante con el apoyo de su esposo y las ganas que posee para seguir surgiendo.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, pants, skirts, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Helen Joice

texts.es:
Mrs. Helen belongs to La Positiva Communal Bank, located at 47 Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Mesa, in the district of Calleria, the state of Ucayali. She is 33 years old, she is the mother of 2 children she is married and her husband is a fisherman. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in selling fish. Nowadays she continues selling fish, but she has formalized a fixed place for selling. She wakes up at 4 AM to go to sell the fish and in the afternoons she dedicates herself to caring for her children and domestic chores. With the loan of 1500 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of more fish, she will remodel her selling post and also she use part of the loan on the education of her children. Helen is very grateful to Maunela Ramos for all her support, because through the loan she has been successful and been able to obtain good things for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

.La señora Helen pertenece al banco comunal La Positiva, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Mesa Nº 47, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es casada y su esposo es pescador. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescados. En la actualidad continúa con la venta de pescado, pero ya formalizada en un puesto de venta. Se levanta a las 4 a.m. para ir a vender su pescado y en las tardes se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y a las labores domésticas. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de más pescados, remodelará su puesto de venta y también parte del préstamo lo designará para la educación de sus hijos. Helen está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado, porque a través de los préstamos ha surgido y ha podido lograr muchas cosas buenas para ella y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase fish. To remodel her selling post.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Mrs. Irene belongs to The Pearls of Pucallpa Comunal Bank, located at 546 Saenz Pena Avenue, district of Calleria, state of Ucayali. Irene is 50 years old and is the mother of 4 children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in the sale of sodas. Nowadays, with a lot of strength in this endeavor, Irene has been able to start a store. Together with her children she tends to the store and her husband also helps when he has time. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which she will pay in 5 months, she will invest in products such as rice, sugar, milk, preservatives, etc, and in this manner she will be able to better supply her store. Irene is in the stage of her life that she feels most secure, she has been able to consolidate a business that is the economic sustenance of her family and working with Manuela Ramos is a great help to working women.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Irene pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Perlas de Pucallpa, ubicado en la Av. Sáenz Peña N° 546, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Irene tiene 50 años y es madre de 4 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad, con mucho esfuerzo y empeño, Irene logra poner una bodega. Junto con sus hijos atiende la bodega y su esposo también la apoya cuando hay tiempo. Con préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, conservas, etc, y de esa manera poder surtir más su bodega. Irene está en una etapa de su vida que se siente más segura, logró consolidar un negocio que es sustento económico de su familia y manifiesta que trabajar con Manuela Ramos es una ayuda mas para las mujeres trabajadoras.

loans.use: To purchase groceries (rice, sugar, milk, perservatives, etc.)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. Isabel belongs to La Positiva Communal Bank, located at 8 Jr. Alfonso Ugarte St., district of Calleria, state of Ucayali. Isabel is 53 years old and is the mother of 7 children. With the first loan of 300 soles she decided to invest in the purchase of fruit for selling, beginning with a table in the doorway of her home. Nowadays, she sells fruits in her own post in a crowded market in the city. She wakes up at 4 AM in order to go to her place trying to sell, if possible, all the fruit. In the afternoons she dedicates herself to caring for her house and tending to her children whom she helps when she can. With the loan of 1500 soles, which she will pay in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of various fruits. Isabel feels satisfied with the support that Manuela Ramos has given her and is very happy because her daughter successfully finished her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel pertenece al banco comunal La Positiva, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra. N° 8, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Isabel tiene 53 años y es madre de 7 hijos. Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la compra y venta de frutas empezando con una mesa en la puerta de su vivienda. En la actualidad vende frutas en un puesto de venta propio en un mercado muy concurrido de la cuidad. Se levanta a las 4 a.m. para ir a su puesto de venta y vender si es posible todo la fruta. En las tardes se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y atender a sus hijos quienes cuando pueden la ayudan. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de una variedad de frutas. Isabel se siente satisfecha con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos y está muy feliz porque su hija culminó con éxitos sus estudios.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Mrs. Karina belongs to The Pearls of Pucallpa Communal Bank, located at 206 Jr. Libertad St., in the district of Calleria, the state of Ucayali. Karina is 23 years old, she is the mother of 1 son and her husband is a professional. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles she decided to invest in a beauty salon. Nowadays she has a beauty salon where in an organized manner she tends to it and also her domestic chores. With the loan of 1800 soles, which she will pay in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of liquids, dyes, nail polishes, shampoo, creams, etc. Karina is a young mother, and because of her desire to contribute to the economic expenses of her family she decided to start a business. Now she feels more peaceful because in the future she will be able to give her child a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

.La señora Karina pertenece al banco comunal Las Perlas de Pucallpa, ubicado en el Jr. Libertad N° 206, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Karina tiene 23 años, es madre de 1 hijo y su esposo es profesional. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decidió invertir en un salón de belleza. En la actualidad tiene un salón de estética y de belleza donde de manera muy organizada lo atiende y no descuida las labores domésticas. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,800 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en comprar líquido ondulante, tintes, esmaltes, shampoo, cremas, etc. Karina es una madre muy joven, y por el deseo de contribuir a los ingresos económicos de su familia decidió poner un negocio. Ahora se siente mas tranquila porque en el futuro podrá darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: To purchase liquids, dyes, nail polishes, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Señora Ligia is a member of the communal bank Las Perlas de Pucallpa, located on Avenue Sáenz Peña in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. Ligia is 51 years old and a mother of three daughters. With her first loan of 300 Soles she decided to invest in clothing sales.

Presently she continues with the clothing business, buts she also sells OmniLife products. Since her children are already independent and she is separated, she is dedicated to the business for which she must go out a lot to offer products and gain more earnings.

With the loan of 1000 Soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will invest in purchasing clothes and also buying products of OmniLife.

Ligia is a mother who found out how to help her daughters move ahead in life, and although in difficult moments she had to fight, she never surrendered. Now her daughters support her and she feels peaceful and good about her self.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ligia pertenece al banco comunal Las Perlas de Pucallpa, ubicado en la Av. Sáenz Peña N° 469, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Ligia tiene 51 años y es madre de 3 hijas. Con su primer préstamo de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la venta de ropas.

En la actualidad continúa con el negocio de ropa, pero también vende productos omnilife. Como sus hijos ya son independientes y ella es separada se dedica a los negocios para lo cual tiene que salir mucho para ofrecer y tener más ganancias.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa y también invertirá en la compra de productos omnilife.

Ligia es una madre que supo sacar adelante a sus hijas y aún en los momentos más difíciles que tuvo que atravesar nunca sé rindió y ahora sus hijas la apoyan y se siente más tranquila y bien consigo misma.

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim N. lives in the village of Khpob Veng in the province of Kandal in Cambodia. She has one child. She sells the vegetables that her husband, Mr. Yeth Khlong, grows on their farm. In order to help her husband support their large family, she always works hard everyday.

She needs a loan of $800.00 to buy a new motorcycle to transport the vegetables to the market more efficiently. The loan will also help to repair her old house. She appreciates HKL for their support because she will be able to improve her family’s living conditions, and she promises to be accurate in her loan payment.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to transport vegetables to the market

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim C. is 44 years old and works as a fish seller at Takmoa market in the Takmoa District of the Kandal province. She has two children who are both in school. Her husband, Mr. Nhoem Sarith, is 50 years old and works as a vegetable farmer. To earn a living for their family, Yim and her husband work very hard everyday. Because of their business, their children can now continue to study.

Yim needs a loan of $1000.00 to buy a new motorcycle to transport fish and vegetables to the market more efficiently. She has proven to be a reliable client of HKL in the past. And she thanks HKL for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.

Her husband is pictured in the photo because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to transport fish and vegetables to the market

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon P. is 37 years old and works as a teacher at Check Angre secondary school in the Takmoa district of the Kandal province. Her husband, Mr. Chhan Vanthan, is 44 years old and drives a motorcycle taxi. They have two children who are both in school. To earn a living for their family, Yon and her husband work hard everyday.

Yon is requesting $1100.00 in order to build a fifteen-room house that she can then rent to customers. She has proven to be a reliable client of HKL. And she thanks HKL for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.

loans.use: To build a fifteen-room house to rent to customers

loans.name: Chov

texts.en:
Mrs. Chov S. is 24 years old and works as a noodle seller. She is single and lives with her parents in Kruos village in the Kandal province. Her mother, Mrs. Nov Savan, is a grocer and her father, Mr. Chea Choa, is a farmer. To contribute to the family’s living expenses, they try to work very hard everyday.

Chov has successfully completed a loan with HKL for two cycles and has proven to be a reliable client. She is now requesting a loan for $1200.00 to build a gate around her house to protect her business and her family. She appreciates HKL for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.

loans.use: To build a gate around the house to protect the business and the family

payments.comment: This is final repayment earlier than original repayment schedule because her business is going well. She said \" thank you so much for your laon\"

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thun S. is 30 years old. She supervises the guesthouse in front of the Lux Cinema in Phnom Penh City. Her husband, Mr. Vann Syden, is also a supervisor and takes care of three children. Together, they can earn a basic salary of about $150.00 per month.

Mrs. S. and her husband work very hard everyday to cover their family’s expenses. They have also successfully completed a loan with HKL.

In order to raise her income level and improve her family’s living conditions, Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of $700.00 to purchase a clothing store in the Bom Beak market. She appreciates HKL for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.

Her husband is pictured in the photo because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a store to sell clothes

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Kình - Tiên Trà - Trung Nghĩa Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Kình is 52. She is a state employee. She also works on her rice field, raises livestock, makes rice cakes to sells. She is married and has 2 children. Her family income is 12.50 USD a day. She needs a loan to expand her business.
Mrs Thuỷ is a farmer, she raises poultry and sells grocery. She needs a loan to buy chicken feed.
Mrs Hường is a farmer, she raises livestock and sells grocery. She applies for a loan because she likes SEDA's the loan condition.
Mrs Thêu is a farmer. She also works as a laborer for hire. She applies for a loan because SEDA makes it simple to borrow.
Mrs Đang is a farmer. She raises livestock and sells grocery. She likes the idea of making weekly payment.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Kình, 52 tuổi là cán bộ phụ nữ thôn, ngoài làm ruộng, chăn nuôi chị còn làm các loại bánh tẻ, bánh chưng để bán.Chị đã có chồng và hai con.Thu nhập bình quân của nhà chị là 200 000 - 300 000 đồng/tuần. Chị muốn vay để tăng vốn cho chăn nuôi và làm bánh. Chị Thuỷ làm ruộng, nuôi gà để bán, và đi chợ đồng nát. Chị muốn vay vốn để mua thức ăn cho gà. Chị Hường làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và đi chợ đồng nát. Chị muốn vay vốn vì rất thích hình thức trả góp của chương trình. Chị Thêu làm ruộng và đi làm thêm. Chị vay vốn vì thích thủ tục thuận tiện nên tham gia chương trình. Chị Đang làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và đi chợ. Chị thích được trả góp nên tham gia chương trình.

loans.use: buy chicken feed, pig mash, merchandise

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en:
I am Balqees B. from a mid-size town, Multan, Pakistan. My husband transports goods on his donkey cart. His donkey died few days ago and now we need to buy a new donkey. I plan to save some of our profits to collect dowry for my daughter’s marriage.

I would like to borrow in a group and my group members are: Nasreen B. who is borrowing for her family’s soft drink business. Firdos B. will invest her share of our loan in their motorcycle business. Kalsoom B. and Shamim B. need this loan to buy donkey carts. All of us have been together for one year and have acquired loans as a group earlier as well.

loans.use: Buy a donkey to pull our donkey cart

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Đố - Tiên Trà - Trung Nghĩa Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đố, 45 years old, married with two children, farms, tends livestock and đi chợ*. Her children are grown-up and have moved out. Her average weekly income is 12USD. She is taking out loan to by feed for her pigs, same as Mrs. Thi. Mrs. Phúc and Thu use the loan for đi chợ.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đố, 45 tuổi, làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và đi chợ. Chị có chồng và 2 con. Các con đã lớn và ra ở riêng. Thu nhập bình quân nhà chị từ 150 000 đến 200 000/tuần. Chị vay vốn để mua thức ăn cho lợn. Chị Thi vay vốn để chăn nuôi. Chị Phúc vay vốn để đi chợ. Chị Thu vay vốn để đi chợ.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Abrordin

texts.ru:
Abrordin V. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Abrordin has a high school degree. Currently he is managing a grocery store in the kishlak (Tajik village) where he lives. He brings goods from Dushanbe and sells them in his store. His business allows the local population to purchase goods at affordable prices without leaving their kishlak. Furthermore, Abrordin's business helps him support his family. He is planning to use the loan money to expand the number and variety of goods his store offers for sale. Abrordin is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Вахидов Абрордин житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 40 лет, женат имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает , занимается торговлей продуктов питания..Привозит товар из Душанбе и реализует в своем районе. Имеет магазин в своем кишлаке.Этот бизнес помогает населению приобретать товар не выезжая из района по доступным ценам.Кроме того клиент имеет возможность зарабатывать и обеспечивать свою семью.Клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Пгасить кредитклиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Salijon

texts.en:
A. Salijon, 35 years old, is married with three children.

He has been running the business of selling cell phone accessories in the local central  market for more than 3 years.  These products are in high demand, so the business is successful, generating a stable income for the family.

Salijon is planning to expand his business and to enlarge the range of goods sold. For this purpose he requests $1000.00 for the term of 9 months. Having a positive credit history, he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone accessories in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Khamdamali

texts.en: Khamdamali A. was born in 1963 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is married and has three children. Mr. A. first applied to MicroInvest for a prior loan when he heard about a friend's successful business development loan. At that time, his business was having difficulties and he was going to sell it. However, with that loan, he was able to improve his business as he purchased a milk cow that his wife works with in milk production. He would now like to enlarge his livestock business by purchasing a pedigreed bull and is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $1,200.00.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Khumarbi

texts.en:
A. Khumarbi is 49 years old and raising two children alone. 

Khumarbi has been selling towels, tablecloths and women's shawls in the local market for 10 years.  She usually travels to Bishkek, located in the neighboring country of Kyrgyzstan, to purchase these goods. Since the business is the main source of income for her family, Khumarbi works hard to generate income. For the upcoming Women’s Day, she is planning to purchase additional new goods to sell.  For this purpose she is requesting a loan of $600.00 for the term of 6 months. Having a positive credit history, Khumarbi promises to repay the loan on time and thanks all supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as towels, tablecloths and women's shawls in order to increase the range of products for sale.

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Thuận - Tiên Trà - Trung Nghĩa Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thuận, 27 years old, a cadre, has small child. Her husband is a carpenter. Their weekly income is 18USD. She is taking out a loan to by tools for her husband. Mrs. Định collects scrap material and resells to depots. She is taking out loan to invest more into that recycle business. Mrs. Tám uses the funds of the loan for poultry and Mrs. Vui for buying goods for her stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Thuận 27 tuổi, làm cán bộ nhà nước, chi đang nuôi con nhỏ. Chồng chị làm nghề mộc. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 200 000 đến 300 000 đồng/ tuần. Chị vay vốn để mua thiết bị dụng cụ làm mộc cho chồng. Chị Định thu mua bao bì rồi bán lại cho các nhà máy. Chị vay vốn để tăng vốn làm ăn. Chị Tám vay vốn để chăn nuôi. Chị Vui vay vốn để đi chợ.

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba A. lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan. She is 22 years old, single and has no children. She has a professional degree as a seamstress. Matluba has 3 years of experience in her profession. She has a knitting machine in her home on which she knits scarves, hats and shawls to order. She is planning to use the loan money to purchase raw materials, such as yarn and wool for knitting of shawls. Matluba is hoping to pay back the loan in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Асоева Матлюба проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 22 года , не замужем, детей не имеет. Образование средне специальное. Специальность- швея.Опыт работы в данной сфере услуг 3 года. Имеет дома вязальную машинку. Клиентка вяжет платки ,шапки и шарфы на заказ. Планирует получить кредит для приобретения материала в виде ниток и пряжи для вязания платков , шалей и шарфов. Погасить кредит клиентка собирается в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of yarn and other raw materials

loans.name: Ehson

texts.en:
K. Ehson is 38 years old. He is married with three children of school age.

Ehson has been in the business of growing and selling a variety of flowers for 13 years.  The trading place is located in the center of the city, and as a rule he works from early morning till late night. Polite and friendly with his clients, Ehson has developed a stable business generating significant income for the family. 

In order to purchase a greater variety of flowers to sell, Ehson is requesting a loan of $750.00 for the term of 10 months. He has been a client of IMON for several years and has a positive credit history. He promises to be timely in repaying the loan

loans.use: To purchase a variety of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Khikmat

texts.en:
I. Khikmat is 27 years old and married with two adorable children aged 1 and 2.

Khikmat is a cattleman, purchasing young cattle, raising and then selling them in the local market. He has been in this business for 7 years. Khikmat is working hard to make his business thrive, as it is the main source of income for his family for whom he is trying to ensure adequate living conditions.  Currently Khikmat has 2 cows and is requesting a loan of $600.00 for the term of 6 months to purchase 2 more. This is the first loan for Khikmat; he thanks all for their trust and promises to repay the loan without violations.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.ru:
Izzat H. lives in the the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. Izzat has a high school degree and no professional degree. For the last 6 years he has been raising and selling cattle. He purchases calves, fattens them for 40-45 days and then sells them for a higher price, since fattened calves are used for meat. Izzat then buys more calves using the money he made from the sales. His business helps him support his family as Izzat is the sole breadwinner. His business also contributes to the development of agriculture in the region and supplies the markets with wholesome meat at an affordable price. Izzat is planning to use the loan to purchase additional animals. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Хушвахтов Иззат житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст45 лет,женат, имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее. Специальности не имеет.Занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает около 40-45 ддней а затем продает по более высокой цене, так как откормленные и подросшие бычки стоят дороже и их используют на мясо.Затем он покупает новый молодняк , откармливает и продает. Так по этой схеме действует его бизнес.Этот бизнес помогает обеспечивать его семью так как клиент является единственным кормильцем семьи. Кроме того развитие животноводческого сектора позволяет обеспечить рынки полноценным мясом и по доступным ценам.Занимается животноводством клиент уже около 6 лет.Поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 6месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Manzurahon

texts.en: Manzurahon U. is 25 years old and she lives in the Asht region. She has a business selling food products and used a previous loan to improve her business and open a trade outlet in the food bazaar where she trades the different food products. She has a good assortment and repeat customers. Now Mrs. U. is applying to KIVA for a loan of $625.00 to purchase a large supply of sugar.

loans.use: To purchase a large supply of sugar

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Phương - Tiên Trà - Trung Nghĩa Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phương, 37 years old, is a village market trader. She also raises chickens and tends a grocery stand. Her husband passes away so she must work harder to support three school age children.
