Имеет участок земли, который засеивает пшеницей. Планирует получить кредит для покупки семян пшеницы и удобрений. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seedsa and fertilizer

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru:
Sulton K. was born in 1953, works as a security guard in the co-op Somonkom. Sulton has 7 children. The oldest daughter has married and two of his sons have their own families, so currently he is only supporting 4 of his children who live at home. He has a black and white TV at home and would like to purchase a color TV. But since his salary as a security guard is not sufficient for a comfortable living he has turned for a loan to Microinvest. Sulton thinks that it is more economical to take out a loan to purchase the television.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Курбанов Султон 1953 года рождения ,работает охраником в совместном предприятии Сомонком, имеет 7 детей Старшую дочь уже выдал замуж, два сына тоже уже семейные.Сейчас у него на иждивении еще 4 детей.Он имеет телевизор не цветной ,и хочет купить цветной .Но т.к. у него заработной платы не хватает для хорошего проживания он обратился за кредитом в Микроинвест.Считает что ему выгодней купить телевизор в кредит..

loans.use: Purchase of a television

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
I am Amna T. from Multan, a city in Pakistan famous for its shrines. I live in a two-room brick house with my husband and five sons. My husband has operated a bakery for the last 20 years. He sells sweets, soft drinks and various snacks at his store. He needs to buy stock of various items for his bakery and therefore is in need of a loan. I plan to save extra profits from his income to marry my sons.

My group members are: Haneefa B. who will invest her share of our loan in her family’s resturant. Koser P. will use the loan to expand her grocery store. Shahida B. is borrowing for her tea stall. All of us have been together for one year and have exhibited a strong sense of responsibility and cooperation during the tenure.

loans.use: Expand bakery

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida Y. has been selling cosmetics in her shop for the past three years. She is married to a carpenter and has six children. She is requesting $525 to buy additional cosmetics so she can expand her client base.

Vida is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics so she can expand her client base.

loans.name: Khidoyat

texts.en:
M. Khidoyat is 56 years old. He is married and already has four grandchildren.

Khidoyat is an entrepreneur. He is selling foodstuffs like confectioneries and tea. At the same time he is selling  housewares. He has been in this business for 5 years. His wife is also involved in the business and helps Khidoyat in the market. The business is successful and generates income sufficient for supporting their large family. 

Today Khidoyat requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to increase capital for purchasing the foodstuffs for selling. Having proved himself a reliable client, Khidoyat promises to pay the current loan in time.

loans.use: Increasing capital for purchasing foodstuffs for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing of office supplies for selling.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Abdujalil K. Abdumurodovich lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 36, married and has 4 children. He has a High School education. He is a farmer. He owns a piece of land which he uses to grow wheat. When the wheat is ready, he grinds it into flower. Abdujalil keeps a portion of the obtained flower for his family and sells the rest on the market. This business provides for the family financially for the entire year and supplies affordable flower to the local markets. Abdujalil plans to use the money from the loan to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer. He has been in this business for the past 5 years.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Курбонов Абдуджалил Абдумуродович проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 36 лет. Женат имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается землиделием. Имеет участок земли, который засеивает под пшеницу. После получения урожая перемалывает пшеницу в муку. Часть оставляет своей семье ,а часть выносит на рынки. Этот бизнес дает годовой доход его семье, а так же обеспечивает рынки продуктом первой необходимости- мукой, по доступным ценам.Планирует получить кредит для покупки семян и удобрений. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 5 лет.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. has been a trader for the past four years. Her husband repairs freezers and air conditioners around Cape Coast. They have three children.

Mary is requesting $275 to expand her current stock of products.

Mary is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To expand her current stock of products.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov C. ,40, and his wife, Tong Bunthoeun have been married since 1992. They have four children; one son and three daughters. Two of their children are students, one daughter is working in a garment factory and the youngest daughter stays at home. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Mr. C. has been selling palm fruit and palm juice for many years. He collects the juice from palm trees and sells the fruit and juice in his village and at the Psa Doem Kor Market in Phnom Penh. When he finishes selling his products, he runs a motor taxi for additional income. His wife works in a garment factory near his village.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to replace his old motorbike with a new motorbike for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny P. , 44, is a widow with six children-- four sons and two daughters. She was only able to complete the fourth grade in primary school. However, she is polite, friendly and clever in her business. There are five children living under her custody, all of them are working except one who is studying. The family lives approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. P. has been selling fruit with her daughter, Noun Chanda, at the Ta Kmao market since 2000. She purchases the fruit from a farm in her village. She is requesting her second loan in the amount of $1100. She will use this money to buy more fruit for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for resale

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim U. , 55, and her husband, Tep Heang, have been married since 1979. They have seven children; six sons and one daughter. Four of their children are employed full time and the others are studying at the local school. The family lives approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. U. has been selling Cambodian cookies and vegetables for four years. She purchases the food products in her village and resells them at the Ta Kmao market in the city. Her husband has been a construction worker for over ten years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun P. and her husband have been married since 1981. They have four children; one son and three daughters. Two of their children are married and the other two are employed full time. The family lives approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. P. has been selling meatballs in front of her house for many years. Her husband, Mr. Meach Sorn, has been a construction contractor since 1981 and helps his wife cook for wedding ceremonies when he has free time from his construction work. She is requesting her second loan in the the amount of $400. She will use this money to purchase construction materials for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Srey Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Aun P. , 21, and her husband have been married for three years and have one son. Srey Aun and her family live across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

She has been a silk weaver since 2003. It’s a skill she learned from her sister. Her husband grows rice and runs a horse cart in the village. She is requesting a loan for the third time, in the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Mrs. Saron D. and her husband have been married since 1979. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, while the other three (one of whom is working in Phnom Penh) live at home. The family live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. D. has been a silk weaver since 1979. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. Two of her children that live at home also weave. Her husband is farming and raising cows.

She is requesting a second loan of $350. This money will be used to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread and fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Zongty

texts.en:
Mrs. Zongty E. and her husband, Kong Saron, have been married since 1986. They have two daughters. One of their daughters is studying at the university in Phnom Penh and the other is attending a local school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. E. started her silk weaving business in 1980. It’s a skill she learned from her mother (she is pictured with her mother). Her husband is a silk weaver as well. Both of thE. work hard to support their daughters and promote their education.

Mrs. E. is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase silk materials for weaving and to pay tuition for her daughter who is attending the university.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and pay tuition

loans.name: Sron

texts.en:
Mrs. Sron C. and her husband, Khorn That, have been married since 2002. They have one son and one daughter, both who are studying in the local school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. C. started her silk weaving in 1990. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband grows rice and weaves silk. He wants to create another business of running horse carts. They hope that their businesses will continue to support their children in school and allow them to build a new house.

Mrs. C. is requesting a loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy a horse for her husband's new business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and a buy a horse for running horse carts.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Miss. Vanny S. is single and lives with her parents. She has four brothers and four sisters. She and her family live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Two of her sisters weave silk at home and one of her brothers works at a company in Phnom Penh. Vanny has been a silk weaver since 1995. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $150. She will use this money to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a married mother with one child. She has been a trader for the past four years. Her husband is a carpenter.

She is requesting $525 to buy cement and plywood. She would also like to expand her product range so she can sell cosmetics as well.

Mary is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy cement and plywood.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mr. Leang S. (picture with his wife under his house) was married in 1980 and has five daughters. Two of the daughters work in a garment factory and the other three are studying in the local school. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

He has been in the house construction business since 1980. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Mr. S. is requesting a second loan in the amount of $1000 to build a restroom and a concrete room under his wooden house for storage.

loans.use: To build a restroom and storage room.

loans.name: Loth

texts.en:
Mrs. Loth S. is 57 years old. She is the owner of a grocery store and also takes care of one child. She earns about $2.50 a day. Her husband, Mr. Tep Lan, is a junk stuff broker and earns about $5.00 dollar a day. Her 18 year old daughter is a student.

Mrs. S. needs more income to pay for her daughter's school fees and daily expenses. Along with her husband, she will use this loan to increase their stock of junk stuff. They request $1,200.00 and appreciate HKL's help.

loans.use: To buy junk stuff stock to generate more income

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy M. and her husband have been married for fifteen years. They have four daughters; three of them are studying in the local school and the youngest one stay at home. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. M. and her husband have been in the business of selling vegetables since 2005. They purchase them from their village and resell the produce at a market in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 for the second time. She will use this money to purchase a motor carriage for transporting vegetables to the market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a motor carriage.

loans.name: Sreydy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreydy D. (pictured with her mother) and her husband have been married since 2006 and have one son. She works in a garment factory. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and does construction work. The couple lives with her mother who grows rice. Their home is approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. D. is requesting her third loan in the amount of $800. She will use this money to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Samath

texts.en:
Mrs. Samat Y. and her husband, Thol Hout, have been married since 2000. They have four children; one son and three daughters. All of them are still young and stay at home. Samat works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a full time employee in an electrical shop in Phnom Penh for seven years. Both of them travel to work on their old motorbike from their home in Kandal Steung district, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Y. is requesting her second loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money, along with money she has saved, to purchase a new motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngin S. is 41 years old. She sells food from her house in the Plou Paem village near Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She earns about $3.00 a day from her business. Her husband, Mr. Koy Dok, is a bricklayer and earns about $2.00 a day. They have four children. One of them is a garment worker who earns about $2.00 a day.

To increase their income and better support their large family, they plan to decorate their house to be a proper and attractive place to sell food. They will use this loan of $1,100.00 to decorate their house, and a also partly to pay for their children to go to school.

loans.use: To decorate their house to be proper and attractive as a selling place

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun P. and her husband, Keam Sokha, have been married since 1969. They have eight children; two sons and six daughters. All of them are married. Two of the married children are living in the family home. Their house is in a Phnom Penh suburb.

She and her husband have been in the business of renting houses to local workers since 2000. Mrs. P. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for her sons to start a motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach P. and her husband, Kheav Boran, have been married since 1983. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is married and lives outside the family home. One of her daughters has full time employment and the other stays at home. The youngest son is in school. Her family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Mrs. P. has been in the business of renting houses to local workers and selling jackfruit since 1999. She purchases the fruit from the Neak Meas Market (fruit market) to sell at her shop in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for her sons to become motor taxi drivers.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kuthea R. and her husband have been married since 1998. They have two sons; one is studying in primary school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

She and her husband have been in the business of raising pigs and ducks since 2003. They raise almost one hundred pigs on the farm behind their house. Besides the raising of pigs and ducks, they also raise fish.

Mrs. R. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1200. She will use this money to purchase additional feed and to repair her mother's house.

loans.use: To purchase feed and house repairs

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mr. Lay S. has been married to his second wife since 1996. He has four children; two sons and two daughters. His two sons work in the construction business with him and the other two children are studying in the local school. Mr. S. has been in business for four years. Besides construction work, he is also a fisherman. His wife has been farming for more than ten years. Lay and his family live on an island in the Mekong River,about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000. He will use this money to purchase additional construction tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs. Him C. is 40 years old. She sells food in front of the garment factory in the Banlar Saet village near Phnom Penh City. She sells mostly to garment workers and earns about $3.00 a day.

Her husband, Mr. Roem Roschea, is 40 years old and drives a motorcycle taxi. He can earn up to $2.50 a day. They have four children, one of whom can contribute about $2.00 a day to the family by working in the garment factory.

Him's business can earn just enough to support the daily expenses. The materials are old and out of date. She will use this loan of $700.00 to upgrade her business. She is applying for the loan from HKL because she is satisfied with their methodology.

loans.use: To expand her business in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Yam

texts.en:
Mrs. Yam L. and her husband have been married since 1993. They have six children; four sons and two daughters. Four of their children are studying in the local school and the youngest two stay at home. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. L. has been raising pigs and growing a vegetable garden for over ten years. She grows papayas, eggplant and tomatoes on her farm. Her husband, Mr. Khem You, is a construction worker and a part time fisherman.

She is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $400 to reconstruct the stairs of her home.

loans.use: To reconstruct stairs in the home

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng T. and her husband have been married since 1990. They have four children; three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a radio and television repairman and the other three children are studying in the local school. Mrs. T. and her family live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

She has been a silk weaver for over ten years. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. Her husband, Mr. Vun Ra, has been a television and radio repairman for four years. He learned his skills at electrician school in Phnom Penh. Besides this job, he also raises cattle.

Mrs. T. is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 for the third time. She would like to purchase additional silk material and build a shop in front of her house for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and build a shop.

loans.name: Sam On

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam On U. , 47, is a widow with two daughters. Her eldest daughter is working in a garment factory and the youngest one is studying in secondary school. Her family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. U. has been in the business of selling jasmine flowers and bananas for over ten years. She buys them from farmers in her village and rells the products at a market in Phnom Penh. She hopes that her business will continue to support the daughter in school. Mrs. U. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase additional jasmine flowers and bananas.

loans.use: To purchase flowers and bananas for resale

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov S. (pictured with her mother), 34, and her husband, Mr. Meng Leang, have been married for over ten years. They have two children; one son and one daughter, both who are studying in primary school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. S. has been in the business of selling flowers and bananas since she was young. She takes jasmine flowers from her farm and some she purchases from a farmer in her village to sell atthe Chba Ampov Market in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises pigs and cows. He would like to set up a new business cleaning in the village. The couple hopes that both businesses will be able to support her children through school.

Mrs. S. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to set up a motorbike cleaning shop for her husband.

loans.use: To set up a motorbike cleaning shop

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha S. and her husband have been married since 1990. They have five children; one son and four daughters. Three of her children are studying in the local school, the two youngest children stay at home. Her family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. S. and her husband have been in the business of selling fruits for many years. They purchase the fruits from a market in Phnom Penh and resell the produce in front of garment factory near their village. She is requesting her third loan in the amount of $300. This money will be used for buying fruits to resell.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for reselling

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S. (pictured with her husband) and her husband have been married for eight years and have five children; three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are working in a garment factory and the other three are studying in the local school.The family lives approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. S. and her husband have been in the business of selling lotus flowers for many years. They purchase the flowers from growers in their village and resell them at a market in Phnom Penh. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to make repairs on the family home.

loans.use: To make house repairs

loans.name: Duku's Group

texts.en: Duku, Amis, and Patrick have all been our clients for 3 years, and each one of them has a business. They are residents of Kayunga, and they would like a loan to boost their businesses. Patrick works at the maize factory and carries bags of maize on his bicycle for a fee, Duku has a clinic, and Amis has a stationery shop in Busaana.

loans.use: Patrick wants to buy a new bicycle, Duku wants to buy medicine, and Amis wants to buy more books and pens.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en: I am Nusrat I., 30, married and the mother of three daughters. All of my daughters are small and two attend kindergarten; one is too small to attend school at present. I and my husband work on thread looms and manufacture cloth. We want to expand our business further for which we require a loan. With this loan we will buy thread in bulk.  The other members in my group are: Shaihda B. who needs this loan for the repair of her husband’s rickshaw. Balqees B.’s husband has a soft drinks stand and Saeeda B. will buy a donkey cart with her share of our loan.

loans.use: Expand cloth manufacturing business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a married mother of five. She supports her family and husband, who is a mason, by selling bowls and chicken feed. She is requesting $525 to buy a wider variety of bowls and kitchenware in hopes to improve her income and profit.

Mary is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of bowls and kitchenware.

loans.name: St. Noah Women's Group

texts.en: Sarah, aged 41 and a resident of Kayunga, is a woman of substance. She is married with 5 children, although her husband lives in Kampala. Since 1989 her business has been buying coffee seeds from all the villages around Kayunga and selling them to the factory in Kayunga. Her range is usually 3 to 5 tonnes, where a tonne is 1000 kilogrammes. Sarah needs a loan, together with her group members, to enable her to buy more tonnes now that the prices are high, as well as to cover the ever increasing transport costs, because of the crisis in Kenya. She has been our client for 16 months and so far we have no regrets.

loans.use: Sarah intends to buy more kilogrammes of coffee to increase her savings.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor O. is a 39 year-old married father of four. For the past 12 years, Victor has run a small shop, located in an auto repair yard, selling spare car parts. He is requesting $525 to buy additional spare car parts for sale.

Victor is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional spare car parts.

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en: I am Hajra A. from Multan, a city in Pakistan famous for its shrines. I am married and the mother of two boys. I sell cloth from my house and need a loan to buy cloth in bulk. Wedding season is around the corner and sales of cloth will be high. There is  another woman  Kaneez B. who is borrowing for her grocery store. This is a group loan and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans.

loans.use: Buy cloth in bulk

loans.name: Rashid's Group

texts.en: Since 1984, Rashid, together with some of his group members, has been going as far as Masindi, Tanzania, in search of business. They are involved in buying goats, cows, and sheep for sale in Busaana, their hometown. From the way things are going, they are in business but only with the boost given by loans, which they have been getting for 3 years now. The rest of the members each have businesses of their own. Rashid is 34 years old and married with 13 children, as he cares for 3 children that belong to his late brother.

loans.use: Rashid plans to buy more goats, cows, and sheep with the loan.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. is a 50 year-old widow. She supports her five children by selling rice porridge, which is a popular breakfast dish in Ghana. She is requesting $275 to buy rice in bulk from a wholesaler so she can reduce her costs.

Sarah is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk from a wholesaler so she can reduce her costs.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
I am the group leader of three women: Rabia B. runs a beauty parlor. Parween B. will invest her share of our loan in her family’s vegetable business. Asiah B. operates a boutique. These women are my neighbors and we have been together for a very long time.

I was born in a small town, Vehari, but moved to a mid-size town, Multan, after my marriage. I have two kids: one boy and one girl. My son is seven years old and attends kindergarten and my daughter is three years old and will begin school next year. I want to start a beauty parlor and I need a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: Start up a beauty salon

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en: I am Salma B. from Multan, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of eight: four girls and four boys. I am requesting a loan to buy an additional cow for my milk business. I sell milk to neighborhood clients.  With the extra profits I plan to collect a dowry  for my daughters. I would like to borrow in a group of few other women: Sadiqa B. manufactures ice creams. Farzana B. is borrowing for her family’s spare parts business. Rukhsana B. will use her share of our loan in her grocery store.

loans.use: Expand milk business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is married and has four children. She supports her family and husband, who is a mechanic, by selling plywood at Poly Junction in Cape Coast. She is requesting $525 to buy plywood in bulk from a wholesaler at a reduced rate. She hopes this loan will increase her income.

Agnes is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy plywood in bulk from a wholesaler at a reduced rate.

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en:
Suzy A. has been a dressmaker for the past four years. She is married to a taxi-driver and has two children. She is requesting $275 to buy cloth and linen to produce dresses.

Suzy is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy cloth and linen to produce dresses.

loans.name: Bwavu Mpologoma Lending Group

texts.en:
Moses N. has been a farmer all his life. He is 47 years old, married with seven children and he cares for three orphans. He grows maize, beans, coffee, and bananas and he has been our client for three years. His children are still in lower classes at school. The loans have really helped him in his crop fields, especially with manpower, enabling him to get enough profits that he uses partly to pay the children’s school dues.

Moses is the leader of the Bwavu Mpologoma Lending group, which will share in this loan.

loans.use: Moses plans to employ workers on his maize, beans, banana and coffee for better yields.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia V. is a young vivacious woman of thirty-six. She is married to Jorge Arturo Garcia, who works as a driver for a transportation business which works between the neighboring countries. Felicia works as a seamstress for the business Cecilia Fadul. She specializes in a special type of sewing called ao poí.

The loan which she is asking for will be used to buy fabrics for her area of specialty in sewing. With the loan she will be able to buy the fabric in bulk and lower the prices of her clothes. This will attract more buyers and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Corith

texts.es:
Corith Sangma S. is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres en Acción" of Picota. She lives in the San Martín region, Picota province, Picota district. Her business is located at the Mercado de Abastos de Picota, a market. She sells salted dried fish. She started this business to increase her income and to be able to pay for her family's basic day to day needs.

The loan, in the amount of S/.1300.00 and that she will pay back in 6 months, will be used to stock her stand with a wide variety of of salted dried fish such as: paiche, tilapia, maparate, bocachico, lisa and others.

Corith is 31 years old, lives with her husband and has 1 son. They are her source of strength to get ahead and to improve their standard of living. Her dream is to have a large store where she would be able to offer her products to a large section of the local population.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Corith S. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción” de Picota, vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, su negocio esta ubicado en el Mercado de Abastos de Picota y se dedica a la venta de pescado seco salado. Ella emprendió este negocio para obtener mayores ingresos, y cubrir las necesidades diarias de su familia.

Con el crédito de S/.1300.00, que pagara en un plazo de 6 meses, podrá surtir su negocio con gran variedad de pescado seco salado como: paiche, tilapia, maparate, bocachico, arahuana, lisa y otros.

La señora Corith tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y tiene 1 hijo, que son su fuerza para salir adelante, y mejorar su nivel de vida. Su sueño es tener un depósito de pescado seco salado y cubrir las necesidades de la localidad.

loans.use: To stock her business with a wide variety of fish.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian P. is a young single mother of two. She used to work and live in the interior of Paraguay in a small town called Caaguazu, but in 2006 decided to move near to Asuncion to open her own convenience store. She knew that in order to support her children, she needed to move to a more populated area where there would be more traffic in and out of her store.

In the past two years she has formed a great clientele and has many regulars. With this loan, Mirian will invest in a larger variety of goods to meet her clientele’s demands. A bigger amount of goods will mean a bigger income for Mirian and her two children. She will buy more rice, different styles of noodles, and sugar.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and different varieties of noodles.

loans.name: Elida Angelica

texts.es:
Señora Corith Sangama Sinti, belongs to the "Women in Action" Communal Bank of Pillory. She lives in the San Martin region of the province of Pillory, district of Pillory. Her business is located in the Pillory Supplies Market and is dedicated to the sale of dry salted fish.

She undertook this business to obtain a greater income and to cover the daily needs of her family.

With the loan of 1300 soles, that she will pay back in 6 months, she will be able to supply her business with great variety of dry salted fish such as: paiche, tilapia, maparate, bocachico, arahuana, lisa and others.

Señora Corith is 31 years old, lives with her husband and has 1 son, that she supports to do well and to improve his standard of living.

Her dream is to have a deposit of dry salted fish and to supply the needs of the local area.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Corith Sangama Sinti, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción” de Picota, vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, su negocio esta ubicado en el Mercado de Abastos de Picota y se dedica a la venta de pescado seco salado.

Ella emprendió este negocio para obtener mayores ingresos, y cubrir las necesidades diarias de su familia.

Con el crédito de S/.1300.00, que pagara en un plazo de 6 meses, podrá surtir su negocio con gran variedad de pescado seco salado como: paiche, tilapia, maparate, bocachico, arahuana, lisa y otros.

La señora Corith tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y tiene 1 hijo, que son su fuerza para salir adelante, y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Su sueño es tener un depósito de pescado seco salado y cubrir las necesidades de la localidad.

loans.use: To buy more cabinets and fish for her store.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric N. is a tailor. He is married to a fish monger and has no children. Eric is running out of tread and other knitting materials which are needed to meet customer demands.

Eric is asking for $525 to buy more thread and other knitting materials for his business

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more thread and other knitting materials.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia F. is a forty-four year old married mother of five children. Her children range from elementary school to college age. For years, Patrocinia has been working as a seamstress to support her family.

Her current project is working on school uniforms for children in elementary and high school. Not only does she make clothes for school, she also makes uniforms for soccer teams.

She wishes for a loan to have the ability to more fabric in bulk so that she can offer her clients lower prices than her competitors. Patrocinia has a lot of connections with the schools because her children are still in them. She has a strong clientele base and knows that the loan will be well used.

loans.use: To buy fabric to sew school uniforms for elementary and high school students

loans.name: Santos Rosmery

texts.es:
Santos Rosmery Lázaro Q. is 23 years old. She attended high school but was unable to complete her studies due to personal reasons. She is the mother of two children that depend on her for sustenance. She lives in the Usquil district, Oztuco province, departamento de La Libertad. She earns a living buying live animals, such as pigs, and selling the meat to the restaurants in her district.

Becoming a member of the communal bank "Usquil" enabled her to start her business. She obtained her first loan, in the amount of S/. 300.00. She used it to travel to the Coina district to buy live animals at lower prices, which in turn brought her greater profits.

The loan, in the amount of S./ 1500.00 that will be paid in 4 months, will be used to buy 14 live animals to expand her business. Ms. Santos is a member of the club of mothers "Santa Rosa". Her dream is to set up a business in the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Santos Rosmery Lázaro Q. tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, sus estudios no los pudo culminar por motivos personales. Tiene 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a la compra de animales vivos tales como huachos y chanchos los cuales mata para luego vender la carne; esta la reparte y ofrece por los diferentes restaurantes de su distrito.

Al integrarse al Banco Comunal “Usquil” pudo iniciar su negocio ya que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 , con este dinero pudo viajar al distrito de Coina para comprar huachos a menor precio y así obtener mas utilidades.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 , el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 8 huachos y 6 chanchos para poder incrementar su negocio. La señora Santos es socia del club de madres “Santa Rosa”. Su sueño es poner un negocio en la ciudad de Trujillo.

loans.use: Purchase of 14 live animals to expand her business

loans.name: Liz Orfita

texts.es:
Liz is a member of the communal bank Loreto, located in the Jr. Comandante Suárez No. 344, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Liz is 26 years old and is the mother of 1 child. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, in the amount of S/300, she invested in the retail sale of groceries. With a lot of hard work she was able to set up a small store and thanks to the loans she has received from Manuela Ramos she is able to stock it with a variety of products used in everyday life.

The S/3,000 loan, that she will pay in 5 months, will be used to purchase 2 sacks of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 2 boxes of sodas, 1 box of cooking oil, etc.

At the beginning, Liz had a lot of doubts about earning a living selling groceries, but with time and the support she received from Manuela Ramos, she realized that her business was starting to be successful. With her husband's support Liz hopes to continue to grow not only as a woman but as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

señora Liz pertenece al banco comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez N° 344, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Liz tiene 26 años y es madre de 1 hijo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la venta de abarrotes al por menor. En la actualidad, con mucho esfuerzo, formó una bodega, que gracias a los préstamos que está recibiendo de Manuela Ramos la está implementando con más productos de primera necesidad.

Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses implementará su bodega con la compra de 2 sacos de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leches, 2 cajas de refrescos, 1 caja de aceite, etc.

Al principio Liz tuvo muchas dudas para dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, pero se dio cuenta, con el tiempo y con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos, que el negocio le estaba dando buenos resultados. Junto con su esposo, que la apoya, quiere seguir creciendo como mujer y como empresaria.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (sugar, rice, milk, cooking oil, etc)

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene, Juana, and Nicolasa are members of the “Virgen del Carmen” community bank. Irene has been a member for ten years, while Juana and Nicolasa joined three years ago. They are all from the district of Pacaycasa, which is 30 minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. In the community bank, they have learned to be responsible, to take care of their children, and learned how to manage their businesses.

Irene is 50 years old and has four children. She makes bricks in the fields that she owns. She uses general laborers to help her make the bricks. She then sells the bricks to people who fire them. In addition, on Sundays, Irene sells popular local foods and soft drinks from her home, which is located close to the local stadium.

Juana is 63 years old. She has eight children, one of whom still lives with her. Juana raises pigs and sells their meat. On Sundays, she travels to the market in the town of Huanta, where she buys pigs to fatten in her yard. She sells her meat in the district of Quinua. In addition, seasonally, Juana sells tara, which is a local tree used to make industrial products. She also sells soft drinks from her home.

Nicolasa is 55 years old. She has three children, one of whom is still living with her. Nicolasa buys pigs from different towns. She later butchers them, and sells the meat in her district, or she transports it to other towns. She also buys guinea pigs, which are eaten in Peru, and sells them to restaurants in the town of Conchopata.

Irene, Juana, and Nicolasa need loans of 300, 300, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy pigs and guinea pigs, and to pay their laborers.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Irene, Juana, and Nicolasa plan to use their savings to pay for any unexpected costs, old age, and to make home repairs. Their dreams are that their children will have better lives and be professionals, to have bigger businesses, and to start raising cattle.

loans.use: Irene, Juana, and Nicolasa need loans of 300, 300, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy pigs and guinea pigs, and to pay their laborers.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mrs. Mariluz D. is a member of the “Las Perlas de Pucallpa” microfinance institution, located at Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra. 7, Calleria district, in the Ucayali department. Mariluz is a 39-year-old mother of five. She decided to invest her first loan of S/ 300 soles in the purchase and sale of groceries.

She currently has a well-stocked market, which she operates alongside her husband and children.

She will invest the loan of S/ 1,600 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, in buying more groceries such as rice, milk, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, preserves, etc.

Mariluz keeps working assiduously in order to give her children the best. Her business is growing more and more everyday, which makes her very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mariluz pertenece al banco comunal Las Perlas de Pucallpa, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra.7, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Mariluz tiene 39 años y es madre de 5 hijos., Con su primer préstamo de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la compra y venta de abarrotes al por menor.

En la actualidad tiene una bodega muy surtida, que atiende junto con sus hijos y su esposo. Mariluz sigue trabajando muy duro para darles lo mejor a sus hijos que aún necesita. El negocio está creciendo cada día más y eso la hace muy feliz.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, milk, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Martha Estela

texts.es:
Martha is a member of the communal bank Bellavista, located in the Jr. Octavio MonteverD. No. 240, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. She is 39 years old, she has two children and is separated from her husband. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, in the amount of S/300, she invested in the manicure business. Currently there is great demand for her services and her roster of clients continues to grow. She wakes up very early to tent to her children, cleans her home and in the afternoons she works on her stand. Occasionally she goes to the clients' homes

The S/.1,500 loan will be used to stock her manicure stand with more nail polish, lotions, tweezers, etc.

Martha never thought that her ability to draw would make her a business woman. With the training she received, painting and decorating nails as well as pedicure treatments, she is able to proviD. an education for her children and to meet some of her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Matha pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Octavio MonteverD. N° 240, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 39 años, es madre D. 2 hijos y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300 deciD. invertir en el negocio D. manicura. En la actualidad sus clientes han aumentado por la demanda que tiene. Se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos, hace el aseo D. su hogar, en las tardes se dedica a su negocio y a veces atienD. a domicilio.

Con el préstamo D. S/.1,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, implementará el stand D. manicura con más esmaltes, paletas, cremas, pinzas, etc.

Martha nunca pensó que la habilidad que tenia para dibujar la haría una mujer D. negocios. Con los estudios que realizó en el pintado D. uñas y tratamiento para los pies ella pueD. darle educación a sus hijos y también satisfacer algunas necesidades D. su hogar.

loans.use: To stock her manicure stand with nail polish, lotions, etc.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.en:
The committee of nineteen women named “The Eight of December” is one of the best committees of women entrepreneurs in the city. They are enthusiastic, hard working women who are looking out for the welfare of their children.

These women work together to increase the success of their independent businesses. They work with everything from food to clothing, sewing, crafting and more. Together they split up the loan they are asking for, according to how much each woman needs. Then they meet a few times a month to repay the loan and talk about business strategies. The system works because all the women trust each other and understand one another’s situation.

loans.use: To buy various items for the women’s businesses, including food, cleaning items, clothing, and other home goods.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria owns a store that offers cellular phone services and calling cards. Her husband is a bricklayer, and his job is the family’s primary source of income that covers the household expenses. They live in the Rió Seco zone in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase more cell phone calling cards, in view of the high demand, thus increasing the household income.

This is her first loan with IMPRO. Maria’s credit check allows her to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene una tienda cuyos servicios son llamadas de telefonía móvil y comercialización de tarjetas de crédito para teléfonos móviles. Su esposo es albañil; siendo dicha ocupación su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos; el domicilio de la familia está ubicado en la Zona de Rió Seco (ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito será destinado para comprar más tarjetas de créditos para teléfonos móviles, en vista de que su demanda ha aumentado y de esa forma incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Maria.

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone calling cards

loans.name: Marcelina Tulia's Group

texts.en:
Felicitas, Norma, and Marcelina are members of the “Virgen del Carmen” community bank. Felicitas and Marcelina have been members for ten years, while Norma joined three years ago. They are all from the district of Pacaycasa, which is 30 minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. In the bank, they have learned to save, how to manage their business, to be responsible, punctual, to have self-esteem, and to respect others.

Felicitas is 58 years old. She is married and has seven children, two of whom live with her. Felicitas buys tara, a local tree used to make industrial products, and cochinilla, an insect used to make red dye, in Pacaycasa, and then sell them in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, seasonally, Felicitas collects tuna, a local fruit that comes from a cactus, and sells them in Ayacucho.

Norma is 23 years old. She is a single mother and has one daughter. Norma buys tuna, cochinilla, and tara and sells them to middlemen in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Norma makes bricks, which she later sells to others who fire them. With her new loan, Norma will open a new business selling vegetables from the jungle region of Ayacucho.

Marcelina is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. Marcelina has a store where she sells food, such as, flour, rice and sugar. Her store is located in the central square of Pacaycasa. In addition, Marcelina buys tara, cochinilla, and lucama, a local fruit, and sells them to middlemen.

Felicitas, Norma, and Marcelina need loans of 300, 1500, and 900 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in tara, cochinilla, vegetables, sugar, rice, oil, and noodles.

Felicitas, Norma, and Marcelina dream that their children will be professionals, their business will be successful, and that they will be able to own a home.

loans.use: Felicitas, Norma, and Marcelina need loans of 300, 1500, and 900 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying tara, cochinilla, vegetables, sugar, rice, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
N. Comfort is trader who sells both soft and alcoholic drinks. She is married to a sanitation officer and has 5 children. She plans on expanding her business, but lacks adequate funds.

She is asking for $525 as an additional capital to buy increase her stock of drinks and expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase stock

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en: Adelaide A. has been running her own general store for the past 8 years.  She is married and has 4 children.  She is requesting $525 to buy items for her store (i.e. stationary, water and vitamins).  Adelaide is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy items for her general store (i.e. stationary, water and vitamins).

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a young and hard worker. She offers phone and tea services. Her home has two phone booths and it is her main source of income which she uses to support herself and cover education expenses at the university. She lives at her grandmother's house in the area of Los Andes in the city of El Alto. The loan requested is to acquire another phone booth to increase her working capital. In this way, she will help support her grandmother and pay for her university expenses. This is the second loan via KIVA; the last one allowed her to strengthen her business. The evaluation performed approved Beatriz for another loan. The previous loan has been completely paid off.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz es una joven trabajadora, ofrece servicios de té y telefonía móvil. Su tienda consta de dos cabinas telefónicas, es su mayor fuente de ingreso, le sirve para mantenerse y cubrir su educación universitaria. Vive en la casa de su abuela; su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Los Andes de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requerido es para adquirir una cabina telefónica e incrementar su capital de trabajo. De esta forma, colaborará con la manutención de su abuela y cubrirá sus gastos universitarios. Este es el segundo crédito vía KIVA, el anterior le permitió fortalecer su pequeña actividad comercial. La evaluación realizada permite aprobar otro préstamo a Beatriz. El crédito anterior está completamente pagado.

loans.use: Purchase a new phone booth to expand her business

loans.name: Victoria Mauricia's Group

texts.en:
Victoria, Marcelina, and Sabina are members of the “Estrellas” community bank. Victoria and Marcelina have belonged for four years, while Sabina joined one year ago. In the community bank, they have learned how to care for their children, how to treat friends, how to manage their businesses, and how to save. They mentioned that they enjoy meetings because they are entertaining.

Victoria is 50 years old. She is married and has eight children. Victoria sells flowers in the 12th of April Market in Ayacucho. She has a small cart that she uses to display her products. She buys the flowers from fields outside of the city. In addition, Victoria buys grains, which she grinds into flour and later sells.

Marcelina is 38 years old. She is a single mother and has three children. Marcelina sells cheeses at the central market of Ayacucho. She buys the cheese from the markets in the small towns around Ayacucho. In addition, Marcelina sells fruits and candies from her home during the school season.

Sabina is 24 years old. She lives with her partner and two children. Together with her partner, Sabina has an auto shop that is located in her home. They have been running this business for four years. When they started, it was very difficult, but their business has continued to grow. In addition, Sabina grows fruits and vegetables that she sells in Ayacucho.

Victoria, Marcelina, and Sabina need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying flowers, grains, cookies, candies, and auto parts.

Victoria, Marcelina, and Sabina dream of their children being professionals, buying land, owning a home, improving their businesses, and owning a car.

loans.use: Victoria, Marcelina, and Sabina need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying flowers, grains, cookies, candies, and auto parts.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mrs. Mirna H. is a member of the “La Positiva” communal bank, located at Jr. Venezuela S/N, Calleria district, in the Ucayali department. Mirna is a 39-year-old mother of three. She decided to invest the first loan of S/ 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase and sale of fish, starting out with only a tub in which to keep her fish.

She has become a fish wholesaler who has a stand in a much frequented market in the city. She gets up very early in order to go to her stand, while in the evenings, she looks after her home and children. Furthermore, she has her husband’s support.

She will invest the loan of S/ 1,500 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, in the purchase of different kinds of fish. She will also set aside some of the loan for any exigencies that may arise.

Mirna states that there are some periods in which sales are good, and others in which they are not. This fact is not, however, is not an impediment for success. On the contrary, it is a force that helps her and her family press forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mirna pertenece al banco comunal La Positiva, ubicado en el Jr. Venezuela S/N, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Mirna tiene 39 años y es madre de 3 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la compra y venta de pescado, empezando con una tina donde ofrecía los pescados.

En la actualidad se ha vuelto mayorista de venta de pescado, tiene un puesto de venta en un mercado muy concurrido de nuestra cuidad. Se levanta muy temprano para ir a su puesto de venta y en las tardes se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y atender a sus hijos y además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de pescado de diferentes tipos y otra parte del préstamo lo destinará para el ahorro en caso suceda alguna emergencia.

Mirna manifiesta que como todos los años hay temporadas donde se vende más y otras menos, no es impedimento para seguir surgiendo, al contrario es un impulso mas para salir adelante por ella misma y por su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of fish

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Mrs. Noemí R. is a member of the Loreto communal bank, located at Jr. Loreto N° 251, Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is a 29-year-old mother of one dependent child, and her husband is a merchant. She decided to invest the first loan of S/300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos in opening a mini market in her house.

She currently operates this mini market. She wakes up at 6:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and child, and then she runs the mini market until 8:00 p.m.

With the this loan of S/ 2,000 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy 1 sack of rice, 2 packages of noodles, chicken, fish, milk, preserves, etc.

Noemí is happy because she receives a lot of support from the Manuela Ramos loans, which help her keep moving forward, staying active in her business and supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Noemí pertenece al banco comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Loreto N° 251, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años, es madre de 1 hijo menor de edad y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en una pequeña bodega en su domicilio.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega. Se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y el de su esposo, luego atiende la bodega hasta las 8.00 p.m.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 paquetes de fideos, pollos, pescados, leche, conservas, etc.

Noemí está contenta, recibe bastante apoyo de los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, porque la ayudan a salir adelante, a mantenerse activa en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (sugar, rice, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula is a member if the communal bank Loreto, located in the Jr. Victor Montalvo, No. 792, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Paula is 43 years old and has 5 children. With the first S/. 300.00 loan she received from Manuela Rios she invested in the sale of whole grains. Currently she continues to sell grains with the help of her husband. For this reason she has to constantly go to her farm to check on her crop and bring the corn that will be sold.

The S/1,300 loan, that she will pay back in 5 months, will be used to sow more corn and purchase sacks to store grains. She will save the remainder of the loan for any eventuality that may arise.

Paula posses an enviable vitality. She doesn't stop working even though she is tired. He children support her and she states that all of her sacrifices are for their benefit. Her greatest satisfaction will be to see them become educated professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Paula pertenece al banco comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Victor Montalvo N° 792, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Paula tiene 43 años y es madre de 5 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela de S/. 300.00 decide invertir en la compra y venta de granos. En la actualidad sigue con el negocio de venta de granos, para ello tiene que ir constantemente a su chacra y ver como está la cosecha y traer el maíz para poder venderlos, su esposo trabaja junto con ella. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,300 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la siembra de maíz, comprará sacos para poder almacenar y otra parte del prestamo lo guardará para cualquier necesidad que se le presente. Paula tiene una vitalidad envidiable porque aún cansada no deja de seguir trabajando, sus hijos la apoyan y manifiesta que todo el sacrificio que realiza es por ellos, que quiere verlos profesionales, eso será su mayor satisfacción.

loans.use: To invest in corn crops

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
The committee of women called “Working Women” is from Villa Elisa. They began with the work of Maria Ofelia G., who invited her women friends and neighbors to come together. Now they work with Fundación Paraguaya to better their businesses.

All of the women work hard in their respective businesses, whether it be selling clothes, food, or goods for the house. They understand that their children are all depending on them to bring in sufficient incomes so that they all can eat. The women all have the goal of keeping their children in school until they have graduated college.

The loan that they are asking for today will be used to buy more goods for their different businesses.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy items to sell including new and used clothing, fruits, yerba, cleaning supplies and fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Mrs. Sandra S. is a member of the “Las Perlas de Pucallpa” communal bank, located on Jr. Santa Rosa N° 181, Calleria district, in the Ucayali department. Sandra is a 48-year-old mother of two. She decided to invest the first loan of S/ 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase and sale of sports uniforms.

She still owns that sports uniform business, which she operates from the office of the Sports Institute, especially for karate practitioners.

With this loan of S/ 1,700 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase more uniforms for different types of sports.

Sandra is planning on setting up a sports uniform store, and she is very grateful for the support that she receives from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sandra pertenece al banco comunal Las Perlas de Pucallpa, ubicado en el Jr. Santa Rosa N° 181, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Sandra tiene 48 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la compra y venta de ropa deportiva al por menor.

En la actualidad continúa con el negocio de venta de ropa deportiva, la cual ofrece en las oficinas del Instituto del Deporte, especialmente para los karatecas.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,700 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en comprar más ropa deportiva de diferentes disciplinas deportivas.

Sandra piensa poner una tienda de venta de ropa deportiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of sports uniforms

loans.name: Redžiba

texts.en:
Redžiba is a 54-year-old woman, She is married and she lives in Gradišće, near the town of Zenica. Her housband is a pensioner and his monthly pension is 390KM (~ $300 USD). She has four sons from 22-37 years old.

Redžiba wants to buy a cow and a chicken in order to expand her business. Redžiba hopes that she will manage to improve the living standards of her family with this loan in the amount of 600KM.

loans.use: Buying a cow and a chicken.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married with two sons, ages 13 and 4. His elderly mother also lives with him and his family in Simferopol, Southern Ukraine.

Andrei owns a rapidly growing business selling the “Dr. Nona” brand of natural cosmetics and food supplements in the central city market. He has been in business for three years and has proven to be a very sharp business owner. In those three years, his business has expanded a lot. Presently, Andrei has about $3000 in merchandise. His monthly income is about $550. There is not much competition for Andrei’s products, because they are unique and characterized by very high quality.

Andrei has requested a loan of $500 to help him purchase additional merchandise for retail sale. He would like to use the additional financial assistance to grow his business even further. Andrei loves what he is doing, and is looking forward to the future. He is grateful for the opportunity this business has given to provide for his business and sustain his family of five. We believe Andrei’s natural liveliness and optimism, along with his responsibility and serious business approach, will help him make his dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia F. is a 58 year old mother of three.  She runs a clothing business, which she began with the help of her husband sixteen years ago.  She now sells all sorts of clothing goods in the city of Caaguazú, including shirts, blouses, pants, jeans and skirts.In order to keep up with the changing fashion styles, she must invest in the latest pants, blouses, underwear, bathing suits, among others.  Currently, Amelia travels to the neighboring countries of Brazil and Bolivia to explore and purchase cheaper clothing.

loans.use: To buy various clothing and cloth goods for her business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Mrs. Trinidad belongs to the communal bank “Bellavista”, located at Jr. Prolongacion Libertad #1202, in the district of Calleria in the Ucayali department. She is 52 years old, has 3 children and her husband is a motortaxi driver. With the first loan of S/. 300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, Trinidad decided to invest in her sewing workshop. Currently her shop has grown and the number of clients has increased due to the high quality of her work. Her children are now living on their own, and now Trinidad takes care of her house and her husband, and she dedicates her evenings to sewing. With the new loan of S/.1,500, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy cloth, buttons, scissors, thread, silk laces, etc . Despite her age, Trinidad says that she will continue to work as long as she has energy. She was able to pay for the education of her children (who are now professionals) thanks to her ability to sew, and she is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the support that they have offered her.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Prolongación Libertad N° 1202, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años, es madre de 3 hijos y su esposo es motocarrista, Trinidad con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un pequeño taller de costura. En la actualidad el taller de costura ha crecido, con el buen acabado de las prendas, sus clientas han aumentado. Sus hijos ya son independientes y sólo se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y al de su esposo y en las tardes a la costura. Con el préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, implementará el taller con la compra de telas, hilos, blondas, elásticos, botones, tijeras. Trinidad a pesar de su edad no deja de seguir trabajando, nos dice que tiene energías para rato. Con la habilidad que tiene para coser educó a sus hijos que ahora son todos unos profesionales y está muy agradecida al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy cloth, thread, buttons, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ruvejda

texts.en: Ruvejda was born in 1956 and she lives in a suburb of Zenica called Nemila. She is married and her husband has a full-time job. He can earn about 1000KM. They have additional incomes from selling pictures that Ruvejda paints. They have three children. By selling pictures, they can earn about 500KM monthly. Ruvejda wants to use this loan to buy material for painting in order to continue her hobby and earn some extra money.

loans.use: Buying material for painting.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Victoria C. is a member of the Loreto Communal Bank, located on Jr. Oscar R. Benavides N° 989, Calleria district, in the department of Ucayali. She is a 49-year-old mother of 8, and her husband is a teacher and mechanic. With the loan of S/ 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to set up a small shop that offers private phone booths where calls are paid when completed.

She still has this phone and internet shop. She wakes up at 6:00 a.m. to do her household chores, then focuses on her business activities. Upon closing her shop, she rests in order to have enough energy for the next day.

With the loan of S/. 3,000 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will expand her business by purchasing 2 phone booths and telephones. She will also improve her business space, and buy paint and a photocopier.

Victoria feels that she has maD. progress working with Manuela Ramos, which helps her financial status. She is at a stage in life where she feels good about herself.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Oscar R. Benavides N° 989, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 49 años, es madre D. 8 hijos y su esposo es profesor y mecánico. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300 deciD. invertir en un pequeño locutorio.

En la actualidad cuenta con un locutorio y cabinas D. Internet. Se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para hacer las tareas domésticas y luego se dedica a la atención D. sus negocios. Cuando cierra descansa para tener energías para el día siguiente.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, implementará el negocio con la compra D. 2 cabinas para locutorio y teléfonos. También hará modificaciones a su local y comprará pintura y una fotocopiadora.

Victoria trabajando con Manuela Ramos siente que esta progresando, es una ayuda para su economía y está en una etapa D. su vida que se siente muy bien consigo misma.

loans.use: Purchase of phone booths and telephones

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila K. is married with a grown daughter. They live in Simferopol, Crimea. Ludmila runs a small business in the local “Moskoltso” market selling hosiery and socks. Ludmila’s business is well-known in the neighborhood for low prices. She started her venture 8 years ago. Currently, her income is about $900 a month. She has about $6000 in inventory.

Ludmila is a well qualified sales manager. Her professional vending skills help her generate new ideas and products that make her business more profitable. Ludmila is consistently growing and developing as an entrepreneur. She is planning to use this loan to purchase seasonal clothing in bulk so she will have plenty to attract new customers. Ludmila is hoping to invest the profits she generates into the legalization of her land lot and the reconstruction of her house.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing in bulk for her hosiery and sock business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel S. is a single nineteen year old business man. He began his business by selling chocolates and other goodies as a traveling salesman. Now, he has expanded his merchandise and is selling backpacks and other school supplies.

Daniel’s big dream is to continue with his schooling while expanding his business into a small store. Someday he hopes to have a family, a business in a central location, and a good income. He will invest the requested loan in school supplies to sell.

loans.use: To buy backpacks, notebooks, brushes, and paints.

loans.name: Vahida

texts.en: Vahida is 60-year-old women from Nemila, a small suburb of Zenica. She is married and she and her husband receive a pension of 400KM. Vahida knits and that is the way she can earn some extra money. She enjoys in it and she wants to use this loan in the amount of 1000KM for buying wool in order to spend her time in a better way.

loans.use: Buying wool.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is a widow with a grown daughter named Irina. She lives in the town of Mikhailovka and sells groceries and household items in a little store. One of the biggest advantages of her business is its uniqueness as the only retail store in the neighborhood. Nadezhda has been in this trade for 12 years. Her business has proven to be very stable over these past years. Currently, Nadezhda’s gross income is about $3000 a month.

Nadezhda has always believed that family is her first and utmost priority in life. Her business has been a consistent source of support, not only for herself, but for her daughter’s family as well. At this time, Nadezhda is seeking a loan of $500 to increase her working capital and help grow her sales rates. She is hoping to use a portion of the profits she generates to help her daughter with the construction of a private house. We believe Nadezhda’s persistence and determination will help her repay this loan and succeed in her business.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married with two children – a 16-year-old daughter and an 8-year-old son. Their family of four lives in the city of Drogobych, Western Ukraine. Olena sells men’s outer wear in the local market in Drogobych. She started this venture ten years ago. Currently, her gross income is about $1600 a month. Her monthly net profit is about $300. Olena has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine.

Olena has requested a loan of $1000 for one main purpose. She’d like to use it as working capital to buy necessary inventory and develop her business. With her history thus far as an entrepreneur, it will be exciting to watch how her business will grow and prosper in the future.

loans.use: To restock inventory for men's clothing store.

loans.name: Dragica

texts.en: Dragica is from Nova Bila, a suburb of the town of Travnik. She is 58 years old and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job and he can earn 200 KM monthly. They have two children, 35 and 32 years old. She wants to use this loan of 1000 KM to buy a sewing machine and expand the business. She hopes that she will increase her monthly income.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena lives in the town of Mikhailovka with her grown daughter, Angela. She has had a small retail business for about eight years and is in the process of expanding it. Yelena sells a variety of clothing and Ukrainian style rubber galoshes in the local market. By offering a range of clothing items, she provides a convenient stop for her customers who often will buy more than just one item from her. Her normal monthly profit is about $800.

Yelena has requested a loan of $1200 to increase her working capital and help sustain her business. Purchasing inventory from wholesalers has required a substantial investment from Yelena which is why she decided to obtain a loan. This loan will give her added flexibility and will help cover some of her growing expenses while she develops a larger business. Additional profits generated by her business will provide her with stable income and the ability to support her family financially.

loans.use: To sustain her clothing and shoe business

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira was born in 1947 and she is married. Her husband is a pensioner and his monthly pension is 250 KM. They have 2 children, 31 and 37 years old. She works as a translator (German-Croatia). She wants to buy computer with this loan in the amount of 1000KM to help her to do her work more profesionally.

loans.use: To buy a computer for her translating business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with one child. She lives in Zaporozhye and works in the local city market called “Angolenko”. Yelena owns a small business selling household items, kitchen supplies, electric appliances, plastic dishes and other small items. Yelena has been in this business for six years. She has been expanding her trade during those years. Currently, Yelena has two vending locations and is hoping to expand her business even more in the future. Yelena has about $3000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $300.

Yelena has requested a loan of $800 that will allow her to continue developing her business. It will help her open a new vending facility and purchase necessary supplies for her day-to-day business operations. Financial assistance will give her additional capital so that she can further promote her work and increase her business knowledge.

loans.use: To open a new household item store

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: Sallay T. is 45 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns a stall in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Before the previous loan from SMT, she sold peppers and rice.  With the loans, she diversified her business.  Married to a subsistence farmer, Sallay contributed some money from her business profit for the purchase of seeds and paid laborers to assist with the farming activities.  She is requesting for an additional loan of $350 to expand her business.

loans.use: Sallay needs to expand her business further to meet growing customer demand.  Her loan would enable her to buy extra stock, like rice and peppers, to sell.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: Mabinty is 45 years old.  She sells local food (rice and Fufu with cassava leaves, peanut soup, fish etc) within her household and has many customers.  Before the loans from SMT, she used to sell rice and pepper on a very small scale.  With the loans, she changed her business to running a restaurant.  She is able to purchase the ingredients on wholesale from the villages and has thus increased her profit.  She is requesting for another loan, of $350, to expand the business.

loans.use: Mabinty needs to purchase additional ingredients for preparing meals at her restaurant.  This loan will help her to increase her productivity and increase her profits.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is a 37 year old petty trader.  She sells food items in the market of Makeni town in Sierra Leone. The previous loan increased her stock and profit.  Fatmata said she can now save small amounts of money every month for future business diversification. She is requesting a loan of $350 to increase her stock and income.  Fatmata is married with 4 children.

loans.use: Fatmata needs to increase her stock of food items for selling and the Kiva loan would allow her the opportunity to do so.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is 35 years old and married with 2 children.  She sells tie dyed materials, which she makes herself.  She started the business with only 4 yards of white cotton material.  With her previous loan, she increased her stock to 450 yards and could produce 130 suits.  Her income also increased.  Her plan is to sell her products wholesale, and therefore she would like a loan of $350 to increase her production

loans.use: Salamatu is experiencing great success with her business and needs additional capital to continue to attract new customers and meet the demand.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en: Binta sells childrens clothes, shoes, lotions, and gels.  Due to a lack of space in the market, she established her business outside the veranda of her friend’s grocery shop but finds it difficult to remain during the rainy season.  With the previous loans, Binta diversified the business, and now, she would like to find appropriate shelter for rent in the market town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to increase her stock for more profit, which will enable her to earn enough profits to rent a place for running the business.  Binta is 38 years old and married with 3 children.

loans.use: Binta needs to increase her stock so that her profits will be large enough to enable her to rent space for her business.
